loans.name: Zeynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou est une femme mariée qui gère un cyber café .Elle propose à ses clients des services de traitement de texte, de reprographie et de connexion internet.Elle sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter un ordinateur et une photocopieuse.Cela lui permettra d'améliorer ses services et d'augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux prendre en charge ses propres besoins.
texts.en: Zeynabou is a married woman who runs an internet café. She offers her customers services such as word processing, photocopying and internet connection, and has requested a loan of 300,000 Francs to buy a computer and a photocopier. This will allow her to improve her services and increase her income, so that she can better provide for herself.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a photocopier.

loans.name: Bokk Diome De Gawane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement "Bokk diome de gawane" se compose de cinq femmes mariées.Elles exercent toutes un commerce de produits ménagers et cosmétiques.Elles achètent en gros et se partagent les marchandises en fonction de l'apport de chacune d'elles. La vente de ces marchandises leur permet de subvenir à leurs propres besoins et à ceux de leurs familles respectives.Le chef du groupe ( devant, doigt pointé avec le sourire sur la photo), est mère de quatre enfants.Elle place des produits cosmétiques à domicile et à crédit.Elle récupère son argent un mois après.
Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000 f pour acheter du lait de beauté, des des parfums.
texts.en:
The "Bokk diome de gawane" group has five members, all of whom are married women. They all work selling household products and cosmetics, and buy their merchandise wholesale before dividing it out based on the contribution made by each of them. 

The sale of these goods allows the women to provide for themselves and their respective families. The head of the group (pictured to the front with her hand raised and smiling in the photo) is a mother to four children. She sells her cosmetic products from home and on a credit basis, and collects the money one month later.

In order to increase their working capital, the group has requested a loan of 500,000 francs to buy beauty lotions and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy beauty lotions and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs associated with his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Dufatanye Duterimbere / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Félix fait partie du groupe Dufatanye Duterimbere / RSZ . Le nom du groupe signifie «Soutenons nous pour le développement».Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 12 à 24 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Félix est cultivateur de riz. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre se activités agricole. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur du riz dans la vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Félix is part of the Dufatanye Duterimbere / RSZ group, the name of which means “supporting each other for development”. He is 45 years of age, married, and has six children aged between 12 and 24. Five of his children are at school, and he himself studied six years of elementary school.

Félix works growing rice, and this is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the labor expenses associated with his rice-growing business. To expand his business, he plans to request other loans to increase his agricultural activities. Over the coming years, he would like to become the best rice grower in the valley. Félix plans to use his profits to educate and provide for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay the labor expenses associated with his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gemma hopes to be successful in her business and dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 62, resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Letecia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Letecia hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Turuhuke/ Isngn Group

texts.fr:
Victoire fait partie du groupe Turuhuke/Isngn. Il a 56 ans et il est marié, avec 5 enfants de 6 ans à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Il a une autre personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Victoire est agriculteur. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autres crédits pour augmenter la capacité de son agriculture et d’utiliser des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Victoire voudrait être un meilleur agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants .
texts.en:
Victoire is part of the Turuhuke/Isngn group. He is 56 years of age, married, and has five children aged between 6 and 16, four of whom are at school. He also has another person under his care in addition to his children, and he studied six years of elementary school education.

Victoire is a farmer, and this is his second loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor expenses. To expand his business, he plans to request other loans to increase capacity and use improved seeds. Over the coming years, Victoire would like to be a better farmer within his region, and he plans to use his profits to cover his children’s schooling and medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. She previously accessed a 28,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy an additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nancy dreams of being able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and business needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Violeta hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business.

loans.name: Ntiwigunge/rbmb Group

texts.fr:
Amissa est le membre et le président du groupe Ntiwigunge / Rbmb. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres ».Elle a 35 ans et elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 10 ans  à 15 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Amissa est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB et elle dit que le crédit soldé a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz et elle n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement de crédit. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, elle planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être l’agricultrice professionnelle dans la région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amissa is a member and president of the Ntiwigunge/Rbmb group, the name of which means “the members”. She is 35 years of age, married, and has three children aged from 10 to 15, all of whom are at school. She herself studied three years of high school.

Amissa works growing rice, and this is her second loan cycle with ACB. She says that the loan she has repaid helped her rice business, and she had no difficulties in making repayments. She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs associated with her business.

To expand her rice growing, Amissa plans to request further loans to increase her rice business capacity. Over the coming years, she would like to become her region’s professional farmer, and she hopes to the use the profits to pay for her children’s schooling and medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is 46 years old and a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a carpenter, and has children. Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating her business. She works hard to continuously provide income for their everyday expenses.

Blesilda operates a resale business. She buys pillowcases, curtains, bed sheets, shorts and other dry goods and resells them to the community using her cart. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales, daily.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more products (in quantity and variety), to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Blesilda dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education. She hopes to give her family a good future through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy curtains, bed sheets, pillowcases and other dry goods needed in her business.

Jasmine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jasmine hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

texts.en:
This is Annalisa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Annalisa hopes her business will grow in the coming years, and she dreams of giving her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 that meet weekly. The groups study the word of God, build social capital, and encourage the repayment of micro-finance loans.
