loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
This is Elvis. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Elvis hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
This is Flordeliza, 50, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Flordeliza maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, undergarments, cosmetics, soaps and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. She also sells peanut butter. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Flordeliza hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy orders for her customers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
This is Isabel. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 31,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Isabel hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Akouavi Omolayo (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est une veuve. Akouavi Omolayo est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, et à sa charge. Akouavi Omolayo vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses diverses charges. Akouavi Omolayo a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de dix neuf ans que Akouavi Omolayo mène comme activité la vente des tissus et des chaussures à son domicile. Akouavi Omolayo mène cette activité afin de pouvoir à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Akouavi Omolayo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Akouavi Omolayo sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe MAHUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Mahugnon is a group of three people, all of whom live in the same area. The group’s representative is called Akouavi Omolayo (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is a 46-year-old widow. She has four children, all of whom are at school and under her care. 

Akouavi Omolayo lives alone with her children, and is solely responsible for covering the various household expenses. She stopped attending school at secondary level, and for almost 19 years has worked selling fabrics and shoes from home. She runs this business so that she can provide for herself and her children. 

Akouavi Omolayo gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, she has requested her first loan along with the members of the Mahugnon group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ needs, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa y dos de sus tres hijos. Quienes viven de manera independiente, en la casa que compró hace 13 años. Desde hace 31 años elabora faldas típicas de su región que se llaman faldas plisadas y las faldas de mil rayas. Su confección lo realiza en su propio taller que acondicionó en su casa, junto a su esposa y uno de sus familiares  trabajan en su mismo taller, cuando hay más pedidos contrata los servicios de 2 personas más, que llevan este trabajo a sus mismas casas con el fin de ahorrar la energía eléctrica. Disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque desde su niñez le enseñaron y le ha permitido disfrutar de agradables momentos  con su familia, por los años de experiencia  en este trabajo ya tiene clientes fijos que siempre solicitan  estas faldas además que siempre adquieren nuevos clientes a recomendación del buen trabajo que realiza. Ahora desea mejorar su taller e equiparlo para poder cubrir los pedidos a otras ciudades.
Él pertenece al grupo solidario “los puntuales del ovalo” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde le agrada saber que es parte de un grupo de personas a las que considera como parte de su familia y puede aprender mucho de ellas. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Raúl; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas de diversos colores y texturas en cantidad, para seguir con sus bordados.
texts.en:
Raúl is 54 years of age, and lives with his wife and two of his three children. They live independently in a house they bought 13 years ago. For the past 31 years Raúl has made traditional skirts from his region, which are called “faldas plisadas” [pleated skirts] and “faldas de mil rayas” [skirts with a thousand stripes]. He runs his own workshop which he set up at home, along with his wife and one of his family members, who work in the shop with him. 

When there are more orders, Raúl hires a further two people, who take the work to their own homes in order to save on electricity. He enjoys his job because he was taught to do it from a young age, and it allows him to spend enjoyable time with his family. His years of experience in this area mean that he has regular customers, who always come to buy these skirts. He also obtains new customers by word of mouth, due to the good work he does. He would like to improve his workshop, equipping it so that he can cover orders from other cities.

Raúl belongs to a loan group called “Los Puntuales del Ovalo”, and this is their seventh loan with MFP. He is happy to know that he forms part of a group of people he considers part of the family, and he can learn a lot from them. He therefore promises to pay his loan installments on time. Raúl plans to invest the money he has requested in the purchase of fabrics of different colors and textures. He will buy large quantities of these so that he can continue with his embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics of different colors.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 37 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo Diego en la casa de sus suegros desde hace 4 años.  
Desde hace 8 años ofrece su servicio de construcción, siempre está pendiente de ofrecer sus servicios y concretarlo en contratos de varios meses hasta concluir el acuerdo de construcción de las diversas edificaciones que le encomiendan, desde casas hasta obras publicas de su localidad, dispone de sus propias herramientas de trabajo que le permiten ofrecer un servicio de calidad y  lo conocen en su comunidad como un maestro de obra. Ahora desea comenzar con la construcción de su propia casa que es uno de sus grandes anhelos, ya comenzó comprando un pequeño terreno. Su experiencia y las buenas referencias de su trabajo son las mejores garantías para ofrecer su servicio y ha visto a lo largo de los años el fruto de su esfuerzo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “puntuales del ovalo” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde ha visto unidad en su grupo y siente que puede tener confianza con los demás integrantes, pues son responsables como él y pagarán sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Javier; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una cortadora de cerámica para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Javier is 37 years of age, and lives with his wife and son Diego in the house of his parents-in-law, where they have lived for four years.

Eight years ago he started his construction business, and is always careful to offer his services and arrange contracts for various months until he has completed the construction agreements for the various buildings entrusted to him. These include houses and public buildings in his town. He has his own work tools, and this allows him to offer a quality service. Javier is known in his local area as a building master. 

Javier would now like to build his own house, which is one of his greatest ambitions. He has already started by buying a small plot of land. His experience and good work references are the best guarantee for his service, and over the years he has seen all his hard work pay off. 

Javier is part of a solidarity group called “Puntuales del Ovalo”, and this is their fifth loan with MFP. He has seen lots of unity in his group, and feels that he trusts the other members, as they are responsible like him and pay their loan installments on time. Javier plans to invest the money he has requested in buying a tile cutter, which he will use to continue with his business.

loans.use: To buy a tile cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair products and another hairdryer.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 39 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su madre hace 20 años. Las mañanas de Delia son muy agitadas ya que tiene que llevar a sus 8 vacas a alimentarse sin antes haber extraído la leche que venderá muy temprano a una empresa procesadora de leche en tarro, cuenta que al día vende un promedio de 15 litros, ya tiene 15 años dedicados al campo. Su secreto es trabajar en conjunto la tierra, por lo que comparte su tiempo con el cultivo de pasto y maíz, los cuales siembra en terrenos propios y alquilados, espera muy pronto poder comprar más terrenos y así no tener que alquilar ni uno. Ahora espera con mucha ansiedad la época de cosecha para poder obtener ganancias y seguir con la siembra, pues esa actividad es la única que realza durante su tiempo. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Delia, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el dinero para la compra de un nuevo terreno agrícola, que le servirá para sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Delia is 39 year of age, and leads a simple life. She lives with her husband and five children, and she looks after them in the house she inherited from her mother 20 years ago. 

Delia’s mornings are hectic, as she has to take her eight cows for feeding before milking them, and then selling the milk very early to a company that processes milk in bottles. Each day she sells an average of 15 liters, and she has worked in this area for 15 years. Her secret is that she works in harmony with the land, and shares her time between growing pasture and corn. She sows these crops on her own land and rented land, and hopes to soon be able to buy more land and not have to rent any.

Delia is now awaiting harvest time anxiously, so that she can obtain income and continue sowing crops, as this is the only business she has. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the help she has received, as it has allowed her to continue investing in moving her business forward. She also promises to make her repayments on time. She plans to invest the money by adding it to her savings to buy another plot of agricultural land, which will allow her to sow more.

loans.use: To buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry de 22 años de edad, tiene un taller automotriz junto a un socio, el  cual está ubicado en la ciudad de Bogotá, lugar donde habita y realiza las tareas de arreglo de motores y sus accesorios, diagnósticos de fallas e  instalación de accesorios.  Desde sus 15 años de edad, su padre le enseñó las tareas derivadas del servicio de  mecánica automotriz y poco a poco ha conseguido emprender una ventura de negocios,  tener una clientela  fija y fiel, lograda mediante referidos de empresas de automóviles; su horario de trabajo se extiende desde  las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche; el servicio automotriz lo  ofrece de contado y a crédito a clientes muy conocidos, que forman parte de su haber de compradores. Henry planea independizarse en un taller propio y está capacitándose para ello en el área de mecánica automotriz, para actualizarse en este tema;  su mayo desafío es no contar con herramientas y capital de trabajo para lograrlo y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una grúa para subir motores, una pistola metálica y un compresor. Su meta es lograr mas adelante tener su propio taller y mejorar los servicios de mantenimiento y reparación de vehículos automotores y por eso se prepara día a día para conseguirla.
texts.en:
Henry is 22 years of age, and owns a car workshop with a partner. The shop is located in the city of Bogotá where he lives, and is where he carries out his engine and accessory repair business, as well as assessing breakdowns and installing accessories. 

Henry’s father began to teach him the tasks related to car mechanic services when he was 15, and little by little he has undertaken his own business venture. He now has regular, loyal customers, which he has obtained through referrals from car companies. He works from 8:30 am until 7 pm, and he offers his services on a cash and credit basis to customers who he knows well, and who are part of his purchaser network. 

Henry would like to become more independent and have his own workshop, and is undertaking car mechanic training so that he can be up-to-date with the latest developments in the industry. His greatest challenge is the lack of tools and working capital to make this move, and this is why he has requested a Kiva loan. This is the first financing he has applied for from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy a crane to lift engines, a metal spray gun and a compressor. Henry’s goal is to have his own workshop in the future, and to improve his car repair and maintenance services. To do so, he is constantly preparing himself on a day-to-day basis.

loans.use: To buy a crane to lift engines, a metal spray gun and a compressor.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her tailoring business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Maribel is requesting another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of the raw materials she needs in her business. The profits from her loan will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. Maribel looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maribel hopes to grow her business and she dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 28 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Nilo, con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 3 años.  

Junto a su esposo, desde hace 8 años comenzó a dedicar su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura, actividad que desarrollaron desde niña. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, olluco y alverja, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues la cosecha lo comercializa en la ciudad de Lima, donde los compradores son muy exigentes con la calidad de los alimentos al momento de la compra. Sus terrenos se ubican en la zona alta del pueblo, por lo que tiene que caminar horas para poder llegar. Ahora espera juntar el dinero necesario para poder comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pues cuentan con algunos propios, pero como tienen que sembrar en cantidad también alquilan otros, “ya no quiero invertir el dinero para beneficio de terceras personas, por eso compraré unos propios”, comenta. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Nancy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de semilla de alverja y fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
28-year-old Nancy is a hard-working woman who lives together with her husband, Nilo.  The couple have three children who they care for in a house that they bought three years ago.

Eight years ago, Nancy and her husband started putting their time and efforts into farming, an activity Nancy has been working in since she was a girl.  Her main crops are potatoes, olluco (a native tuber) and peas.  She puts a lot of care into her work as she sells her harvests in the city of Lima where buyers are very demanding as regards the quality of the food they buy.  Nancy's lands are located in the high part of the village which means that she has to walk for hours in order to reach them.  She hopes to be able to put together the money she needs to buy her own farmland.  She currently has some land of her own but, as she has to grow her crops in large quantities, she also rents additional land.  "I no longer want to invest my money to benefit other people and, for this reason, I will buy some land of my own", she says.  This is Nancy's fourth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the support they have given her because it means she is able to continue investing in the progress of her business.  She pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

Nancy will invest her money in buying pea seeds and also natural fertilizers which she will spread over her crops.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, tiene 43 años de edad, soltero, vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. El decidió hace 10 años en tener su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios como ser: refrescos, golosinas, pan, arroz, frijoles, harina, azúcar, manteca, lácteos, etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y quiere mantenerlo siempre surtido de los productos que demandan sus clientes. El préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar refrescos, churros, golosinas, pan, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, manteca, harina, etc. esta inversión le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su objetivo es mantener el negocio siempre surtido de todo tipo de productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Alberto is 43 years of age, single, and lives in the town of Puerto Cortes. He decided to set up his own business 10 years ago, and sells food products such as soft drinks, sweets, bread, rice, beans, flour, sugar, lard, dairy products, and so on. This business is his source of income, and he wants to make sure that it is constantly supplied with the products his customers request. 

Alberto has asked for a loan of 21,000 Honduran Lempiras, which he will use to buy soft drinks, churros, sweets, bread, sugar, beans, lard, flour, and other products. This will allow him to increase his sales and income, and his goal is to have his business constantly supplied with all kinds of products for sale.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, beans, soft drinks, flour, bread, churros, etc. to supply his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her general store. Her earnings were a big help in providing for her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Gloria is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and on hand, the better. Increasing her inventory will result in better profit which will help her to sustain her daily needs. Gloria looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gloria dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and products

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso, de 63 años, vive en compañía de 2 de sus 4 hijos: Stefany y Jonatan. Alos que quiere mucho y cuida en la casa que compró hace muchos años. Enviudó hace 4 años, desde entonces tiene que luchar por sus hijos, cuidar de ellos y representar el papel de madre. Es un poco difícil comenta, pero en todo este tiempo logró ganarse la confianza de ellos, quienes lo aprecian mucho. Desde hace 20 años, abrió un taller en su propia casa, donde realiza todo tipo de máquinas panificadoras, como batidoras, cortadoras, hornos para hacer panes y demás. En todo este logró obtener buenos clientes, además de perfeccionar su capacidad en la construcción, tiene muchas máquinas todas ellas le ayudan en su trabajo. Los meses de diciembre tiene mucho trabajo, es en ese mes donde contrata personal, ya que no solo se dedica a la fabricación de las máquinas, también realiza mantenimiento, reparación y perfeccionamiento. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio y poder contratar a un profesional que pueda sustituirlo, ya que no tiene las mismas fuerzas de antes. Pero como es un hombre responsable, comenta que siempre supervisará el negocio que tanto lo apasiona. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy satisfecha de poder, desarrollar sus actividades con normalidad, pues tiene el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete cargar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que siempre fue una persona trabajadora y honrada.
Celso, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales como planchas de aluminio, pernos y demás insumos para la construcción de sus máquinas panificadoras.
texts.en:
63-year-old Celso lives with two of his four children: Stefany and Jonatan.  He loves them dearly and cares for them in a house that he bought many years ago.  Celso has been a widower for four years and, over those years, he has had to work hard for his children, take care of them and take over their mother's role.  He says that it is a little difficult but he has managed to gain their confidence and they are very fond of him.

Twenty years ago, Celso opened a workshop in his own home where he makes all kinds of bread-making machinery such as mixers, cutters, bread ovens, etc.  He has managed to gain good customers and perfect his construction abilities.  He has a lot of machines that help him in his work.  He has a lot of work in the month of December and so he hires staff during that month as he doesn't just make machines but also maintains, repairs and improves them.  He would like to improve his business and be able to hire a professional to replace him because he doesn't have the strength he once had.  However, as he is a responsible man, he says that he will always oversee the business that he loves so much.

This is Celso's third loan from MFP and he feels very happy that he is able to carry out his work as normal thanks to the support that you all give him.  He pledges to make his loan repayments on time as he has always been a hard-working, respectable person.  Celso will invest the money he has requested in buying materials such as aluminum sheets, bolts and other supplies that he uses to make his bread-making machinery.

loans.use: to buy aluminum sheets and bolts

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 30 años de edad y se dedica a ofrecer servicios de consultoría en software y hardware;  desde muy joven le gustó aprender el desarrollo de programas de computación, mantenimiento y reparación de equipos de informática. Juan Carlos estudió física como complemento a su actividad y ha logrado enfocarse en un mercado conformado por empresas, personas independientes y muchos referidos. Él tiene 12 años de experiencia y es  la fortaleza mas importante de su empresa, emprendida desde hace 8 años. Su sueño es expandir la infraestructura de negocios, para mas adelante obtener su casa propia  y especializarse en física que es su mayor sueño, pero su mayor desafío es lograr tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para invertir y avanzar en su proyecto empresarial que es su proyecto de vida. En la actualidad se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará dos computadores, con las que planea ampliar su infraestructura física e incrementar los servicios de consultoría entre su extensa y potencial clientela, a la que está dispuesto a conquistar cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 30 years of age, and works offering software and hardware consultancy services. From an early age he enjoyed learning about software development and IT equipment maintenance and repair. He studied physics, and to improve his business he has managed to focus on a market comprised of businesses, individuals and a large number of referrals. 

Juan Carlos has 12 years of experience, and this is the main strength of his business, which he started up eight years ago. His dream is to expand his business infrastructure, so that in the future he can have his own house and specialize in physics, which is his biggest dream. 

Juan Carlos’ greatest challenge is obtaining enough working capital so that he can invest and move forward with his business project, which is a life-long project. He has applied for a Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and this is his first financing from the organization. He plans to use the loan to buy two computers, which he will use to increase his physical infrastructure. This will also enable him to expand his consultancy services among his extensive current and potential customer base, as he plans to win even more jobs from them.

loans.use: To buy two computers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 54, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pablito and mother to her children. Together with her husband, Teresita manages her own household while operating a variety store. She works hard to continually provide for her family's everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a food stall and her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and continue operating. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Teresita hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products for her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Irene, ahora tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   producción y venta  de leche. Irene necesita producir más leche para cubrir su demanda, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar 2 vacas lecheras.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Irene pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member, Irene, is now 31 years old.  She is married, has two children, and lives in Tambo Real district, in Anta province.  She continues producing and selling milk.  Irene needs to produce more milk in order to meet demand and so she will invest the loan she has requested in buying two dairy cows.

This member is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to make progress in her business and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Irene belongs to the 'San Bartolo de Tambo Real' community bank which is located in Tambo Real district, in Anta province, in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantity and variety of items and products for her grocery. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Mercedita is requesting another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in her store, the better. Mercedita's business profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mercedita hopes to be able to expand her business and she also hopes to have her own car service for her business. She dreams of growing her business in the coming years. Mercedita faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products for her store

loans.name: Jesukpego 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO 7 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont aucun n’est plus à leur charge. Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d’année environs que Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana mène comme activité la vente des tissus, des chaussures, des ustensiles de cuisine et des articles de parfumerie dans un quartier du Bénin. Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 7 sollicitent ensemble un  premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Jesukpego 7 group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels. 

Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana is 39 years of age, and is married to Sylvain. The couple has three children, all of whom are at school but none of whom are dependent on them. Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana lives with her children and husband, and she and her husband make sure that the various household expenses are covered. 

Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana went to school until secondary level, and about 10 years ago started her business selling fabrics, shoe, kitchen utensils, and perfume in a Benin neighborhood. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin and in Togo. Customer demand is growing, and given her limited means, she can no longer meet their requests. Due to this, and because of her lack of resources, Ablawa Bénédicta Tatiana and the other members of the Jesukpego 7 group have requested their first joint loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
Evarista de 51 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su hijos Maycol al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Su valentía es admirable, cuidó sola de sus 3 hijos, 2 de ellos ya realizaron su vida, tiene familia y siempre velan por la tranquilidad de su madre. Sigue al cuidado de su hijo al que quiere mucho, por ello todos los días de lunes a viernes trabaja en una mina, por la zona alta de al ciudad, ahí extrae oro, plata y cobre. Recibe buen sueldo por ello, esto le permite cubrir sus gastos, cuenta que muchas veces lava los residuos botados de la mina y extrae pequeñas pepas de oro y plata que comercializa a las joyerías de la ciudad, obteniendo de esa manera un dinero extra. Pero como no siempre tiene este ingreso, comenzó con un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ovejas y granos, los cuales vende a la capital del país los fines de semana cuando descanso de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chilca” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Evarista; invertirá el dinero solicitado en al compra de ovejas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
51-year old Evarista is a responsible woman who lives her son Maycol whom she looks after in her own home located in the Chilca neighbourhood. Her courage is admirable; alone she brought up three children, two of whom have already left home and have children of their own. They watch out for their mother and make sure she has peace of mind. Evaristo continues to care for one son whom she loves very much.

Every day from Monday to Friday she works in a mine in the high part of the city. The mine produces gold, silver, and copper. She earns good money for her work which allows her to cover household expenses. Often times she washes the waste from the mine and extracts tiny bits of gold and silver which she sells to the jewellers in town to earn extra money. However, as she doesn’t always have money from this activity she started a small business buying and selling sheep and grain which she sells in the capital city at weekends when she is off work. 
Evarista belongs to the Chilca Group and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very grateful for this financial support since it helps her with her business. She promises to repay the money according to the schedule. She is also pleased to be part of her group as all the members are responsible and committed.

She will use the money to buy sheep and improve her business.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase a variety of groceries and products needed in her general store. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for providing for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Estelita is requesting another 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at her store the better, as this will result in better profit. Estelita's profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estelita hopes to be able to expand her business and she dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products to sell in her store

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny, de 36 años es una joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que cuida en la casa de sus padres, donde vive desde que nació. Su única responsabilidad es mantener a sus padres tranquilos. Por ello trabaja sin descanso en la compra y venta de ovejas pequeñas, que es su especialidad. Su trabajo consiste en viajar a la altura donde crían los animales, para comprar a los ganaderos por cantidad, ella misma los traslada a la ciudad donde los comercializa a las diferentes ferias del valle. Le va muy bien en su trabajo por ello se siente realizada, ya que desde muy joven comenzó este trabajo cada año obtiene mejores clientes y por ende mejores ganancias. Los meses que tiene más ingresos son desde marzo a septiembre, que los pobladores se alistan para la época festiva en conmemoración de los animales. Ahora desea consolidarse en su negocio. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chilca” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Marleny invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas para su negocio.
texts.en:
36-year old Marleny is a responsible young woman. She lives with her parents and siblings whom she looks after in her parents’ house. She has lived there since she was born. Her only responsibility is to keep her parents well cared-for. So she works without days off buying and selling lambs which are her specialty. 

She travels into the high country where the animals are raised to buy from the farmers there. Then she transports them to the town where she sells them at various markets in the valley. All is going well with the work so Marleny feels content since she started doing this as a young woman. Every year she gets more customers and therefore earns more money. She earns the most in the months of March to September when the local people get ready for the festive season commemorating their animals.

Now Marleny wishes to put her business on a stronger footing. She belongs to the Chilca Group and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very grateful for this financial support since it helps her with her business. She promises to repay the money according to the schedule. She is also pleased to be part of her group as all the members are responsible and committed.

Marleny will use the money to buy sheep for her business.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used buy products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for providing for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Lilibeth is requesting another 17,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. Lilibeth looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilibeth dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and products for her food stall

loans.name: Akuemevo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKUEMEVO est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léocadie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Léocadie est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Mesmin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léocadie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Léocadie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Léocadie assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Léocadie mène comme activité la vente des savons, des charbons de bois et du maïs dans son quartier. Léocadie exerce cette activité depuis dix sept ans. Léocadie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léocadie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKUEMEVO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The AKUEMEVO group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. Léocadie (the woman who is raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative. Léocadie is 40 years old and married to a man named Mesmin. The couple has three children, all of whom live in their care and have received schooling. Léocadie stopped her studies at the primary school level. She lives with her children and husband. She covers the various household needs together with her husband.

In order to cover her various expenses, Léocadie sells soap, charcoal, and corn in her neighborhood. She has been running this business for 17 years now. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and revenue, Léocadie, along with the other members of the  AKUEMEVO group, is seeking a loan from ALIDé. She will use the loan to increase her stock of products and grow her customer base.

loans.use: to buy soap, charcoal, and corn

loans.name: Dieu-Beni Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU-BENI est formé de quatre personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, Chantal, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 33 ans. Chantal est mariée à un certain Augustin et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Chantal a très peu fréquenté l'école. Chantal vend des conserves et des céréales à son domicile. Il y a environs neuf ans que Chantal exerce cette activité. Chantal s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Chantal ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Chantal sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU-BENI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Dieu-Beni group has four members, who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative is 33-year-old Chantal, who is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is married to Augustin and has three children, all of whom are at school and under her care. 

Chantal did not attend school for very long, and now works selling canned goods and cereals from home. She has had this business for approximately nine years, and she gets her supplies at a market in Benin. To increase her business levels, Chantal would like to have a greater level of stock to sell, as this will allow her to meet customer demand. To do so, she and the other members of the Dieu-Beni group have requested a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy canned goods and cereals.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She previously accessed a 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion hopes her business grows in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Doralina

texts.es: Doña Doralina tiene 52 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposo y una hija en la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro. La señora tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la confección de ropa de uso domestico y de vestir como ser: cortinas, sabanas, forros para muebles, cojines, y reparación de prendas de vestir. El taller lo tiene en su casa donde le dedica el tiempo necesario. Esta actividad la ha mantenido estable mediante préstamos, con ODEF lleva 10 ciclos de préstamos. Este que solicita actualmente lo utilizara en la compra de Telas, hilos, encajes, agujas y otros materiales que necesita para la confección de las prendas. Espera establecer mejor su negocio y obtener mayor utilidad. Su plan es tener una estabilidad familiar y establecer un taller más fuerte de confección.
texts.en:
Doralina is 52 years of age, married, and has four children. She lives with her husband and one daughter in the city of Olanchito, located in Yoro. She has worked for 15 years making fabric items and clothing, such as curtains, sheets, furniture covers, cushions, and clothing repairs. She has her workshop at home, where she works as much as necessary. 

Doralina has kept her business stable by using loans, and she has had 10 loan cycles with ODEF. This current loan will be used to buy fabrics, thread, needles and other materials that she needs to prepare her items. She hopes to have a more stable business, and make more use of it, and her plan is to have family stability and have a larger workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, needles, lace and other materials to make sheets, covers for furniture, curtains and cushions, and to make clothing repairs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson, de 24 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Angélica y su hija Isabela, pero muy pronto tendrán la llegada de un integrante más de la familia, pues su esposa está embarazada. Como una familia ellos viven en una casa alquilada desde hace 4 años. La zona donde habita posee una tierra muy fina e ideal para la elaboración de ladrillos, durante 4 años comenzó a emplear esa tierra para la elaboración de ladrillos, los cuales labra con mucho esmero, pues de su trabajo depende el ingreso económico de su hogar. Comenta que la fábrica lo comparte con su cuñado, pues tiene una sociedad y trabajan juntos. “Mi principal ingreso económico se centra en vender los millares de ladrillos a empresa y gobernaciones, de esa forma obtengo más ganancias y puedo vender mayor cantidad”, comenta. Es así que aprovecha la temporada de verano y sobre todo que la fabrica se ubica al costado de su vivienda, “de esa manera puedo vigilar el secado de los ladrillos”, afirma. En todo este tiempo tuvo mucha competencia, por lo que la arena del lugar terminará dentro de unos años más, es así que quiere comenzar con la crianza de vacas y intensificar su crianza cuando deje de fabricar ladrillos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Wilson, invertirá el dinero en la compra de aserrín y leña para continuar con la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 24 year old working man who lives with his wife Angélica and their daughter Isabela, but very soon they will have another member in the family as his wife is pregnant.  As a family, they have lived in a rented home for the past four years.  The area they live in is ideal for making bricks, and during the past four years, he has used the land for brick-making, in which he labors with great care since his household income depends on his work. 
He shares the factory with his brother-in-law since they have a business together.  

He says that his main income comes from selling thousands of bricks to business and government entities, which increases his earnings since he can sell larger quantities.  He can also take advantage of the summer as well as the fact that the factory is located next to his house, to monitor the drying of the bricks.  During this time, he has had a lot of competition which will lead to a shortage of sand with in the next few years.  Due to this, he wants to start raising cows, and intensify that effort once he stops making bricks.  

This is his second loan with MFP, to whom he is very grateful of for their support which has allowed him to continue to invest in the growth of his business.  Furthermore, he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Wilson will invest this money in the purchase of a saw and lumber to continue with his brick-making.

loans.use: to purchase a saw and lumber

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to buy additional stock of toys and other products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 11,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of toys and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilou dreams of growing her business and hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of toy products needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia previously received a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she used to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Delia is requesting another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better profits, which will help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes to have her own house and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
This is Melita, who is 46 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ody, a company driver, and a mother to their children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Melita hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 23 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa heredada de sus padres. Se dedica  a la venta de animales como vacas ovejas y caballos desde hace 5 años, en la actualidad este negocio le sirve para generarse ingresos que son necesarios para su reciente familia. Su trabajo consiste en comprar al por mayor los animales, los cuales revende en el mismo lugar de la feria ganadera, para esto sale a comprar en horas de la madrugada  a los propietarios de los animales y garantizarse un buen margen de ganancias, adicionalmente a esto  tiene unos terrenos de cultivo en la zona alta de su localidad, ahí tiene maíz, papa y demás tubérculos, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues es rentable en su medio y tiene planes de seguir creciendo en capital y extensión de terrenos. Ella pertenece al grupo “ajo pata” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido porque considera que este préstamo es un apoyo para mejorar su negocio y promete ser puntual en sus pagos.
Jhony, invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos, además de ganado si es que le alcanza el dinero.
texts.en:
Jhony is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house he inherited from his parents. He has been selling animals, such as cows, sheep and horses for five years. Currently this business generates the income to support his recently established family. His work consists of buying animals wholesale, which he sells in the same place at the cattle market. Therefore he leaves at dawn to make his purchases from the animal owners and to guarantee he makes a good profit margin.  

In addition to this business, he also has land under cultivation in the higher areas of the town. There he has corn, potatoes and other tubers, which he tends very carefully since it is profitable in this environment and he plans to continue growing both his capital and by expanding his land holdings.

He belongs to the “Ajo Pata” Communal Bank and this is his third loan from MFP. He is grateful because he feels this loan will  help him to improve his business and he promises to be punctual in his payments. 

Jhony will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizer for his fields and if he has enough,  he will also buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
This is Noel, 47, a resident of Manila, Philippines. His wife is Eva, the mother of his children. 

He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Noel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Noel hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

loans.use: To buy cloth and fabrics needed in her business.

texts.en:
Maricel is 42 years old and a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers floor mats and rugs. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms are available year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Maricel earns a minimum of 500 PHP a day. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

To help her continue operations of her business, Maricel is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will be using to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other items. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maricel faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
This is Editha, 47, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, a worker, and is the mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Editha maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Editha hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Saraswati" group is named after the goddesses of education. All four members of this group are women from a remote village called Kurebhana and belong to the Below Poverty Line category. Kurebhana is located in the district of Bolangir; one of the poorest districts of Odisha India. 

Mina is one of the members of this group who has raised her hand in the photo. She is 23 years old and lives with her husband, a four-year-old son, and a nine-year-old daughter. Her daughter is going to the local school. Mina and her husband are doing multifarious businesses of milk, salt and vegetable cultivation. Her husband looks after salt and vegetable cultivation leaving the milk business to Mina. 

She has three cows giving 12 liters of milk. From the milk business Mina is getting 2,000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month by selling the milk in bulk to a milk processing unit of her village. Her husband earns 2,000 INR per month from the salt business and vegetable cultivation, which is insufficient to maintain her family. Mina has planned to utilize the loan for purchasing another cow and remodeling her cow shed. Mina has a focused dream to provide better education to her children. 

The other three members Sindhusuta, Tula and Urmila also have milk businesses.

loans.use: to buy a cow and remodel a cow shed

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 54 years old, married, and has children.  She is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. Her husband is a vinyl installer. Araceli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Araceli earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Araceli is requesting a loan for10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and boost her business income. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Araceli hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny, de 30 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Fredy con quien tiene 2 hijos: Lisbeth y Frank a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas que se ubican en la zona alta de su localidad, ahí tiene diversos sembríos de papa, maíz y demás tubérculos, pues es propicia la zona para la maduración de esa clase. Desde que nació dedicó su vida a la agricultura, por lo que tiene conocimiento de la buena producción de los alimentos, como fertilizar, cuidar, regar y quitar la maleza que crece entre los terrenos. Los días viernes baja a la feria de la zona, donde puede comprar los diversos alimentos que consumirá durante los demás días, además que aprovecha para comercializar algunos productos, como también vender los ganados que cría como ovejas. Ella pertenece al grupo “ajo pata” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido porque considera que este préstamo es un apoyo para mejorar su negocio y promete ser puntual en sus pagos. 
Jenny, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza podrá comprar un poco de ganado.
texts.en: Jenny is a 30 year old modest woman. She lives with her husband, Fredy. They have two children, Lisbeth and Frank who they take care of in their house bought 10 years ago. Every morning, she makes her way towards the farm lands located in the high zone near her community. She has diverse crops of potatoes, corn and other tubers there. This area is favorable for the development of these crops. Since she was born, she has dedicated her life to farming. She has knowledge of growing foods well like fertilizing them, caring for them and removing the weeds that grow between the plots. On Fridays, She goes to the market in the area where she can buy different foods that she will consume during the other days. In addition, she can take advantage of the opportunity to sell some products. She also sells livestock that she raises like sheep. She belongs to the “ajo pata” group and this is her third loan with MFP. She is grateful because she considers this loan to be a support that helps her improve her business. She promises to be punctual with her payments. Jenny will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers in order to start sowing fields and if there is enough money, she will purchase some livestock.

loans.use: purchase natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Nolambay

texts.en:

She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nolambay operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nolambay hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 60, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Teresita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Cristina vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es casada, propietaria de un tramo en un mercado de Managua desde hace 27 años su principal actividad es la venta de vigoron comida típica de Nicaragua, doña Rosa Cristina  nos explica la elaboración del vigoron  el chicharon se hace de el cuero del cerdo, se sofríe en la misma manteca que trae el cuero, la yuca se pone a coser hasta estar suave, y el toque final es la elaboración de ensaladas de repollo, tomate, vinagre, zanahoria.
  
Este delicioso platillo se sirve en bandeja elaborada  de bambú,  o en hoja  de chagüite 
Cabe mencionar que las  bandejas son elaboradas por artesanos  en la ciudad de Masaya.


La señora Rosa cristina empieza su jornada de trabajo desde las 8:00 de la mañana la venta de vigoron es por las mañana ya que a las 12 del mediodía ya ha terminado su venta de vigoron es por esta razón que también oferta bisutería a sus cliente. Así siempre esta ofertando lo típico de nuestro país.

Agradece a CEPRODEL  por que con el financiamiento otorgado ha podido mantener su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Cristina lives in the city of Managua in Nicaragua. She is married and she has a section in the Managua market. For her past 27 years her main occupation has been the sale of vigoron – a typical Nicaraguan dish. Doña Rosa tells us about the production of vigaron – the chicharon is made from pigskin, it is fried in the same fat as the skin, the yuca is cooked until it is soft and the it is finished off with a cabbage, tomato, vinegar and carrot salad.

This delicious dish is served on a bamboo plate or a banana leaf.
It is worth mentioning that the plates are handmade in the city of Masaya.

Señora Cristina begins her working day at 8.00 in the morning. She sells vigoron in the mornings, as by midday she has already finished up with the vigoron sales and for this reason she also sells jewelry to her customers. Therefore, the products that she sells are always traditional of our country.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL, because with the financing she has managed to maintain her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase yuca, chicharon, cabbage, carrot, jewelry and pieces made from wood, wire and stone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Florissa

texts.en:
This is Florissa, a 36-year-old resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Marlon and is a mother to her children. She and husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Florissa oversees operations of their jeepney* transportation business. She has one 14-16 person capacity jeepney, which has a paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florissa dreams to be successful in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partnersclients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 29 años y  nació en Buga, una ciudad pequeña y cercana al lugar al cual tuvo que trasladarse  para realizar sus estudios de economía en la Universidad Pública del Valle. Gracias a su dedicación y buen desempeño, fue apoyada por la universidad para cubrir los costos de su matrícula, al igual que fue merecedora de ayudas otorgadas por la institución a personas con dificultades económicas y con buen desempeño académico. Estos apoyos le permitieron culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios de pregrado. 

El traslado a esta nueva ciudad fue todo un reto, no solo por lo que significaba encontrarse con un mundo diferente y desconocido, sino también por la necesidad de afrontar condiciones asociadas a una difícil situación económica por la que pasaba su familia en ese momento; con su madre desempleada y su padre fallecido se vio en la necesidad de combinar sus estudios diurnos con diferentes trabajos que le permitieran formarse como profesional. 

Ahora, Karina tiene el sueño de realizar una Maestría en el Reino Unido para lo cual ha venido preparándose desde que culmino sus estudios de pregrado y la única forma para pagar los exámenes y gastos de aplicación es recibiendo el apoyo de Kiva.

Aquí está su historia:
