Her husband is a farmer who cultivates their farmland by planting rice and some vegetables to sell. They aim to earn and save more income to build their own house and provide for the schooling of their children. She plans to raise more piglets for sale but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 17,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that, through this loan, she can be able to make an improvement in the business and hopes that someday she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is 33-year-old married man, father of one child. He has worked as a blacksmith for twelve years. Husein is a hard worker and a family loving person. Husein has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to help his brother to pay his university fees. 

Husein feels responsible for his family members, and insists in providing them with the education that he didn't get. Husein is an expert in his field, and recommended by most of his loyal customers.

He hopes to keep on improving and developing his business, to provide a good and healthy living to his family and the best education ever.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's university fees.

loans.name: Zulaina's Group

texts.en:
Zulaina's Group includes seven hardworking women. Zulaina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Zulaina has been working hard to manage her small business of selling maize. 

To help expand her business, Zulaina has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize to sell and will help Zulaina to generate greater profits. This will help her parents pay the school fees for her younger siblings. 

Zulaina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 36-year-old, married woman from Tiribe, Kenya.  She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in school.  Josephine works hard in her clothing sales business, which she has had for seven years.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Josephine is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to improve her business.  Specifically, she will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes and use a third of the money to pay school fees for her children. Josephine says that the loan will be very helpful in contributing to the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell and pay school fees

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo  con su anterior credikiva compró víveres en mayor volumen  y los vendió en el peso y la medida que solicitaron sus clientes. A él con esta inversión le fue bien, porque rotó su capital de trabajó aumentó el volumen de sus ventas y ganó por compras con descuentos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará  productos de aseo, productos como arroz, aceite, refrescos, con ello prestará en su negocio cada vez más un mejor servicio a sus clientes y además comprando en mayor cantidad ganará descuentos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente. “Doy muchas gracias por ayudarme a sacare adelante mi negocio para mejorar mis condiciones de vida y que Dios los Bendiga. “
texts.en:
Rodrigo used his previous Kiva loan to buy foodstuffs in greater volume and sold them by the pound or in the amounts his customers needed.  He did well with this investment because he rotated his working capital and increased sales volume; he also came out ahead because he was able to get volume buying discounts.

He’s now applying for a new Kiva loan that he’ll use to buy cleaning supplies, rice, oil and soft-drinks.  By doing so, he will once again provide better customer service and by buying in larger amounts will qualify for discounts.  

His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you very much for helping me to move my business forward to improve my living conditions.  May God bless you.”

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, rice, oil and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Doña Tomasa tiene 68 años de edad, soltera por viudez, tiene 7 hijos y vive en el Progreso, Yoro junto a un hijo y dos nietos.
Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace año y medio estableció bien su negocio de pulpería donde vende azúcar, arroz, frijoles, dulces, churros, condimentos, refrescos, manteca, abarrotes etc. es una señora muy trabajadora de su negocio ayuda a sus hijos y nietos. Este negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante préstamos, con ODEF lleva 11 ciclos de préstamos. El préstamo actual que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y con este va surtir mas la pulpería de productos que le hace falta y con otra parte quiere terminar de pagar un pequeño terreno que adquirió. Su meta inmediata es terminar de pagar el terreno y mantener su negocio surtido de donde espera obtener los ingresos que sostienen su hogar.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 68, is single due to widowhood; she has seven children and she lives in El Progreso, Yoro with a son and two grandchildren.

She’s always been a merchant and a year and a half ago she started her own grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, lard, groceries, etc.  She’s a very hardworking woman and helps her children and grandchildren by means of her business.  She has kept the business stable thanks to loans; she’s been with ODEF for 11 loan cycles.

The current loan request is for 21000 Lempiras that she will use to better stock her grocery store with the products she needs and will also use part of it to finish paying for a small piece of land she bought.  Her immediate goal is to pay off the lot and to keep her store stocked so that she can earn income to support her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Arida Clemencia

texts.es:
Arida tiene 52 años es madre soltera pero sus hijos son mayores de edad. La descendencia de Árida se dedicaban a la venta de comida tradicional y ella quiso seguir con la tradición ya que piensa que es un negocio muy bueno. En la actualidad es vendedora de ceviches -es un plato consistente en carne marinada en aliños cítricos, siendo los más comunes preparados a base de pescado, mariscos o ambos. Ahora su horario es todos los días desde la mañana con la ayuda de un hijo y otra persona. 
El tipo de negocio es la venta de ceviche (venta de plato tipico del Ecuador) y con el préstamo va a comprar insumos como pescado, cevollas, etc.Una de las dificultades puede ser la delincuencia ya que esta por todos lados.El sueño de Árida es seguir trabajando para vivir mejor piensa en ayudar a sus hijos para que no se decaigan y sigan progresando
texts.en:
Arida, 52, is a single mother but her children are all adults.  Arida’s ancestors worked selling traditional meals and she wanted to continue the tradition since she believes it’s a very good business.  She currently sells ceviche, a dish consisting of meat marinated in citrus juices.  The most common ones are made from fish, seafood or both.  Her work schedule now is every day starting in the morning; her son and another person help her.

The type of business is ceviche sales (sale of an Ecuadorean traditional dish) and she will use the loan to buy ingredients like fish, onions, etc.  One of the difficulties is crime because it’s everywhere.  Arida’s dream is to continue working in order to live better.  She intends to help her children so that they will not become discouraged and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy fish, onions, etc.

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is a 52 year old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jacinta who is also a farmer. They are blessed with a five year old child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family. 

Mburu is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mburu will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and water pipes for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and watering pipes.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 25 year old Lebanese man. He’s single, living with his only one parent. He is the one responsible for managing the family’s household expenses. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to gain a higher income. He has been working as a plumber and also installing solar systems, upon requests, seven years ago. He’s an honest man and, above all, punctual. This is what make his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added plumbing tools in addition to many solar system related items for his business. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. This is how Abbas works to collect higher revenues to be able to offer his only parent a respectable way of living.

loans.use: to purchase added plumbing tools in addition to many solar system related items.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Emilia  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Emilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man. He has only one child. He has a mini-market that serves the neighborhood he lives in, and now he wants to expand by adding more goods and products to the store. For this purpose, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to expand by adding more goods and products

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 25, married, and has two infant children. She and her husband aim to become financially stable, to build their own house, and to give their children a bright future. Arlyn works in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of PHP 9,000 when she sells two heads on a live-weight basis.

Arlyn plans to acquire more piglets to raise, but she has inadequate capital to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 38,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will enable her to carry out her plan and she hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en: Froilan is a father who is involved in hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is 38 years old and has five school-age children. Due to hardship of living, he aimed to strengthen the business to earn sufficient income for their daily consumption and the allowances of their children in school. To improve the business, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP 17,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. Despite problems and calamities he encountered in life, he has a strong determination to improve the business, for he believes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Akpabal Group

texts.fr: Groupe de solidarité à caractère masculin, l’Association AKPABAL est localisée dans la région centrale du Togo et a pour président N’Tanki. N’Tanki est cultivateur de profession et est mariée à une ménagère. Il a quatre enfants scolarisés sur six où le premier est âgé de 32 ans et le dernier de 25 ans. N’Tanki est âgé de  53 ans et exerce comme activité la culture du maïs destinée à la vente. Il exerce cette activité depuis les années 1970 toujours dans la région centrale et se fait aider par 03 membres de sa famille et 05 employés. N’Tanki vient de découvrir WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit destiné à l’achat des outils de travail. Pour l’avenir, il espère augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire une nouvelle maison. Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs et espèrent aussi augmenter leurs superficies cultivables.
texts.en:
AKPABAL is an all-men solidarity group located in Togo’s central region. The group’s president is N’Tanki, a 53-year-old farmer who is married to a homemaker. They have six children aged 25 to 32, four of whom have received schooling. 

N’Tanki grows maize for sale. He has been practicing this activity in the central region since the 70s, and he has three family members and five employees to help him. 

Having recently heard of WAGES, N'Tanki is seeking his first loan to purchase farming equipment. In the long term, he plans to expand his cultivable area and build a new house. 

The other group members are also maize farmers who aim to expand their cultivable land.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Cosme, el ahora tiene 37 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, Cosme continua con su actividad económica principal que es el servicio de taxi en la ruta de anta - cusco, pero tambien se dedica a la venta de leche de forma paralela. El socio Cosme trabaja hace muchos años en esta actividad y es con esta que saca adelante a toda su familia.
Cosme necesita dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, por ello invertirá su préstamo en la reparación del mismo, para ello debe comprar repuestos y accesorios como llantas nuevas, y tambien necesita comprar leche para cumplir con sus clientes y con su demanda. 
Cosme está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a mantenerse y desarrollarse en sus actividades y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Cosme pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolome de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Cosme quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
Cosme is now 37 years old, he is married with 2 children. He lives in the Tambo Real district of the Anta Province. 

Cosme still works in his primary job which is a taxi route traveling between Anta to Cusco, but he also sells milk in bulk. The member has worked in this field for many years, and because of it he and his family have excelled. 

Cosme needs to maintain his vehicle. He will invest the money from the loan in repair costs. To repair it he needs to buy spare parts and accessories, such as new wheels. He also needs to purchase milk in bulk to be able to satisfy his clients. 

Cosme is very grateful for Kiva's help in maintaining and developing his business. 

He promises to complete payments as scheduled. 

Cosme belongs to the communal bank "San Bartolome de Tambo Real" of the Tambo Real district in the Anta province, in Cusco, Peru. 

Cosme wants to give a better life and education to his children. It is because of them that he sacrifices himself, hopes to work hard, and save so he can invest in their education

loans.use: to maintain his car and to buy milk in bulk.

loans.name: Urbanización 31 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URBANIZACIÓN 31 DE ENERO”  iniciará el ciclo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria                                                        es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de arena, artesanía, artesanía en guantes y chullus, tejido de chompas, carnicería, venta de charque, artesanía en sombreros, artesanía en polainas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carne; cuanta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente el primer préstamo que hizo en nuestra institución y en la actualidad le está yendo muy bien.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de herramienta (compra de congeladora) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de el alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Urbanización 31 de Enero” communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by María, President.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: sand sales, crafts, knit glove and cap making, sweater knitting, butcher shop, dried meat sales, hat and legging making.

They will take out the loan to benefit their micro businesses.  María is a member and she indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a cycle ago having been invited to join by one of the institution’s  program’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a butcher shop that she says she started with her first loan she got from the institution and is currently doing very well.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her work tools; she will buy a freezer in the local street market in El Alto to then install in her shop.  This way of working allows her to have the resources to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
La Señora Joaquina tiene 46 años es soltera, y está acompañado con el Sr. Celso, con quien es muy feliz. Ella es dueña de una pequeña despensa bien surtid, en la que muy sacrificadamente trabaja todos los días.
Tiene su pequeño negocio desde hace 7 años y gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha lo ido creciendo. Cuenta también que su marido siempre la ayuda en todo lo que puede y de esa forma van creciendo.
Joaquina pide el crédito para la compra de leche, pan, carnes, bebidas y demás productos para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en: Joaquina, 46, is single but lives with her spouse, Celso; she’s very happy with him.  She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store where she works very hard every day.  She’s had her small business for 7 years and thanks to her work and sacrifice it’s been growing.  She also relates that her husband always helps her in everything he can and they are growing this way.  Joaquina requests the loan to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages and other products needed to stock the store to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina de 60 años de edad es viuda; habita con sus dos hijos ya mayores, en su propia casa que compró junto con su difunto esposo. Agustina se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña tienda donde ofrece: verduras, arroz, azúcar, cereales, conservas, entre otros. Esta labor realiza hace 15 años y comenta que siempre le ido muy bien con sus ventas; hay días en que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en lo necesario. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede permanecer tranquila sin tener que hacer ningún esfuerzo; sin embargo su mayor  problema es la falta de productos y que la gran mayoría sus clientes lo requieren. 
Con el préstamo podrá comprar un poco de mercadería que le hace falta, ya que gracias a su negocio puede solventar con los gastos de educación para sus hijos. Este es su crédito número 01; se siente contenta por contar con este apoyo financiero, se compromete ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal. Con los 500 nuevos soles comprará un saco de arroz y algunas verduras, ya que son principales comestibles que requiere su clientela.
texts.en:
Agustina, 60, is a widow who lives with her two grown children in the house she bought with her husband. She is a merchant and owns a small store where she sells vegetables, rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, and other items. She started the business 15 years ago, and sales have always been good. Her children help out on days when she needs them. What she likes best about her business is that she feels it can continue without much strain on her. However, her biggest concern is not having the items most of her customers request.  

She will be able to buy some of the merchandise she needs with this loan. Her business income pays for her children's education. This is her first loan cycle, and she is happy to have financial support. She promises to make her payments on time and to remain in good standing with her group. With the 500 nuevos soles, she will buy a sack of rice and some vegetables, which are the main food items her customers need.

loans.use: to buy more essential items.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 60 years old and has five grown-up children. He is a farmer who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community. He also raises hogs to generate additional income. His aim is to give his family a better life. 

Domingo has been farming for almost 38 years and usually earns a profit of 20,000 PHP per harvest season. His earnings go toward the family's daily expenses and his children's school allowances. Through his patience, sacrifice, and hard work, most of Domingo's children have earned a degree and have a stable job. So now, Domingo wants to improve his hog-raising business so that he can put more money into savings. 

He is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins, and materials needed to improve the pigpen. He hopes that someday, he will make the business grow and viable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins, additional piglets, and pigpen materials.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 67-year-old fish vendor from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. Carolina has been in the fish vending business for more than ten years now.

Carolina needs financial support for her family's business. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for the repair of her family's fishing boat and to buy fuel for it. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch.

The revenue that they will earn will be used for family daily consumption, for reinvestment in their business, and for savings purposes.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her family's fishing boat and to buy fuel for it

loans.name: Katia Nancy

texts.es: La Sra. Katia tiene 36 años y es casada con 1 hijo que es de la edad de 5 años, su actividad es el Arte decorativo manual, tiene una tienda que se encuentra en la zona central donde expone la variedad de sus productos.  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la compra del material necesario para la fabricacion de su trabajo ya que tiene muchos pedidos por la buena calidad de su arte, la Sra. Katia es una persona muy trabajadora y muy habil.
texts.en: Katia, 36, is married and has one son who is five years old. She makes decorative crafts and has a store in the city center where she sells her various products. She is asking for the loan to purchase the material necessary to make her crafts since she has such a high demand for her crafts due to their high quality. Katia is very hard working and very effective.

loans.use: materials to make artisan crafts

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 29-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be a determined woman. She operates a general store where she sells shoes, clothes, beauty products etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to improve the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products,shoes and clothes for selling. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will she will buy land for her family. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM. The previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes,shoes and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Partrick

texts.en:
Partrick is 40 years old. He is married with one child. He operates a general store to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year. Previously, he used to sell music DVDs and tapes. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy bulb tapes, sockets and adapters.

loans.use: To buy bulb tapes, sockets and adapters.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es: Doña Martha,  comenzó su negocio de venta de tamales en el 2008, por recomendación de una vecina. Inició vendiendo 5 docenas de tamales de pedidos de algunos vecinos y a medida que conocian la calidad de los tamales, se incrementaban los pedidos. Hoy en día, la Sra. Martha vende 240 docenas de tamales por semana y y con el crédito solicitado piensa invertirlo para producir 360 docenas, pues poco a poco se ha dado a conocer por la calidad de sus alimentos asi como lo puntual en el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.  Ella se siente muy contenta por el desarrollo de su negocio. Martha junto con su esposo Juan tienen 3 hijos, 2 estudian en la preparatoria y 1 en la primaria, y el compromiso que tienen con ellos es darle una preparación en la vida y una carrera profesional a cada unos de ellos. La Sra.Martha es muy trabajadora siguiendo el ejemplo de su padre quien de muy joven a los 15 años dejo su lugar de nacimiento el estado de Zacatecas (Mexico) y emigro al Estado de Nuevo Leon (Monterrey)  para lograr un trabajo mas formal que le permitiera superarse, ese espiritu de trabajo lo inculco en sus hijos como la Sra. Martha que es muy emprenderora y mujer de mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha started selling tamales in 2008 as a result of encouragement from a neighbor.  She stared off selling five dozen tamales to order to some neighbors and as the quality of the tamales became better known orders have increased.  Today, Martha sells 240 dozen tamales weekly and intends to use the requested loan so that she can produce 360 dozen because she’s gradually become better known thanks to the quality of the food and the punctual way she meets her commitments.  She feels very happy with  her business’ development.

Martha and her husband, Juan, have three children; two attend high school and one is in elementary school.  The commitment they have with them is to prepare them well for life and to provide each one of them with professional careers.

Martha is very hardworking and follows her father’s example who at the age of 15 left his native Zacatecas (México) and moved to the state of Nuevo León (Monterrey) to look for stable employment that would make it possible for him to improve.  He inculcated that working spirit into his children like Martha who is very enterprising and a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 21-year-old single man. He opened an Internet cafe in September 2011, with 8 years of experience in this field. He also sells mobile phones, phone, accessories, and prepaid cards. Hassan is a hard worker. Before starting his own business, he used to work in a hotel, but ever-ambitious, he insisted on making his own business plans.

Hassan is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua so that he can open a shoe shop and finish paying off the computers. He wants to open the shoe shop as an additional business, to increase his income and improve his standard of living. This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower and he is very excited to take this step forward.

Hassan hopes to keep on starting new businesses, and to make a beautiful small family of his own.

loans.use: to open a shoe shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do music production and open a small studio.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a humble woman who lives in Tiribe. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a clothes selling business. She is located near the market where, little by little, she has gained clients' trust and affection. With this business, Chizi is able to sustain her extended family and she has high expectations for growing this business since she works hard every day. 

Today her main clients are neighbors and passer-by. However she wants to take more opportunities. Her investment plan consists of diversifying her merchandise to including more retail items, and adding more products requested by clients such as bundles of clothes for resale. This will improve her working conditions and amplify her product selection according to clients' demands. This is why she is requesting Kiva a loan to expand her business. She believes she can succeed due to the high demand, her strength in her performance, and work discipline. All of these qualities will help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes, rice, sugar and flour for sale

loans.name: Los Amigos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS AMIGOS está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Bertha  tiene 30 años, y un hijo que tiene la edad de un año,  La Sra. Bertha se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Bertha va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Bertha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Bertha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "The Friends" is made up of nine members, six women and three men. The president of the bank is Sra. Bertha. She is 30 years old and has a one year old son. Sra. Bertha sells cosmetics via catalog, and sells these products by walking around and visiting public and private homes and offices in Santa Cruz where she offers her products. 

This is her first loan with the institution, and Sra. Bertha is going to use the loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics and jewellry that is also on sale. In this way she will provide a variety of products to her clientele to increase her earnings. Her motivation for asking for the loan is to be able to continue improving her business and to be able to purchase more variety of products. 

Sra. Bertha is a hard working person and is happy for the opportunity that she's been offered, as some of her fellow group members are working hard to raise their families alone.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale jewellry and cosmetics

loans.name: Everardo

texts.es: Everardo de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la producción de café con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos atiende su parcela. También se emplea en trabajos temporales mientras empieza la cosecha de café. Tiene como siembra alterna unas parcelas con caña de azúcar que con la venta de la misma le ayudan de sostén hasta la cosecha del café. Su  meta como productor es comprar mas tierras para aumentar su siembra y con ello tener buena producción y para ello pide un crédito que le ayudara en la compra de fertilizantes para aumentar su producción y el pago de jornales que le ayudaran a mantener limpia su parcela para cuando llegue el momento de la cosecha, él sabe que si el crédito es bien empleado le dejara resultados satisfactorios y así podrá  cumplir con sus metas personales que son el apoyar  a sus hijos a que terminen una carrera universitaria y con ello  poder  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Everardo, 39, lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  He’s worked as a coffee grower for several years now; his wife and children help him care for his fields.  He also hires day laborers seasonally when the coffee harvest starts.  He also grows sugarcane the sale of which helps him support his household until the coffee is harvested.  

His goal as a grower is to buy more land to increase his crops to have good production and this is why he’s requesting the loan in order to be able to buy fertilizer to increase production and also to hire day laborers that will help him clear the field in preparation for harvest.  He knows that if the loan is put to good use results will be satisfactory and he will be able to reach his personal goal which is to support his children so that they will finish university careers and be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa es miembro del Grupo Todo lo Puedo En Cristo.

Rosa es cosmetóloga estudio en un CEO donde aprendió  corte de cabello y aplicación de tintes, también siguió algunos cursos de repostería donde aprendió a  preparar  todo tipo de  pasteles, en la actualidad tiene un negocio de venta de pasteles que ella misma prepara, este trabajo lo realiza los días de semana y los sábados y domingos  visita a sus clientas para realizar diferentes trabajos de cosmetología, en su mayoría tinturas de cabello que es lo más solicitado. Rosa es casada  y  tiene 3 hijos  que cursan estudios en la universidad.  Gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, en esta oportunidad  utilizara su préstamo para adquirir más tintes y el resto en insumos para la preparación de sus pasteles. El sueño de Rosa es tener un salón de belleza, en su casa ya tiene el ambiente propicio para ese propósito así que espera seguir con EDAPROSPO  para lograrlo muy pronto. Rosa les agradece su apoyo.

*Rosa viste polo negro y aparece en la foto cargando su niño.

* Al lado derecho de la foto aparece la Sra. Gudelia quien viste chompa color marrón y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
We would like to introduce Rosa, a member of Grupo Todo lo Puedo En Cristo.

Rosa is a cosmetologist who studied in a cosmetic school how to cut hair and apply hair dye.  She also pursued courses in baking where she learned to prepare all kinds of cakes.  She actually prepares and sells cakes as a business venture during the week.  On the weekends she visits her clients to work on a variety of cosmetic activities.  The majority of her work is in dyeing hair because it is most highly demanded.

Rosa is married and has three children who are studying in college.  Thanks to her work she has been able to help her children in their studies.  With this loan she will purchase more dye and materials for her cakes.  Rosa's dream is to have a beauty parlor.  The atmosphere in her home feels like a beauty parlor so she hopes to keep working with EDAPROSPO so she can soon realize her dream.

Rosa appreciates your support!

*In the photo Rosa appears wearing a black long-sleeve shirt carrying her child.

loans.use: to purchase dye.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 26-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Peninah says that she ventured into the shoe business after realizing that her husband's wages could not meet the basic needs of her family and has been in business for two years. Like all good mothers she has an ambition of educating her children up to the University. Her business normally gets to the peak during summer holidays and festive seasons such as Christmas and Easter days. Peninah intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es:
Moisés es de la ciudad de Concepción, es estudiante de Medicina del  primer año, vive con sus padres que son maestros. El nos cuenta que con mucho sacrificio sus papas han podido sacarle adelante y pagarles sus estudios ya que son muy caros.
Moisés nos cuenta que desea ser un gran medico y de esa forma poder ayudar a las personas por medio de sus conocimientos. También quiere poder ayudar a sus papas de la misma forma que ellos lo están haciendo con él, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de estudio, con lo cual podrá tener los materiales que necesita para poder seguir estudiando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Moisés is from the city of Concepción.  He’s a first year medical student living with his parents who are teachers.  He relates that his parents have been able to raise him with much sacrifice and pay for his studies which are very expensive.

Moisés relates that he very much wants to become a physician to help others by means of his knowledge.  He also wants to be able to support his parents the same way they are doing with him.  This is why he always exerts the maximum effort.

He’s requesting the loan to buy his study materials so that he will have what’s needed to continue studying and growing.

loans.use: to buy texts and study materials.

loans.name: Jaime Edmundo

texts.es: Jaime tiene 38 años , a el siempre le a gustado trabajar y sobre todo en el comercio y ventas por ello vio que la venta de plátano es un buen negocio en el lugar que vive. Decidió dedicarse a la venta de plátano.El tipo de negocio es la venta de plátano y maduro .Jaime es de estado civil Unión libre su mujer le ayuda con el negocio por la mañana,tiene una hija que esta en preescolar, ella va a una escuela fiscal. Tambien actualmente tiene la dicha que su esposa este embarazada. Una de las dificultades para su negocio son las enfermedades. Con el prestamo quiere comprar platanos para la venta a otros clientes. El sueño de Jaime es convertirse en el mas grande distribuidor de plátano ,mantener sus ingresos de las ventas y tener una mejor comodidad de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jaime, 38, has always liked to work above all in commerce and sales.  He recognized that banana sales where he lives is a good business.  He decided to work selling bananas.  The type of business is selling bananas and plantain.  

Jaime is in a common law relationship.  His wife helps him with the business in the morning.  They have a daughter who attends preschool in a public school.  He’s also happy because his wife is currently pregnant.  

One of the difficulties in his business is disease.  He wants to use this loan to buy bananas to sell to other customers.  Jaime’s dream is to become the greatest banana distributor, to maintain his sales and income and to attain better income comfort level.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Ligia Victoria

texts.es: Ligia esta casada empezo vendiendo Natural Garden de puerta a puerta de alli se compro una vitrina para vender en casa y cuando se entero que D-MIRO realiza credito decidio iniciar una pequeña tienda.Ligia esta casada su esposo trabaja como conserje en la Aviacion Civil y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. el tipo de negocio que tiene ya es una tienda variada con alimentos de primera necesidad ,con la ayuda de un hijo ,no tiene ninguna dificultad con el trabajo. Desea con el prestamo comprar arroz, azucar, enlatados, confites etc. El sueño de Ligia es incrementar el negocio de viveres de primera necesidad para mejorar sus ingressos
texts.en:
Ligia is married and started selling Natural Garden door to door. Then, she bought a showcase to sell at her home and when she knew that D-MIRO gives credit she decided to start a small store.

Ligia is married, her husband works as a janitor in Civil Aviation and she has two adult children. The type of business she has is a store with variety products such as staples. With the help of her son, she doesn't have any difficulty with work. 

With the loan she wants to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, candies, etc. Ligia's dream is to increase the business of staples to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, canned goods, and candies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a fish monger at Manpong near Abura. She buys fresh fish and smokes it to sell. Grace has been into this business for 3 years now. She is married  and has 4 childern.  Grace  uses her income to assist her husband to feed, clothe and pay their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase a large quantiy of fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profit Grace wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a very hardworking mother of two whom she struggles to provide for. They are the reason she started a business selling food, mostly fried potatoes. She says that it has been a profitable business since she has established a good clientele base. Halima says that her customers prefer her products because she adds some delicious flavours that make her fried potatoes more attractive. 

She has run this business for the last two years. She is requesting a loan so as to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of owning a cafe in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has a daughter who is six years old. He describes himself as bold and soft-spoken. He provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located within an accesible and friendly business environment, and his primary customers are local residents and  students from a nearby college. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel for the motorcycle. He plans to use his Kes 20,000 loan to buy household items for  starting a new business of a retail shop. His business goal is to buy a taxi to meet customer demand for transportation services within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his daughter .

loans.use: to buy household items for starting a new business of a retail store

loans.name: Hormiguitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS TRABAJADORAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lola                                                        es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chicharrones de cerdo, venta de dulces en kiosco, fabricación de monederos artesanales, venta de repuestos de autos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lola es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chicharron; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al ver algunas vecinas y en la actualidad es le es muy cómodo en el trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos) este producto lo adquirirá de los distribuidores y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización como un producto extra. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “HORMIGUITAS TRABAJADORAS” (The Hard-Worker Ants) Communal Bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Pan-American Regional Center. The group has 6 members under the direction of a governing board and headed by their President, Lola. The communal bank members run businesses that are varied in nature: pork rind sales, a kiosk selling sweets, manufacture of artisan purses and car part sales.

The loan that Lola's group is currently applying for will benefit these small business-owners. Lola says that it is the first time she has been involved with Pro Mujer, after she was invited to join by one of the institution's promoters who visited her home. Currently, Lola runs a business selling pork rinds. She says that she started this business after seeing her neighbors doing the same and now the work quite suits her.

This current loan will be used to increase her capital (to buy soft drinks), which she will buy from distributors and later sell in her business as an additional product. This type of work allows her to generate more money to support her family in whatever way they might need as she is a single mother with 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health support provided.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nora Belinda

texts.es: Doña Nora, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara con sus hijos y esposo. Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa y variedades. Hace 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella consiguió un local en la comunidad cercana de donde vive y vende pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa interior, juguetes y otros. Con el préstamo que solicita va surtir el negocio de ropa y variedades. Espera incrementar los ingresos y aumentar su clientela. Su sueño es hacer crecer el negocio y generar ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.
texts.en: Nora, 48, has two children; she lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara with her children and her husband.  She has her own clothing  and miscellany sales business.  She’s been in business 8 years.  She got a locale in the community near where she lives and sells pants, shirts, blouses, underwear, toys and others.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to stock up on clothes and miscellany.  She hopes to increase income and clientele.  Her dream is to make the business grow to generate income to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, underwear, toys and others to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de Concepcion, ella es estudiante de obstetricia de primer año, está casada con el Sr. Roberto quien trabaja en Desarrollo Agricola del Paraguay. Ella es una persona que desea salir adelante y es por ello que estudia, ya que desea seguir superándose.
El sueño de Laura es ser una buena doctora y de esa forma poder ayudar a traer vidas al mundo, es por ello que estudia obstetricia. Desea también poder ayudar a su marido por medio de su trabajo y es por todo esto que se esfuerza mucho.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos para poder seguir estudiando y rendir de muy buena forma en la universidad. Agradece a Kiva y a loa fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Laura is from Concepción and is a first year obstetrics student.  She’s married to Roberto who works in Paraguay agricultural development.  She is a person who very much wants to move forward which is why she studies; she wants to continue to improve herself.

Laura’s dream is to be a good physician and help to bring new lives into the world this way which is why she’s studying obstetrics.  She also wants to be able to help her husband through her work and this is why she strives so hard.

She’s asking for the loan to buy her school supplies to be able to continue studying and do well in university.  She thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: María Del Rocio

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad, soltera vive en casa propia con sus padres  siendo ellos los que hace ya varios años le enseñaron a cultivar y producir café actualmente cuenta con una pequeña papelería y una  parcela herencia de sus padres la cual a cuidado y con mucho esfuerzo y empeño a logrado mantener y aumentar su producción pero necesita sembrar plantas nuevas para poder seguir produciendo ya que sus planas ya están viejas y ya no producen mucho, para comprar plantas y poder resembrar una parte de su parcela María pide un préstamo para la compra de planta para resiembra y para el pago de jornaleros que le ayuden a sembrar sus plantas ella sabe que resembrando en unos años aumentara su producción y con ello lograra tener una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, single and lives in her own home with her parents, who in the last years taught her how to cultivate and produce coffee. Currently, she has a small stationery and a plot she inherited from her parents. She took care of the plot with effort and commitment to maintain and increase the production. However, she needs to grow new plants to continue producing, because her plants are old and don't produce much.

In order to buy plants and to sow a part of her plot, María is requesting a loan to buy plants to sow and to pay laborers who will help her to grow the plants. She knows that sowing will increase production in the next years, and thereby she will achieve a better quality.

loans.use: to buy plants for sowing her farm thereby increasing production

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio es estudiante de Medicina, vive en Concepción, y cuenta que desde niño su sueño fue ser doctor y gracias a estos estudios se esta cumpliendo su meta.
Quiere poder ayudar a las personas, y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza mucho para ser el mejor en lo que hace. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar sus materiales de estudios, ya que quiere poder aligerar la carga a sus padres, que ya lo han ayudado mucho.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo pues de esta forma aliviana la carga a sus padres y el  puede sentirse útil también.
texts.en:
Silvio is studying medicine and lives in Concepción. He tells us that ever since he was a boy his dream was to be a doctor, and thanks to these studies he is reaching his goal.

He wants to be able to help people, and this is why he always makes an effort to be the best at what he does. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy his study materials, since he wants to be able to relieve his parents of the burden as they have already helped him a lot.

He is grateful for the opportunity that he's receiving because he'll be able to relieve his parents of the burden and he can feel useful also.

loans.use: to buy study materials for university.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is a 39-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after his wife and four children rests solely on him. For 20 years he has been rearing cows. After they have fully grown, he sells them off. His business is challenged by prolonged drought and theft. Nevertheless, he has dreams of setting up a modern ranch. Because he is a good father, he wishes to educate his children and set up sustainable income generating activities. Friday intends to use this loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Lihe

texts.en:
Lihe is 36 years old and married with four children: the oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 10 months old. She and her family live in the northwest rural part of the country where most of the residents including her are involved in the livestock industry. She has been selling milk and baby calves to the locals for the past eight years, and she says that the profit has been ok, yet not enough to cover extra expenses. With the birth of the baby girl, her daily trips to local market to sell the milk have been presenting a challenge to her because she has to find neighbors to look after the baby until she comes back at no cost.

Anyways, now that the winter is kicking in soon in her region, Lihe feels she should build a stable so that her animals won’t be challenged by the tough weather. This is the reason why she is requesting this loan this time (this is not her first one, it is the fourth, and the previous ones have been repaid).
Lihe appreciates the opportunity she has been given to publish her loan information on Kiva in order to get some financial help through lenders.

loans.use: To build an animal stable

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Intisar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Intisar is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan, who supports seven family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for children's and women's clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. In the future she would like to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to resell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra de 36 años, vive en su propia casa que compró junto con su pareja, Marino de 37 años; en ella habita con sus 03 queridos hijos quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente. Alejandra se dedica a labrar la tierra donde cultiva plantas cacao y café, productos que logró trabajarlos  con mucha entrega para volverlos muy productivas. Esta labor lo realiza durante 8 años en su propia parcela y hoy es toda una conocedora que se ejerce en el campo agrícola. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de productos ella necesariamente tiene que contratar peones para apresurar su trabajo.
Con  el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono ya que con ellos sus plantas lucirán más saludables. Mas adelante para el bien de su economía comprará nuevas tierras  y seguirá cultivando con el mismo empeño que la caracteriza. Este es su crédito número 02; por la cual se siente muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de abono para la fertilización de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 36 years old and lives in the home that she bought with her partner, 37 year old Marino. They have 3 precious children who inspire Alejandra to continue working hard on the land where she grows cocoa and coffee crops. She has managed to grow very productive plants although it took great devotion on her part to achieve this. She has been working this plot for 8 years and these days she is considered to be quite knowledgeable about farming. During the harvest and crop transportation periods, she has to contract day workers as a matter of necessity in order to speed up the work.
With this loan that she is currently applying for, she will buy various sacks of fertilizer to make her crops look more healthy. Furthermore, to advance her work, she will also buy new land and she will continue growing crops with the same dedication which characterizes her. This is her second loan, and she feels happy to know that she has some financial support as she will feel more secure buying what she needs. She is committed to meeting her repayment schedule in a punctual manner.
She will use the NS1,000 to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto de 41 años de edad, convive con Vilma y fruto de ellos, tienen 03 hijos en edad escolar; viven en su propia casa, construido a base de material rustico que compraron hace 10 años de convivencia. Alberto asegura que el producto de raíces de barbasco se ha convertido en los últimos años en un gran negocio, no solo para él, sino para el resto de los agricultores, desde luego que está sacando el máximo provecho a sus plantaciones. En épocas de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros, con la finalidad de obtener mayor rendimiento en su trabajo laboral. Esta actividad lo realiza hace 15 años y siempre le a gustado hacer su trabajo, pues de ello depende para obtener buenas ganancias. Con el dinero del crédito comprará fertilizantes para curar las raíces de barbasco. Este es su crédito número 03; por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo mas lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformen por el buen manejo de su grupo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará funguicidas para el buen crecimiento de raíces de barbasco.
texts.en:
Alberto is 41 years old and lives with Vilma and the three school-aged children they have together. They live in their own home, made of rudimentary materials, which they bought ten years ago and have been living in since. Alberto is secure in that his product, the root of the barbasco bush, has become big business in recent years, not just for him, but also for the rest of the farmers, and certainly he is making the most out of his plantations.

During harvest times and when it's time to pull weeds he needs the help of day laborers so that he can get the greatest yield for his daily work. He's been doing this work for 15 years and he has always liked doing his job, and he depends on it to get good earnings. With the money from this loan he'll buy fertilizer to treat the roots of the barbasco bushes. This is his third loan, and he is committed to continue fulfilling his scheduled repayments. Furthermore he feels that he'll go as far as possible with his communal bank since everyone agrees that the group is well managed.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles he'll buy fungicides so the barbasco roots will grow well.

loans.use: to buy fungicides to treat the roots of his barbasco bushes.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a married woman. She has five children between the ages of 6 and 18. She describes herself to be jovial and kind. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power from customers. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy rolls of fabric. Her business goal is to expanded her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a succesful businesswoman. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel viven en casa propia casado con cinco hijos es productor de café convencional desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado con la producción y los cuidados que tiene el café y fue después de casado cuando compro sus parcelas y comenzó a trabajarlas junto con su esposa poniendo en practica todas las recomendaciones y consejos que le dio su padre referente al cuidado y producción del café. Fidel pide un crédito para comprar plantas para resiembra ya que en su parcela hay muchas plantas viejas que ya no tienen buena producción, fertilizantes que le ayudaran a aumentar su cosecha así como también  para el pago  de jornales que le ayudaran a limpiar su parcela y a mantenerla en perfectas condiciones para la temporada de cosecha, teniendo en cuenta que si realiza estas actividades en su parcela podrá con ello aumentar su producción por cosecha y de igual forma obtendrá mayores ganancias económicas que le ayudaran para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y aunado a esto tendrá una mejor calidad de vida para el y los suyos.
texts.en: Fidel lives in his own house with his five children. He’s a coffee producer. When he was young, his father taught him everything about coffee production, including the care needed to grow it. He bought his parcels of land after he was married and started to work them with his wife, putting into practice all of the recommendations and advice his father gave him with regard to taking care of and producing coffee. Fidel is requesting a loan to buy plants that replace the old ones that don’t yield anymore, fertilizers that help increase the harvest and also to pay day workers who help him clear his parcels and maintain them in perfect condition for the harvest season. By realizing all of these activities in his parcels of land, he’ll be able to increase production each harvest and at the same time obtain bigger economic gains that will help him support his children’s studies and improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy plants (that replace the old ones), fertilizer and pay day workers who help him improve the harvest.

loans.name: Dia De La Mujer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIA DE LA MUJER” iniciará el ciclo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa interior, venta de pasteles, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, pollerera, venta de frazadas y comida, venta de verduras, transportista, venta de electrodomésticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Andrea es una integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pasteles, ella cuenta que hace cuatro años emprendió este negocio ya que necesitaba dinero para cursas sus estudios superiores, para ello ayudo mucho el apoyo de su madre quien le enseño algunas cosas y le ayudo a la comercialización. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de producción (compra de harina, azúcar, etc.) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la preparación lo comercializará en algunos colegios de la ciudad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “DIA DE LA MUJER” (Woman's Day) Communal Bank is starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer at the Villa Exaltación Regional Center. The group is made up of 12 members under the direction of a governing board, and whose Treasurer is Andrea. The communal bank members' business are varied in nature, among them there are underwear sales, cake sales, cosmetic sales, clothing sales, a poulterer, blanket and food sales, vegetable sales, a cargo carrier and home appliance sales.
The loan that they are applying for will benefit this group of small business owners of which Andrea is a member. She says that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer after she was invited to join by her friend who's a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling cakes which she has been running for the last 4 years. She started the business as she needed money to pay for her college course, and she had some help from her mother who taught her how to make her goods and helped her to sell them.
This loan is to increase her production level (to buy flour and sugar, etc). She will buy the goods from the wholesalers and after baking her cakes, she will sell them in some of the city colleges. This work allows her to generate funds to support herself financially.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health support and loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar and flour etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa de 46 años de edad, es viuda; vive en su propia casa que compró con el apoyo de su difunto esposo; en ella habita con su único hijo Denys de 14 años. Luisa, es una mujer laboriosa; se dedica a la venta de comida en su propio domicilio. Desde hace 05 años ha realizado sola esta actividad y a veces cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo.  Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar y una parte lo usa para un ahorro para que su hijo pueda terminar sus estudios. 
Con el crédito que obtuvo comprará insumos para seguir preparando sus alimentos; ya que tiene las esperanzas que a futuro logré abrir un restaurante y se sienta más segura de brindar una buena comodidad para su clientela. Este es su crédito número 01, se siente orgullosa por contar con su apoyo financiero. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar con socios veraces. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de verduras y cereales y con el resto comprará una olla más grande para preparar su alimento.
texts.en:
Luisa is 46 years old. She is a widow. She lives in her own house, which she bought with the help of her deceased spouse. She lives there with her only son, Denys, who is 14. Luisa is an industrious woman. She sells food in her own house. She has been doing this work alone for five years, and sometimes she has the help of her son. What she likes most about her work is that thanks to it, she can pay her household expenses, and she saves part of her earnings so that her son will be able to finish his schooling.

With her loan that she will buy ingredients to continue preparing her food, since she has hope that in the future she will manage to open a restaurant, and she feels more sure of offering good comfort to her customers. This is her first loan, and she feels proud to have her financial support. She is also grateful to her communal bank for giving her the opportunity to work with truthful members.

With the 1000 PEN, she will stock vegetables and grains, and with the rest she will buy a bigger pot for preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, grains, and pots to prepare food

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 20-year-old single man who has worked in water distribution since 2009. He owns a tractor that he uses for many different agricultural needs. He transports water for irrigation, plows land, and spreads pesticides to prevent insects from ruining crops.

Mahdi applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his tractor that will help him to pray pesticides easily. Mahdi is young and energetic. He is ambitious and looking forward to expanding his business more and more by buying accessories for his tractor.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his tractor to help in spraying pesticides

loans.name: Marie Ann

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Marie Ann aims to become successful and financially stable in the future. She is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She has a business raising hogs in order to supplement her husband's income. They agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs some day. 

With this goal in mind, she plans to strengthen her hog-raising business to earn sufficient income for her family. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional 17,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business. She hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Zaum Adhiambo

texts.en:
Zaum has been operating a beauty salon in the Narok town area for eight years, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. With this third loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD, she will purchase more salon equipment for the business.

Zaum will use her additional profits to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dreams are to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to improve her salon services by buying cosmetics, weaves, shampoo, and hair treatments.

loans.name: Nzele

texts.en:
Nzele lives in Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a motorcycle for transport and has operated the business for two years. Besides this, Nzele also owns a poultry farm.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined to access credit to improve on business operations. 
Nzele is applying a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to purchase farm tools, renovate the farm and repair the motorcycle. The extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family. He aspires to expand and build a transport business by buying a public service van.

loans.use: To purchase farm tools, renovate the farm and repair the motorcycle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 37 años, es madre soltera; vive en su casa alquilada propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Marina, es labrar la tierra donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca, esta labor lo realiza hace 05 años y gracias a su esfuerzo logra obtener ingresos para su hogar. En los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que tenga mas avance en cuanto a  la cogida de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que amenazan su producto, siendo así logra obtener muy buena producción en sus cosechas.
 Con el crédito solicitado comprará fertilizantes y abonos, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos. Este es su crédito número 01, espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causar problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contento.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono para purificar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Marina, 37, is a single mother who lives in a rental house with her beloved children to whom she hopes to provide a better life. Maria works the land, growing cacao plants, coffee, and coca leaves. She has been farming for 5 years and has been able to pay household expenses from her labor. During the harvest, she has help from day laborers so that she can pick much more. She likes protecting her crops from the diseases which threaten them, which results in a good yield at harvest. 

She will buy fertilizer and manure with the loan. She expects that this will improve her crops. This is her first loan cycle. She expects to make her payments on time and not cause problems for her communal bank, of which she is happy to be a member. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy manure to fertilizer her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Emprendedoras - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento EMPRENDEDORAS - 26 Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  María, ella se dedica a la venta material de ferretería como grifos para instalaciones de agua, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto San Pedro,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a usar este préstamo para la compra material de ferretería por mayor  para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos  a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. María va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así ir mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una ferretería muy surtida. La Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The entrepreneurship bank "Emprendedoras - 26" (Entrepreneurs - 26) consists of eight members, six women and two men. The president of the bank is Señora Maria. She sells hardware store items such as faucets for water installations. She has a sales stall in the zone of Alto San Pedro. This loan is her first one with the institution. Señora Maria is going to use this loan to buy hardware items wholesale to stock her business and in this way offer a variety of products to her customers. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving her business. She will use the earnings to continue buying products and thus go on improving her income. Her goal for her business is to have a well-stocked hardware store. Señora Maria is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunity offered to her, since her fellow bank members in many cases are people who are raising their families alone.

loans.use: to buy hardware items wholesale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 63 years old. He is from Nakuru and married with five children who are all in school.

Moses has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to buy more charcoal to sell. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future and open up a dry cleaning shop.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es:
¡Buenas tardes! Este es el Grupo Las Triunfadoras Leales de Motupe.

Rosa es la Tesorera del grupo y vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos, que están estudiando en Universidad.

Rosa tiene una bodega, donde vende gaseosas, galletas, dulces y otros abarrotes. El préstamo lo va a usar para comprar más mercancía para vender a sus clientes. A Rosa no le faltan clientes. Muchos de ellos son sus vecinos, ya que la bodega está ubicada en su domicilio. Otros son familias que salen a pasear en el parque al frente de la bodega. Con tantos clientes, Rosa trabaja todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana a las 11 de la noche pero está acostumbrada porque siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora.

Una grande parte de sus ingresos los destina a la educación de sus hijos pero se siente muy feliz saber que van a ser profesionales.

En la foto, Rosa es la segunda señora desde la izquierda en la fila de atrás. ¡Rosa le agradece su apoyo!
texts.en:
Good afternoon! This is the Tirunfadoras Leales de Motupe (Triumphant Loyal Women of Motupe) group.

Rosa is the treasurer of the group and lives with her partner and their two children, who are students at the university.

Rosa has a small grocery store where she sells soft drinks, crackers, sweets, and other groceries. She is going to use the loan to buy more merchandise to sell to her customers. Rosa does not lack for customers. Many of them are her neighbors, since the store is located in her home. Others are families who go out to stroll in the park across from the store. With so many customers, Rosa works every day from 8 in the morning until 11 at night, but she is accustomed to it because she has always been a hard-working woman.

A large part of her income is destined for the education of her children, but she feels very happy to know that they are going to have careers.

In the photo, Rosa is the second woman from the left in the back row. Rosa thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Kombe

texts.en:
Kombe lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of four. He is a dairy farmer, a business he has been running for five years. Besides this, Kombe also runs a bar and restaurant which he has been operating for five years.

He learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges he is facing are insecurity and low income during low seasons.

Kombe is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to expand the business to a bigger one than the one he has now.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en: Anatoli is a 45-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi,Uganda. For seven years he has been operating a retail shop in order to meet the increasing expenses of his family. Price fluctuations, inflation, high taxes and other costs hinder his business. Anatoli dreams of educating his children, moving his business to a more permanent location and owning a wholesale shop. Anatoli intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to  sell.

loans.name: Magnifique

texts.en:
Magnifique is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (www.africanleadershipacademy.org) (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Magnifique was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Magnifique is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to help him conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student-run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Magnifique was born in the Democatic Republic of Congo.  Unfortunately, Magnifique’s family was forced to flee from the war in DRC, and he has grown up as a refugee in Namibia.
 
Magnifique shows a passion for empowering youth to make better choices. Magnifique has an interest in youth entertainment and  showed that he has entreprenieral skills when he started his own production initiative called MN Productions to encourage youth that they can have fun without alcohol.  He continued to develop this entertainment company to provide safe entertainment for young people even though he faced a few challenges along the way (not all young people were interested in his idea of alcohol free entertainment!) To further develop his interest in the entertainment industry, Magnifique interned with an audio company to train himself in the mechanics of running technical audio systems. 

Magnifique is also particularly environmentally conscious.
