He created the R CUBED Committee (Recycle x Reduce and Re-use) in his high school, which he says allowed for his peers to have an avenue to make their science classes practical. “It is important for students to be involved in things they care about”, says Magnifique. “School is about implementing accessed information and not just remembering it for exams,” he says. 

Magnifique’s impressive leadership skills have been apparent from a young age. At the age of only 16, Magnifique became the Junior Deputy Mayor of the Rehoboth Junior Town Council – a prestigious position that he was selected for by his school principal based on his leadership potential.  As a member of the Junior Council, he was extremely involved and even has the opportunity to attend the Youth 21 Global Youth Leadership Forum on Inclusive Governance in Nairobi, Kenya. 

Magnifique is passionate about physical sciences and mathematics. He is especially interested in alien life and robotics – he has even already started designing his own robotic modules. He hopes to one day become one of the world’s greatest scientists. A true entrepreneur, Magnifique hopes to one day open a bank in Africa that will grants dreams and ideas the opportunity to grown and be sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Jean Fernando

texts.en:
Jean Fernando, or “Fernando” as he is known, is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (www.africanleadershipacademy.org) (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Fernando was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Fernando is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to help him conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student-run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Fernando comes from a family of seven in Mozambique. In 2009, right after he finished middle school, his family faced financial difficulties and could not afford to rent the land where his family usually grew rice for profit. In order to continue his schooling, Fernando had to move far away to a new town with his brother. They both supported themselves through high school by working on the weekend of pay for their school fees. 

Passionate about the environment and conservation, Fernando has been very involved with the Malagasy Youth Network for the Environment (MYNE), through which he has been a key player in many projects to clean the town and protect the environment. He has even helped a well-known environmental researcher conduct research on carnivores in the protected rainforests of Maroantsetra, Madagascar. He is particularly passionate about environmental education for youth.

Fernando was one of two winners of the Environmental Prize for Maroantsetra Youth, which is an environmental leadership competition among over 200 students in Maroantsetra involving leadership, speech, and written examinations. In recognition of his dedication and leadership, he was invited to attend an environmental leadership camp around Madagascar with UNICEF and the Wildlife Conservation Society. A true embodiment of the value of tolerance and respect for diversity, Fernando shoes a great appreciation for cross cultural learning and understanding. To this end, in Madagascar, he hosted a cultural exchange radio show where he taught English language and offered information about other cultures. 

In 20 years’ time, Fernando says that he wants to have worked to prevent environmental destruction. He aspires to establish a network of African Environmental Youth Associations and connect with other international environmental organizations so that he can have a positive impact on protecting biodiversity and preventing climate change.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: James Akeen Ngor

texts.en:
James is a 20-year-old, full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

James was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

James is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to help him conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student-run business which form part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

James grew up in the small city of Yei, South Sudan. He was instrumental in negotiating with his local government in 2008, when it decided to close down his school unexpectedly. A charismatic young leader and a true politician in the making, James drafted a memo to arrange a meeting between select students and the county commissioner, which ultimately led to the re-opening of the school.

James has repeatedly displayed an unyielding commitment to service and a natural ability to lead through diplomacy and negotiation.  During a time of significant ethnic unrest in his community, James started the Greater Nilotic Student Association, which hosted a meeting to bring the hostile groups together and restored calm to the community. In an amazing show of solidarity, the young members of this group later led a joint protest against the invasion of South Sudan by the North. James now acts as an advisor to the group.

At the age of 13 he initiated and structured the Sunday School Children’s Union through which he educated young people about the dangers of HIV and discouraged tribalism, encouraging the spirit of peaceful co-existence. He also formed a union called the Discussion Club, which brought students together to discuss a wide array of issues – he made a proposal to the principal and also invited MPs, religious leaders and NGOs to help brainstorm a way forward for the club. James was also a member of the Civil Society Youth Initiative during the referendum for South Sudan.  

James’ natural ability to motivate and encourage others was also displayed in his role as the Public Relations Officer for the Peace Project by the Catholic Church of Yei. In this capacity, James counselled children who had lost family in ethnic conflicts. 

James is passionate about the transformation of the African continent. He wants to see Africa transformed into a democratic, secular and innovative continent.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Dawit

texts.en:
Dawit is a 17 year-old full time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Dawit was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Dawit is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to help him conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student-run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Dawit is extremely community-orientated and passionate about making a difference. He sees problems as challenges to be overcome – the traits of a true entrepreneur. This quality was shown clearly when, during secondary school in Kenya, Dawit noticed that students in his school were not focused on their education and had trouble understanding the material. Dawit decided to do something about the problem and formed a club called “Future Leaders” aimed at tutoring young students. Through this club, he coordinated a group of top students in the 11th and 12th grades to tutor other students three days a week. Thanks to Dawit’s initiative, many students dramatically improved their academic performance and many also started to have a more positive attitude towards their education. 

In his short 17 years, Dawit has demonstrated compassion of the highest degree. When one of his friends lost his father from AIDS and the family began to struggle economically to the point where they were unable to pay for food and rent, Dawit took it on himself to raise money for his friend’s family by organizing a community Iddir (traditional saving mechanism in Ethiopia). Furthermore, he even started a non-governmental organization called Tesfagoh that supports and takes care of HIV carriers. In doing so, he was able to raise the money to help his friend's family and also increase awareness regarding HIV/AIDS.  

Academically, Dawit has always been a high achieving student.  In secondary school in Kenya, he was among the top performing students in all of his classes. In recognition of his leadership and academic excellence, Dawit was given the opportunity to participate in a forum on women’s education in Ethiopia held in Addis Ababa.

Dawit is also passionate about environmental conservation and climate change. He has been instrumental in creating awareness about these issues in his school, using drama as a medium. As Dawit’s knowledge of environmental issues has grown, so too has the impact of his awareness campaigns. Dawit was able to share his knowledge with villagers in his community, to whom he was able to teach sustainable methods of planting and growing seeds. Dawit continues to nurture his keen interest in environmental conservation by studying issues of poor management of water and environmental protection, in addition to his full time studies at ALA.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

She was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Gift is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to help her conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student-run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Gift grew up in Mombasa, Kenya and is one of a family of seven. 

Gift’s demonstrated passion for public service was evident in her extensive involvement in her community and in her high school.  Included in her list of school activities and leadership roles is her instrumental role in Red Cross charity walks and her role as dining hall captain. She was also a Sunday school teacher at Christian Pentecostal Ministries. Gift is a talented public speaker and was selected to participate in Kiswahili Public Speaking at the national level.  A born leader, she was nominated to participate in the 4th National Student Leaders Conference in Kenya. 

Gift has demonstrated academic excellence throughout her school career. Prior to ALA, Gift attended a national high school in Limuru, Kenya, where she was ranked as the 2nd overall student in academic performance. Gift has a particular talent for the sciences and recently participated in the Girls’ Science Congress in Kenya. At the congress, Gift presented on the preservation of stored maize by using extracts and won first place in her category.  

Gift’s dream is to one day become a cardiologist and help fund children who have heart-related diseases but cannot afford the cost of treatment. She plans to impact Africa by starting orphanages for children where they can receive educational and spiritual guidance. High on her agenda is the role of leadership: she aspires to be a leader in her field and a role model to many girls across the continent, hoping to attract many of them into the field of medicine, and therefore further enhance the impact made on the continent.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam de 32 años de edad, es una mujer casada con Rubén de 38 años, fruto de ese amor tienen 03 hijos; viven en su propia casa que lo obtuvieron durante sus 10 años de convivencia. hace 8 años Miriam abrió su propio negocio, que es una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que logró  obtenerlo gracias a la ayuda de su esposo. Poco a poco se lleno de productos y con el transcurso del tiempo sus ahorros se acumularon. Ella es una mujer  laboriosa y señala que uno logra su propósito a base de firmeza. 
Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, es mas, ella tiene casi todo los productos que sus clientes requieren y a esto sumarle el detalle que ella le pone y la buena atención al cliente; su bodega hace que sea tan concurrida.
Ella necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando buen servicio a sus consumidores. Este es su crédito número 01; esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo sugerido y  esta muy contenta  de pertenecer  a su banca comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de víveres para su tienda.
texts.en:
Miriam, 32, is married to 38-year-old Rubén. They have 3 children and live in their own home, which they bought during the 10 years the couple has lived together. Eight years ago, Miriam opened her own business, a grocery store, with her husband's help. Slowly, they stocked the store, and over time they have accumulated savings. Miriam is a hardworking woman and points out that you achieve your purpose with determination. She likes the work she does and the revenue it produces. She also stocks almost all the items her customers need and added details of her great customer service, which brings lots of traffic to her store. 

She needs this loan to continue thriving and giving her customers good service. This is her first loan cycle, and she is happy to know there is financial support available. The support makes her feel confident in buying the merchandise, and she is happy to belong to her communal bank. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Samuel  Kiguru

texts.en: Samuel is 26 years old and married with two children who are in school. He runs a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business to earn a living. He runs this business in a competitive environment with loyal customers. He has engaged in this business for eight years. Besides that, he operates a grocery store to generate more income. Samuel dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda de 58 años de edad, es viuda; junto a su hijo Marcial de 18 años vive en su propia casa que compró gracias a su trabajo. Hace 15 años Amanda logró abrir su negocio con el apoyo de su difunto esposo; ahora ella se dedica a este negocio, pues asi logrará tener ingresos diariamente. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajo es que gracias a ello puede educar a su hijo, ya que su mayor anhelo es que sea un hombre profesional.
Con el crédito que obtuvo por parte de los financieros podrá realizar sus compras para que su tienda se vea bien presentable. Este es su crédito número 02; agradece por la confianza que le brindan y se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, ya que de esa manera no hará quedar mal a sus socios.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de la mercadería que necesita par su tienda como: arroz, azúcar y detergentes.
texts.en:
Amanda is a 58-year-old widow; she owns her own house that she bought thanks to her job and lives in it with her 18-year-old son, Marcial. Fifteen years ago, Amanda, was able to open her business with the support of her late husband; now she runs the business, which provides her with daily income. What she most enjoys about her job is that thanks to it, she’s able to educate her son -- her biggest wish is that he becomes a professional. 
With the loan she’ll be receiving from the financiers, she’ll be able to make some purchases so her store will look presentable. This is her 2nd loan; she is grateful for the confidence she’s being given and promises to be punctual with her payments, as she wouldn’t want to make her associates look bad. 
With the 1,000 Peruvian soles, she’ll stock up on the merchandise that she needs for her store: rice, sugar and detergents.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and detergent.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 26-year-old married man. He has a child who is 3 years old. He describes himself as a determined man. He operates a retail business where he sells cakes, breads and doughnuts. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of fuel for the motorcycle he uses to deliver cakes, bread and doughnuts to customers. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase cakes for selling. His business goal is to be a supplier of food in his hometown within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business by meeting his customers’ demand. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cakes for selling.

loans.name: Ninaai

texts.en:
Ninaai is 44 years old,  He is married to Tumpeyo and they are blessed with two children aged 12 and three years old.  He has been in business for one year with an income of KES 5,000 montly.  

This is his first loan with KADET LTD, and he intends to use the loan to purchase more animals like goats and sheep to fatten and  sell later at a profit.  


The profit he gets he will use to expand his business and his dreams is to have a better future for his children.

loans.use: buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Samuel  Mburu

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old, married and has four children who are in school. For ten years, he has been doing tailoring in a favorable working environment to earn a living.  In addition, he does farming to supplement his income. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Samuel has learned how to manage his business because he has been trained on business management skills. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. Samuel has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: buy fabrics

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 50 years old. He is married to Penina, and together they have two children. He sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and  he will use the loan to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale in his business. Stephen hopes to expand his business. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Nayci, es una joven de 21 años, convive con Jhon de 25 años y tienen una pequeña hija de nombre Merlín de 05 añitos; viven en la casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia.
El trabajo al que Nayci y su pareja realizan es la agricultura; ambos se dedican, a labrar la tierra; en su parcela posee plantas de cacao y café. Todos los días salen a trabajar en su parcela.
Ella sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha.; sus productos los lleva a comercializar en los centros de acopio ubicados en su localidad; lugar donde mejores precios percibe por sus granos de café y cacao.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales donde es el proceso final para  luego comercializarlos. Nayci necesita el préstamo para comprar abonos naturales como estiércol de animales para mejorar sus cosechas.
Más adelante, espera adquirir nuevas tierras para así tener mayores ingresos. Este es su crédito número 02, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará estiércol de animales para abonar sus tierras y así convertirlas fértiles y productivas.
texts.en:
Nayci is a young woman of 21. She lives with her partner, Jhon, who is 25, and they have a little daughter named Merlin, who is 5 years old. They live in the house that her parents gave them as an inheritance.

Nayci and her partner work in agriculture. Both work the land. On their parcel of land they have plantings of cacao and coffee. They go out to work on their parcel every day.

She knows that the money that she obtains for their products depends greatly on the quality of their harvest. She takes her products to sell at the collection centers in her area, a place where she receives better prices for her coffee and cacao beans.

What she likes most about her work is harvesting her land, since then she feels that the months of hard work have borne fruit. She has been doing this work for 8 years, and she finds that the most difficult part is transporting her products from the field to the piles where the final process is done before selling them. Nayci needs the loan to buy natural fertilizer such as animal manure to improve her harvests.

In the future, she hopes to acquire new land to thus obtain more income. This is her second loan, and she states that the money from the loan will help her a lot in the progress of her work. She is well liked by the rest of the members of her communal bank. With the 2000 PEN, she will buy animal manures to fertilize her fields and thus make them fertile and productive.

loans.use: to buy animal manure to fertilize her land

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 30 year old single man who provides for his five siblings. He is a wheat and maize farmer and has been in this business for the past 10 years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is requesting his third loan of KES. 90,000 from KADET LTD, which will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and the purchase of farm inputs e.g. fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides for use in his farm.

He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve his family's standard of living and to educate his siblings.

loans.use: to purchase farm  inputs e.g  fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides for his use in  his farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 years and married with four children who are aged between 16 years and eight years old.

James has been in the dairy farming business for the past three years and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy one dairy cow.

He hopes to improve his standard in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mziphe

texts.en:
Mziphe lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a retail shop, a business he has been operating for three years. Apart from this business, he gets a salary from employment.

He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. He is facing challenges in prices and bad debts.

Mziphe is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cereals. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard. His plan for the future is to own a wholesale shop and be a supplier.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 26 años,  vive en la casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia, junto a su pareja Feliciano de 34 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desean brindarle una buena comodidad. Olga, trabaja en sus propias tierras de cultivo al lado de su pareja; donde viene cultivando cacao, café y hojas de coca; trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener los gastos de su hogar. Los productos cosechados, lo vende en los centros de acopio ubicados en su localidad, lugar donde percibe mejores precios por cada uno de sus productos. A ella le gusta de su trabajo, ya que lo aprendió desde muy pequeña a lado de sus padres y  lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad en su propia parcela. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos; con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este es su crédito número 01; ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de Los integrantes.
Con los 000 nuevos soles, adquirirá abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus plantas y así sacar buen provecho en sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Olga, 26 years old, lives in the house she inherited from her parents along with her partner Feliciano, 34 years old. They have three precious children, to whom she wants to provide a comfortable life. Olga works on her own farmland with her partner. Here, they grow coffee, cocoa beans and cocoa leaves. This work has provided her the necessary income to manage household expenses. Olga loves her work, which she learned at a very young age from her parents. She has been performing this work for 10 years on her own land. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer to improve her harvest. In the future, she wants to buy more land so she can increase her production. This is her tenth loan; she has been very punctual with her previous loans and hopes to be so again now. She is very active in her communal bank and is loved by the other members.

With the 1,000 nuevo soles, she will purchase fertilizer to improve her plants and have a good quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina es una persona muy alegre; tiene 42 años y gracias al trabajo que realiza junto a su esposo Marciano han logrado comprar su propia casa; en ella habita con sus 02 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro. Paulina  y su esposo salen a labrar sus tierras desde muy temprano; para ellos lo primordial es que sus plantas de cacao y café, salgan muy productivas en los tiempos de cosecha. Esta labor lleva realizando hace más de 25 años y comenta que según a su buena calidad, llegan a obtener muy buenos precios por parte de los centros de acopio. Ella sabe que si no le da un buen mantenimiento a sus plantas, las plagas podrían apoderarse de ello y así dañarían su buena producción. Por ello cuenta con el crédito para realizar la fertilización de sus plantas. Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa a base material noble y así dar una mejor estadía a sus hijos. Este es su crédito número 02;  ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona responsable y participe.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abono para obtener una buena producción en su parcela.
texts.en:
Paulina is a very cheerful person. She is 42 years old and thanks to her and her husband Marciano's hard work they have been able to buy their own house. She lives there with her two dear children, whom she wants to provide with a good future. 

Paulina and her husband go out to work on their land very early. The most essential thing to them is for their cocoa and coffee plants to become very productive in the harvest season. She has been farming for over 25 years and says that thanks to the good quality of their products they are able to get very good prices from distribution centers. She knows that if her plants aren't properly maintained, pests could take them over and that would damage her production level. That is why she will use this loan to fertilize her plants.

Her greatest desire is to build her home with quality materials so that she can offer her children better housing. This is her second loan. She paid her installments very promptly and expects to do the same this time. She is an active and responsible member of her communal bank.

She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase sacks of fertilizer so that she may obtain high productivity from her plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 45-year-old man. He is divorced and a father to one son and one daughter who live with him. He is a construction worker who earns a low income, which is not enough to cover his family's cost of living.

Ibrahem is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him pay the cost of purchasing an air conditioner and water purification filter for home use. This will offer to Ibrahem and his children suitable housing conditions and a healthy life. Ibrahem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner and water purification filter.

loans.name: Efrin

texts.es:
Efrin de 39 años de edad, convive con su pareja Reyna de 37 años y tienen dos hijos: juntos residen en su propio techo construido a base de material rústico, que compraron gracias a sus esfuerzos cotidianos. Efrin, empezó a trabajar de jornalero en distintas chacras, durante un buen tiempo, pero él seguía obstinado en tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Hoy, con mucha alegría, siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja; su punto de venta lo realiza en su propio domicilio de su localidad. 
Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, detergentes y golosinas, puesto que su mayor anhelo es mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que le dé un formato distinto a sus demás competencias y de esa manera atraer más a sus clientes. Este es su crédito número 02; por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará víveres para su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Efrin is 39 years old.  He lives with his 37 year old partner, Reyna, with whom he has two children.  They live together in their own rustic home that they were able to buy, thanks to their daily efforts.  Efrin first worked as a day laborer on various small farms, which he did for quite a while.  But he kept insisting on having his own small grocery.  Today, he is happy because he feels that he has met one of his primary objectives, owning his own store.  His business is producing good economic results because of the quality and variety of products that he offers to his costumers.  Normally, Efrin works on his own, but sometimes his wife helps him.  He runs his store out of his home.  
With the loan he has requested, Efrin will purchase sacks of rice, sugar, detergents and sweets.  His greatest desire is to improve his grocery; he wants the format to be different from his competition in order to attract more customers.  This is Efrin's 2nd loan.  He promises to continue complying with his established re-payment plan.  In addition, he is satisfied with his communal bank; all the members comply with their repayments plans.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles (USD $400) he will purchase supplies for his business, like rice, sugar etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and noodles to stock up his store.

loans.name: Constructor Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONSTRUCTOR II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de sombreros, venta de chuño y papa, tejido de manta y macramé, tejido de ajuares de bebe, confección y venta de busos, venta de pipocas de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana María es una integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía (producción de mantas), mismo que emprendió con el primer préstamo que hizo de la institución.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo los fines de semana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Constructor II", as part of the Regional Hub Los Andes, will start the second round in Pro Mujer. It has nine members and is led by a board where Ana María is the President. The businesses that members of the association carry out are varied, and among them there are: selling hats, selling potato flour and potato, blanket and macramé weaving, layettes knitting, tailoring and selling of sweatpants, selling of chicken pipocas.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Ana María is a member. She indicates that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for four years, when she entered by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today, she has a craft business (production of blankets), the same she launched with the first loan from the institution.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase capital (purchase of wool) that she will buy from wholesalers and after the production she will sell it in her permanent stall on weekends. This way to work allows her to generate sources to support her financially. When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health and training.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza, who is from Kobuleti district, West Georgia, is 42 years old and lives with her husband, two grown sons, her daughter-in-law and a grandson. Roza's husband works as an operator at a petrol station, while her elder son is an artisan and the younger one a contractor for the national army. They earn monthly incomes. Her daughter-in-law works a dance teacher.

Roza runs an agricultural business, growing mandarins and nuts upon a plot of land she owns. In addition, she has a milk cow and produces dairy products. A very hard-working person with rich experience, she sells her agricultural production locally.

Roza plans to expand the dairy farm with additional cows, but the existing cattle-shed won't allow her to implement this plan. She is therefore requesting a loan to build a new one. After it is built, Roza will be able to expand her dairy farm and increase production. With the resulting expanded income, she plans to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a cattle-shed.

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru: Гулмахмаду 46 лет. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которая работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Гулмахмад и его жена воспитывают одного ребенка и стараются обеспечить его со всеми необходимыми средствами. Гулмахмад занимается разведением и купли продажи скота. Он является владельцам своего бизнеса. Он начал свой бизнес 20 лет назад. Он покупает теленку и после нескольких месяцев продает. В начале своего бизнеса Гулмахмад встретился с трудностями, несмотря на это он не бросил свой бизнес, а наоборот развевает год за годом.  Гулмахмад имеет дополнительный доход  выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Он хочет развевать свой бизнес дальше, но не имеет достаточного средства. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulmahmad is 46 years old and married to a beautiful woman who works on a dehkan (family) farm. Gulmahmad and his wife are raising one child and try to provide their child with everything necessary.
Gulmahmad breeds, buys, and sells cattle. He started his business 20 years ago. He buys calves and sells them a few months later. At the inception of his business, Gulmahmad ran into some difficulties, but he has not quit his business -- on the contrary, he has kept developing it. Gulmahmad receives some extra income from crop farming.
He wants to develop his business further but does not have the means to. Gulmahmad has requested a loan of 3,000 USD to buy cattle. He appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta, de 46 años, es divorciada; vive en su propia casa que obtuvo gracias a su trabajo cotidiano; en ella habita con sus 02 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Jacinta, se dedica a la venta de víveres (arroz, conservas, bebidas, azúcar, entre otros)  y es muy buena vendedora, por el cual sus productos se venden muy rápido y tiene que renovarlos constantemente. 
Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a  ello, puede cubrir con los gastos de educación para sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes sobre el progreso de su localidad; lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad; la cual se siente satisfecha del trabajo que hace. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más productos de comestibles, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Este es su crédito número 01; agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar junto a ellos. Asegura que aportara puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de víveres necesarios para colocar en su estante.
texts.en:
Jacinta, who is 46 years old, is divorced.  She lives in her own home that she obtained thanks to her hard work.  She lives there with her two children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.  Jacinta makes her living selling provisions (rice, canned food, beverages, sugar and other items).  She is a very good saleswoman, which is why her products sell very quickly and she is constantly restocking her supplies.
Jacinta feels that her work is very profitable, and thanks to it, she can cover the costs of her children's education.  What she likes most about her work is conversing with her customers about the progress of their town.  Jacinta has had her store for six years.  She feels very satisfied with the work that she does.  With the requested loan, she will purchase more foodstuffs in order to offer her customers a greater variety of products.  This is Jacinta's first loan; she thanks the members of her communal for allowing her to work together with them.  She assures us that she will punctually contribute to her loan repayments. 
With the 1,000 nuevos soles (USD $400), she will stock up with provisions to put on the shelves.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies for her store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 32 años de edad, convive con Eduardo de 48 años y fruto de ese amor tienen 02 hijos, a quienes brindan una buena educación; habitan en su propia casa que compraron hace 13 años. Nelly es una mujer alegre y sobre todo laboriosa; se dedica a la venta de víveres como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, etc. Mayormente las amas de casa siempre visitan su tienda y algunos niños se acercan a comprar los dulces que ofrece su tienda. Esta labor tiene 08 años realizando, a veces cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien también se encarga de las ventas. Para ella su trabajo es beneficioso, ya que siempre cuenta con ingreso económico para el bienestar de su familia. Por ello ella sigue con las ganas de mejorar su tienda para que su clientela siempre sea constante. Con el préstamo, se abastecerá de productos para colocar en su vitrina y estantes.  Este es su crédito número 02; una vez mas agradece el apoyo financiero, de esa manera logra continuar con negocio. en su banco comunal, hace que sus socios sean puntuales en las reuniones y responsables con su pago así como lo es ella.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará saco de arroz, azúcar, conservas, y cajas de galetas.
texts.en:
Nelly is 32 years old and lives with Eduardo who is 48 years old.  They have 2 children, for whom they provide a good education.  They live in their own house they bought 13 years ago. 

Nelly is a happy woman and above all, hardworking.  She sells food such as rice, sugar, canned food, etc.  Mostly housewives always visit her store and some children come by to buy the treats offered in her shop. Nelly has done this work for 8 years, sometimes with the support of a partner who is also in charge of sales.  Her work is beneficial as it has provided income for the well-being of her family. Her desire to improve her store for her customers is always constant. With the requested loan, Nelly will supply products to stock her cabinet and shelves. 

This is Nelly's second loan.  Once again, she is grateful for the financial support that continues to improve her business.  In her communal bank, she and her partners are punctual at meetings and responsible with their payment.  With the 1,000 soles she will buy a bag of rice, sugar, canned goods and boxes of cookies.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, sugar, canned goods and boxes of cookies.

loans.name: Constantino Rodolfo

texts.es:
Constantino es un hombre de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja y su hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajado y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a su padres, Constantino no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Agrónoma, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace varios años Constantino de dedica a la agricultura, él cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde cultiva uva y otros sembríos pequeños, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana con ayuda de su pareja inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
Constantino se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insecticidas y fertilizantes para su cultivo; de esta manera Constantino tendrá su cultivo en mejore condiciones, asegurando así que su cosecha se logre satisfactoriamente, con ello él espera poder realizar una buena venta y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio con la crianza de ganado, así el seguirá trabajando y esforzando para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Constantino is a 60 year old man who lives in the city of Pisco with his partner and son that he loves and are his reason for living.  He is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who with his partner works very hard to push their family forward.  Unfortunately, because he had to work from an early age to help his parents, Constantino was not able to study agricultural engineering, although he would have really enjoyed doing so.  In his free time, he enjoys playing sports and on occasion, he cooks a delicious Ají de Gallina for his family.  

With a lot of effort and enthusiasm, Constantino has been working in agriculture for many years.  He has a small plot of land where he grows grapes and other small crops.  With the help of his partner, he works from very early in the morning for about 10 hours a day.  He believes he is doing well because of his dedication and the effort he puts into his work.  

Constantino is very grateful for the Kiva loans, because with their help he will be able to purchase insecticides and fertilizers for his crops.  With these supplies, he can keep his crops in better condition and ensure that he has successful harvests.  With this, he will be able to make better sales and augment his income which will allow him to expand his business in the future and raise livestock.  He will continue working and striving so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento JESUS ES MI PASTOR, está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Juana, tiene 40 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, en la zona de Arco Iris, este préstamo es su octava secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de harina por cantidad para la elaboración de variedad de panes  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Juana  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. Juana  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jesus Es Mi Pastor comprises eight members, all of them women. 

Juana is the bank President. She is forty years old and works making and selling bread. She has her own bakery, which is located in her home, in the Arco Iris area. This loan is her eighth cycle within the institution. Juana is going to use this loan to purchase flour in bulk so that she can offer her customers better service by making a variety of pastries, and increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Juana  is going to use the profits to continue purchasing utensils and supplies to make her breads and pastries.

Juana is a very hard worker and is happy with the opportunity she is being offered along with her fellow members of the group, because in some cases they are supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Iasguli

texts.en:
Iasguli is 32 years old and lives in the Kobuleti district with her family (husband and two children who are ten and twelve years old). The children go to the local school. Iasguli’s husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly salary. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where mandarins and nuts are grown. They also grow different kinds of fruits. In addition, Iasguli has a dairy cow and a calf. She produces dairy products and sells her agricultural production locally. Iasguli is a very hard-working person with a rich experience in her work.

She requested a loan to cultivate agricultural land. Iasguli will work hard during relevant seasons to get a good harvest. She will be able to pick more nuts and mandarins and sell them at a good price. She is hoping to generate a profit from this loan and increase the income of the family. With the increased income, she will improve the living conditions of the family. Iasguli thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 44 years old and lives in the Khelvachauri district with her retired mother. Madona is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a plot of land, where she grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Madona sells her agricultural products at the local open market. In addition, she runs a small dairy farm and has a milk cow. Madona milks the cow twice a day and sells the milk locally.

Madona has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle by purchasing 2 milk cows. This will allow Madona to receive more milk for her dairy and increase her sales, which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and renovate her old and damaged house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 57 years old, is married and has six children, all still in school. Lydia runs a sari-sari, or convenience store, selling various items to the people in her locality. Lydia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP  to buy additional merchandise, such as snack food, shampoo, detergent, cooking ingredients, etc. to sell in her store. This will enable her to cater to her customers' needs. Lydia hopes to see her business become successful. In addition, she wants to send her children to school for better learning and for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise, such as snack food, shampoo, detergent, cooking ingredients, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es: Paula es estudiante en Campoalto de segundo semestre sus padres la apoyan mucho y motivan para que estudie ella tiene 17 años a corto plazo quiere terminar sus estudios tecnicos y continuar con su profesional ella quiere ayudar a su familia y a su hermano menor para que tambien estudie, le gusta mucho esta area y sabe que es una buena opcion para  salir adelante el prestamo de Kiva le va permitir ayudarse para su sostenimiento mientras estudia, ella vive actualmente en Bogota con una prima viene de un pueblo donde no existen muchas opciones de estudiar ya que la prima la apoya con la vivienda ella quiere salir adelante con sus estudios ya que sus padres no contaron con ninguna ayuda y su padre sufrio un accidente que no le permite trabajar es por eso que necesita del credito
texts.en:
Paula is a second-semester student at Campoalto. Her parents support her a lot and motivate her to study. She is seventeen years old.

Her short term plan is to finish her technical studies and go on to pursue a professional degree. She wants to help her family and her younger brother so that he can also go to school. She really enjoys her field and knows that it is a good option to get ahead.

This Kiva loan will allow her to support herself while she is in school. She is currently living in Bogota with her cousin. She comes from a town where there aren't many options of going to school and since her cousin is helping her with housing, she wants to make the most of her studies. Her parents didn't have any help and her father suffered and accident that doesn't allow him to work. That is why she needs this loan.

loans.use: to finance her Healthcare Administration studies in Campoalto.

loans.name: Harry

texts.en: Harry is married and has one child. He describes himself as understanding and self-motivated. For the past year, Harry has operated a poultry farm where he sells chickens. His business is located in a residential business area. Harry describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent outbreaks of poultry disease. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy poultry for resale. Harry's business goal is to build a coop within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business into farming. This is Harry's first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Madlena

texts.en:
Madlena is from the Khelvachauri district, West Georgia. She is 38 years old and lives with her parents, husband and three children (14, 17 and 19 years old). Her father is a pensioner, her mother works as a cleaner and her husband is an artisan, all receiving a monthly income. Madlena is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a plot of land, where she grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Madlena sells her agricultural products at the local open market. In addition, she runs a small dairy farm and has a milk cow. Madlena milks the cow twice a day and produces yogurt, which is sold locally.

Madlena has applied for this loan to increase her number of cattle by purchasing milk cows. This will allow Madlena to receive more milk for her dairy and increase her sales, which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Purevsuren is 43 years old and lives with her two children in a ger in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her children are secondary school students. Since 1998, Mrs. Purevsuren has had her own organic dairy product business on the second floor of the central local market of Uvurhangai province. Her working capital was 200,000 MNT. She is well-experienced in the sector. She is asking for 800,000 MNT to purchase organic milk and organic dairy products for her business. Mrs. Purevsuren's goal is to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase organic milk and organic dairy products for her business

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORECITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guillermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de guantes, venta de pollos, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, venta de aguayos y pescado, costura de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Guillermina es una integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de mantas de vicuña, mismo que aprendió de la colaboración que realizaba en su niñez a su madre, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió con muy poco capital y en la actualidad mejoró esta situación.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Florecitas” (Little Flowers) will be starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Los Andes.  It is made up of eight members and overseen by a board of directors.  Señora Guillermina is the president of the board of directors.  The members' businesses are varied and include: knitting gloves, selling chickens, selling prepared food, running a grocery store, vegetable sales, selling decorative cloths, fish sales and sewing jackets. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Guillermina is one.  She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer two years ago; she was invited by a promoter from the institution.  Currently, Señora Guillermina has a business making vicuña wool blankets, which she learned as a child working together with her mother.  She says that she started the business with very little capital, but that now the situation is improving. 

The loan that Señora Guillermina is taking out is to increase her capital.  She will purchase vicuña wool from the wholesalers and then make it into blankets fill her daily orders.  This form of work allows her to generate the income she needs to financially support herself. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Guillermina responds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to purchase vicuña wool.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 48-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 15 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a retail store where he sells furniture such as wall units, coffee tables, beds, cupboards, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years.

Samuel's business is located at a potentially busy business area  and his primary customers are schools and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying wood for making more furniture.  This is his first loan. He plans to use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy wood for making more furniture to sell to customers. Samuel's goal is to start a new business of selling electronics such as radios, television, phones etc to customers. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business and family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy costume jewelry sets, fancy beads and thread for Pranday (an ornament used to tie back the hair) for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 41-year-old hard-working man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For seven years Godfrey has been selling charcoal and it is from this business that he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. He says that if he had enough capital he would divert from this business and venture into solar systems which are non destructive to the environment. Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Buena Vista Ii Chinique Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos esta casada, tiene 38 años de edad , no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 9 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio con la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso, y  hasta ahora lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de animales domésticos para crianza, específicamente la compra de vacas y cerdos, espera en el futuro tener una carnicería en el lugar donde vive para vender carne, de la crianza de animales. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Santos is 38 years old, and is married with 9 children, three of whom are in school. Santos never had the opportunity to attend school, but she works raising animals and livestock, and taking care of her family and her home. She started her livestock business because her family needed an additional source of income, and she now has 5 years of experience in the trade. Her husband supports her in her business endeavor, and he also works as a farmer.

The solidarity group that Santos helped to organize plans to use the support from this loan to purchase livestock animals for upbringing and breeding, specifically, cows and pigs. Santos hopes, in the future, to open up a meat shop where she can sell high quality animal meats for consumption. The other group members also make a living raising, breeding and selling animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals for upbringing, breeding and resale.

loans.name: Olga Araminta

texts.es: Olga de 48 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de Mezapa Atlántida. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida, vende almuerzos por encargo. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años y le dedica todo el tiempo, atiende a sus clientes con el almuerzo de lunes a viernes y el sábado todo el día. Ella solicita un préstamo a ODEF  por 10,000 Lempiras para la compra de insumos como carnes, verduras, pollo, condimentos etc para la elaboración de comida. Con esta inversión espera obtener los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijos. Su meta es incrementar su clientela y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Olga, age 48, is a single mother with seven children.  She lives with them in the Mezapa Atlántida municipality.

She makes food, and she sells lunches by order.  She has had this business for six years, and she devotes all of her time to it.  She provides lunch to her customers on Mondays through Fridays, and all day on Saturday.

She is requesting a loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, chicken, and condiments, etc. in order to make the food.  With this investment she hopes to get the income that she needs to cover her children’s educational expenses.

Her goal is to increase her clientele and to have her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, rice, beans and other items to make the food to sell.

loans.name: Mario Eugenio

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 43 años, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en una comunidad del Municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte dentro y fuera de la ciudad a través de un taxi. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como motorista y futbolista.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 17000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de repuestos para la reparación del vehículo y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
En el futuro piensa invertir sus ganancias en la compra de otra unidad de transporte y establecer un nuevo negocio ofreciendo el servicio de soldadura.
texts.en:
Mario, 43, is married and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children in a community in the municipality of Tela in Atlántida Department.  He’s been offering taxi transportation services for the last 15 years both inside and outside the city.  He used to work as a driver and soccer player.

At present, he’s asking for a 17000 Lempira loan to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle so that he can offer better customer service.  In the future, he plans to invest his profits in the purchase of another car and to start a new welding service business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joyce will use the loan to buy fertilizer and a heifer. She will use the anticipated profit from the business to expand on tea farming. Joyce's hope and dream is to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a heifer.

loans.name: Soyibnazar

texts.ru: Сойибназар житель района Кубодиен. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дети учатся в школе. Образование у Сойибназара среднее. Он с 20 лет занимается животноводством. Раньше он занимался купле-продажей овец и коз. Вот уже пять лет как Сойибназар зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит телят и бычков у себя дома, и через трех-четырех месяцев продает по высокой цене. Сойибназар просит кредит для закупа телят. Также он хочет заняться посевом сельскохозяйственных культур.
texts.en:
Soyibnazar lives in the Qubadiyon area. He is 34 and married with four children. His wife stays at home, and his children go to school.
Soyibnazar has a high school diploma. He has been active in animal farming since he was 20. Soyibnazar used to buy and sell sheep and goats, but he has been been earning his living by raising cattle for the last five years. He breeds calves and bull calves on his farm and sells them for a high price 3-4 months later. 
Soyibnazar has requested a loan to buy calves. He also wants to plant crops.

loans.use: to buy calves and grow vegetables

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
El señor Jorge, tiene 57 años de edad,casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su esposa y  uno de sus hijos en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. 
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de taxi. El transporta personas de sus casas a sus trabajos, todos los días. Siempre se ha dedicado a este rubro y le ha ido muy bien, ha solicitado cinco préstamos para mantener esta actividad. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo que es por 20,000 Lempiras para la reparación del sistema de dirección y compra de llantas del taxi, para brindar un mejor servicio de seguridad a sus clientes. Con las ganancias tiene planeado comprar otro vehículo más para mejorar los ingresos familiares. Agradece a ODEF y  hoy a Kiva por el apoyo financiero que le brinda.
texts.en:
Jorge, 57, is married and has two children; he lives with his wife and one of his children in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  

He’s been providing taxi services for the last 15 years.  He transports people from their homes to work every day.  He’s always been in this line of work and has done very well.  He’s taken out five loans to support his activity.  He’s now asking for another loan for 20,000 Lempiras to repair the steering system and to buy tires for the taxi to provide better, safer customer service.  With profits obtained he plans to buy another car to improve his family income.  He thanks ODEF and now KIVA too for the financial support they provide him.

loans.use: to buy tires and repair steering system.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana tiene 58 años, es soltera, vive con sus dos hijas en una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas (refrescos, churros,agua y pastelitos de harina y carne). Ella se dedicaba  anteriormente a la venta de comida.
Doña Susana ha solicitado un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de agua, refrescos, harina de trigo, carne y condimentos para la preparación de los pastelitos.
Ella espera aumentar sus ventas con la inversión en la compra de mas productos, también confía en obtener un aumento en sus utilidades que le permitan apoyar a sus dos hijas en sus estudios y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana, 58, is single living with her two daughters in a community in the town of San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  For the last three years she’s been working selling snacks (soft-drinks, snacks, water and meat turnovers).  She used to sell food.

Susana is asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy water, soft-drinks, wheat flour, meat and condiments to make the turnovers.  She hopes to increase sales with the purchase of more products; she also trusts that her profits will increase so that she can support her two daughters with their schooling and continue growing in business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es: Jenny, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su pareja y su hijo. Ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de joyas de plata, perfumes y pantalones jeans. Jenny es una persona emprendedora, atiende su hogar, el negocio y sus estudios. Quiere superarse, por eso ha solicitado este préstamo que es por 5,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar joyas de plata como aretes, anillos, pulseras y cadenas, que le han pedido sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza por pedidos. Con este préstamo aumentara las ventas y sus ingresos, además iniciara una línea crediticia con la institución. Su plan es llegar a tener una tienda, construir apartamentos y vivir de la renta en el futuro, pero antes quiere terminar sus estudios y  tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jenny, 29, lives in Tela, Atlántida with her spouse and son.  She’s been selling silver jewelry, perfume and jeans for three years.  Jenny is an enterprising person who tends to her home, her business and her studies.  She wants to improve which is why she’s requested this loan for 5000 Lempiras to buy silver jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets and chains her customers have requested.  She sells based on prior orders.  With this loan she will increase sales and income and will start a line of credit with the institution.  Her plan is to someday have a store, to build apartments to live in and rent in the future but before all this she wants to finish her studies and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El Señor Bernardino tiene 41 años de edad, está casado, tiene 1 hijo, reside con su familia en una  Comunidad del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortés.
Bernardino laboraba en la empresa privada y debido a que en dicha empresa hubo recorte de personal, él obtuvo sus prestaciones laborales las cuales invirtió en una pulpería.
En su negocio vende productos de consumo familiar como granos básicos (maíz, arroz y frijoles), lácteos, golosinas, medicamentos de uso común, refrescos y productos de higiene personal.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 14,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir surtiendo más su negocio. Él espera crecer en sus ventas ya que dedica 15 horas diarias atendiendo a su clientela.
texts.en:
Bernardino, age 41, is married and has one child.  He lives with his family in a community in the San Pedro Sula municipality in Cortés.
Bernardino used to work for a private company.  Due to the fact that said company had a reduction in its workforce, he got his employment benefits and used them to invest in a small grocery store.

In his business he sells products for family consumption like basic foods (corn, rice, and beans), dairy products, candy, commonly used medicines, soft drinks, and personal hygiene products.

He has currently requested a loan for 14,000 lempiras.  He plans on using the loan to better stock his business.  He hopes that his sales will grow inasmuch as he devotes 15 hours a day tending to his clientele.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his business.

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es:
Aura es una persona muy trabajadora, muy felíz, le gusta ser muy responsable y es carismática. Aura vive solo con sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Aura tiene un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado, negocio que lo lleva por 10 años y que le ha ayudado a sustentar las necesidades de su familia. Aura ha solicitado un crédito a Fodemi con el objetivo de comprar un congelador para que los alimentos no se le dañen y para comprar víveres para el puesto de comida, toda esta inversión servirá a Aura para poder atenderles bien a sus clientes.

Aura sueña en obtener buenos ingresos para en futuro cercano poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Aura is a very hard-working, very happy person.  She likes to be very responsible and she is charismatic.  Aura lives on her own with her three children in the city of Ibarra.

Aura has a food stall in the market.  She has run her business for 10 years, and it has helped her to meet her family's needs.  Aura has requested a loan from Fodemi with the objective of purchasing a freezer so her food doesn't spoil and to purchase provisions for her food stall.  Both investments will help her to better serve her customers. 

Aura dreams of earning a better income to, in the near future, build her own home.

loans.use: with the purchase of a freezer so her food doesn't spoil and with the purchase of provisions for her food stand.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 53-year-old conservative married woman who has four sons. She asked one of them to take her place in the photo. Two of Amneh's sons have their own jobs, and one of them is studying while working. He has registered himself at the university to get a Masters degree, Amneh wants to support her son, so she chose to apply for this loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is from the Senaki district, West Georgia. She is 52 years old and lives with her 13-year-old son, who goes to the local school. Nunu works as a teacher and earns a monthly salary. She is involved in an agricultural business. She owns a plot of land, where she grows nuts, maize and laurel leaves.  In addition, Nunu runs a small dairy farm and has two milk cows and 2 calves. She milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese. She sells her agricultural products at the local open market. Nunu is a very hardworking woman, with a rich experience in her work.

Nunu has requested a loan to set up a grain mill. Her mill will serve the local farmers and crush the grains. Nunu will get a service fee, which will increase the family's income. Nunu will renovate her old and damaged house with the increased income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to set up a grain mill

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 47-year-old widow who started to sell housewares and kitchenware to support herself after her husband passed away, almost two years ago. She now has a few customers, mainly neighbors and friends, since her business is based at home, which makes it hard for some to reach. She has decided to work on increasing her profits so she can open her own store in the near future. Maryam has applied for this loan to bring in more products to sell.

loans.use: to bring in more products to sell.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marcelline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marcelline est âgée de 64 ans et est mariée à un certain Elias. Le couple a huit enfants, dont aucun scolarisé. Marcelline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Marcelline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Marcelline exerce comme activité, la vente des glacières et des ustensiles de cuisine dans un marché du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Marcelline désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Marcelline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUGNON group is made up of three members who live in the same house.  The group's representative, Marcelline, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  

It is the third time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase the level of its activity.

Marcelline is 64 years old and married to a man named Elias.  Marcelline and Elias have eight children, none of whom are currently attending school.  Marcelline lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household's various needs.

Marcelline never went to school.  For the past ten years or so, she has been selling iceboxes and kitchen utensils at a market in Benin, an activity which allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty.

As she would like to better meet her customers' needs, Marcelline is hoping to strengthen and diversify her activity.  In order to do so, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAHUGNON group.  The group's first two loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy iceboxes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking 39-year-old businessman. He is a wholesaler. He supplies commodities to shops to make a living. He has engaged in this business for three years and has employed one person. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business because he has been trained on business management. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy cooking oil, sugar and soft drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! El grupo “Sagitario” es un grupo formado por
7 socios y que está empezando su octavo ciclo. Una de sus miembros es Antonia, que se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.

Antonia tiene una larga experiencia en esta actividad, que empezó hace 19 años. La zona donde vive es una zona rural y es una zona donde hay muchas chancherías. Chancherías son lugares donde se crían cerdos. Como Antonia no tiene suficiente espacio es su casa, renta un área en una chanchería para así poder crear sus cerdos, que pasados 3 o 4 meses vende.

Antonia va a utilizar su préstamo en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus cerdos y está muy contenta por haberlo obtenido.

Antonia es casada y vive con su esposo e hijo. Ella es la señora que habla en el video, que está en el medio de la primera fila. ¡Antonia agradece el apoyo brindado!
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

The “Sagitario” (Sagittarius) communal bank has 7 members who are starting their 8th cycle.  One of the members is Antonia who raises pigs.  Antonia has vast experience in this line of work; she started 19 years ago.

The area she lives in is rural and there are many ‘chancherías’ there.  Chancherías are places where pigs are raised.  Because Antonia does not have enough space at home, she rents space in a chanchería to raise her pigs in.  She sells them after three or four months.

Antonia will use her loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pits and she’s very happy to have gotten it.  Antonia is married and lives with her husband and son.  She is the woman who speaks in the video.  She’s in the center of the first row.  Antonia is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día; también es dueño de un vehículo que trabaja como taxi el cual le entrega rentas diarias y de esta manera le alcanza para  cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra y  cambio de motor de su vehículo, pues es un poco antiguo y necesita un motor en mejor estado, lo cual  le será de mucha ayuda por que es su fuente adicional de ingresos.
El sueño de David es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
David’s single and does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house occupying a single, small room.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Cotahuma zone.

He earns income as an employee in a private firm; he works more than 8 hours daily.  He also owns a car that he puts to work as a taxi and it earns him a daily rental fee. He’s able to pay for his food and basic utility costs this way.
