The loan he needs is to buy a new motor to replace the one currently in his taxi because it’s a bit old and he needs a motor that’s in better condition which will be of great help to him since this is his additional source of income.

David’s dream is to improve his income in order to be able to become independent because he’d like to have more comfort and improve his quality of life.  This is his second loan with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a motor that's in better shape for his taxi.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old, a single lady and blessed with one child. She has been running a restaurant for the past eleven years, with a  monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mercy will use the loan to buy food items such as baking flour, sugar, soft drinks for use in the restaurant. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will invest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy food items such as baking flour, sugar, soft drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 41-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for seventeen years. Wilson has profitably been able to use his meager salary to buy land and to pay school fees for his children, one of whom has now graduated from university. He also has a retail shop to supplement his salary. Wilson faces hardships of customers not paying on time, a low salary, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are to educate his children and to build a permanent home; his business goal is to expand into new markets. Wilson is requesting a loan to buy building materials for construction for his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for construction for his house.

loans.name: Ndiang Montagne Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Ndiang Montagne existe depuis le 15 décembre 2008; le groupe PC 01 est constitué de dix huit femmes qui sont amies, parentes, voisines et ont comme lien commun le commerce.

L'emprunteur vedette madame Coumba est âgée de 55 ans, elle est veuve mère de cinq enfants dont le plus jeune a 23 ans, une de ses filles est mariée. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce d'articles divers et capitalise une bonne expérience de 4 ans, elle a démarré avec son premier financement reçu de Caurie. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite à l'extrême habillée en grand boubou jaune fleurettes et a levé la main gauche.


Coumba s'approvisionne en marchandises(écharpes, chaussures, pochettes....)pour  revendre dans son quartier en faisant du porte à porte et à domicile.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des tissus khartoum 100000 F, chaussures 30000 F, pochettes 30000 F; les frais de transport et divers vont constituer son apport.


Les bénéfices servent à épargner, participer un peu aux dépenses; les charges de la famille incombent à ses enfants qui sont tous majeurs.
texts.en:
The "Banc Villageois" Ndjang Montagne exists since December 15, 2008; the group PC 01 consists of 18 women who are friends, relatives, neighbors and have as a common link shopkeeping.

The featured borrower Coumba is 55 years old. She is a widow and mother to five children of whom the youngest is 23 years old. One of her daughters is married. She manages a business selling diverse items and capitalizes on a good experience of 4 years. She started with her first loan received from Caurie. In the photo, she is standing on the far right dressed in a large yellow boubou with flowers and is raising her left hand.

Coumba gets her merchandise (scarves, shoes, clutch bags...) to resell it in her neighborhood by selling door-to-door and from her home.

Her loan will allow her to buy 100,000 F of Khartoum fabric, 30,000 F of shoes, 30,000 F of clutch bags; transportation costs and miscellaneous expenses will make up her contribution.

The profits serve to save, and participate a bit in the expenses; the expenses of the family are the responsibility of her children who are all adults.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and clutch bags to resell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Hace tres años que Luis, estableció su propio taller de zapatería donde brinda el servicio de confección y reparación de zapatos de todo tipo. el taller lo tiene establecido en una casa de su hermano dedicándole todo el día. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió ejercer su oficio de zapatería. ha mantenido el taller mediante inversión de préstamos que ha solicitado a ODEF, actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo que es por 16,000 Lempiras para utilizarlo en la compra de materia prima como suela, cuero, suelas, hilos, pegamentos, agujas y otros para realizar los trabajos pendientes de zapatería e incrementar la producción.  Su meta es seguir creciendo hasta llegar a tener un taller fuerte y expandirlo mas, así poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 29, lives in suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his wife and two children.  Luis opened his own shoe repair shop three years ago; he provides shoemaking and shoe repair services for all types of shoes.  His workshop is in his brother’s house and he spends all day in it.  He used to work at an assembly plant and when he became unemployed he decided to practice his occupation as a cobbler.  

He’s stayed in business thanks to ODEF loans.  He’s currently requesting his third loan for 16,000 Lempiras to buy raw materials like soles, leather, thread, glue, needles and others to do his pending cobbler jobs and to increase production.  His goal is to continue growing until having a strong workshop and expand it more to move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shoe repair shop.

loans.name: Playeritas De Chua Caicoto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLAYERITAS DE CHUA CAICOTO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dominga es la Elsa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de camas y pesca, costura de deportivos, constructor  y pesca, venta de cerveza, venta de camas y animales, tejido de mantas, costura de busos deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene negocios de cultivo y tejido de camas, mismo que aprendió y desarrollo desde sus quince años de edad gracias a la enseñanza de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar el negocio (compra de lanas) mismo que comprará de las ferias provinciales del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido, todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, A.C. "Chua PLAYERITAS CAICOTO," will begin their first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana.  The group has eight members and is headed by a board where la señora is Elsa. The members of the communal bank have varied businesses such as: woven beds and fishing, athletic clothing, construction and fishing,selling beer, selling beds and animals, blanket weaving, and diving sport clothing.

The requested loan will be used to benefit micro-businesses where Elsa is a member.  Elsa indicates that it is her first time with Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a promoter of the institution that came to her house to invite her. At present, Elsa has a business making and weaving beds.  She learned and worked since she was fifteen tears old thanks to her mother's teaching.

The requested loan will be used to expand the business (by purchasing wool) that she will buy in the the local markets in the Department of La Paz.  Afterwards she will market the beds to order every day.  This workflow allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elsa says that she likes the health training and loans.

loans.use: to buy beds.

loans.name: Suma Pancara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA PANCARA” iniciará el ciclo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mery es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de lana de alpaca, venta de fruta, venta de peluches, venta de pantalones, venta de pan, venta de ropa, costura de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mery es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, ella cuenta que este negocio lo inicio por el incentivo unas amigas hace varios años 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de las comerciantes que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Suma Pancara” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Cascada.  It is made up of eight members and guided by a board or directors.  Señora Mery is the secretary of the board of directors.  The members' businesses are varied and include: selling alpaca wool, fruit sales, stuffed toy sales, selling pants, selling bread, clothing sales and sewing t-shirts. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Mery is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of her friend, who is a member of the institution.  Señora Mery currently has a business selling clothing.  She says that she started her business when she was motivated by some friends a few years ago. 

Señora Mery is taking out the loan to increase her capital.  She will purchase clothing from the wholesalers and then re-sell it from her sales stall.  This form of work has allowed her to generate enough income to support her family as much as possible; she is divorced and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Mery says that she likes the health classes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Jorge Anibal

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 53 años, se destaca por ser una persona emprendedora, responsable con su trabajo y es muy feliz lo que le ha permitido tener varios clientes. Jorge vive con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Jorge tiene una mecánica en la cual repara vehículos y motos, el empezó como ayudante hace 17 años pero ahora con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su propia mecánica, Jorge necesita que su negocio se mantenga y este a disposición de sus clientes por mucho tiempo es por eso que realiza un crédito en Fodemi el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de repuestos, accesorios para motos y herramientas que necesita en su mecánica.

Jorge sueña en tener un almacen donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de repuestos y accesorios y obtener buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, 53, stands out for being an enterprising person who is responsible with his work; he’s very happy because this has led him to have many customers.  Jorge lives with his wife and children in the city of Ibarra.

Jorge has a repair shop where he repairs cars and motorcycles.  He started out 17 years ago as a helper but now with much effort has managed to have his own shop.  Jorge needs to stay in business and be at his customers’ service for a long time which is why he’s taking out a loan from Fodemi to buy motorcycles spare parts and accessories and tools he needs in his shop.

Jorge dreams with having a warehouse where he can sell all types of spare parts and accessories and earn good income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice growing business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 2 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be an energetic, social and humble man. 

He operates a retail business where he provides bicycle repair services. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located near a viable busy road with many motorcycle owners and his primary customers are motorcycle and bicycle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be local authorities’ disturbance. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts. His business goal is to run a motorcycle and bicycle spare parts retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standard of his family with profits he will have earned from the business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is a 50-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been engaged in their fishing business for more than 20 years. Her husband fishes, and she sells the catch in the market.

Marlina works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. As of this time, she needs additional funds for her business. She is requesting a loan of 8,000PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. 

Marlina hopes to make her business a success. The income generated from the venture will be used to finance the family's daily needs, to reinvest in the business and to save.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Brisas” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de confort, venta de pan amasado, venta de ensaladas, venta de artesanía en goma eva, venta de churrascos, venta de pasteles, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Mónica integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el quinto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón de color negro, chaqueta de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro lo usa suelto y largo. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de maravillas (semillas, en el cual se pueden utilizar de diferentes formas en aceite, o alimento de animales o consumible por el humano) desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa donde tuesta y envasa la maravilla para la venta, se dedica de  lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para la venta de las semillas de maravilla las compra en distribuidoras, y para envasar las semillas compra bolsas en los supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente semillas de maravillas.
Una de las metas de Mónica es comprar algunos productos como helados, además de la venta de maravillas, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Mónica vive junto a su marido y dos hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es agrandar su negocio y crecer como una microempresaria y cada vez agregar otros productos para la venta, así darle una buena estabilidad de vida su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Las Brisas. It comprises seventeen entrepreneurs who work in different trades, which include selling bath tissue, "pan amasado" (a Chilean homemade bread), salads, EVA foam crafts, steak sandwiches, pastries, and other services. They all belong to the city of Talca.

Mónica is one of the members of this communal bank. In the picture she is the fifth person from the right, wearing black pants and a black jacket, with brown long hair. She has worked selling sunflower seeds for one year. These seeds can be used in different ways: to make oil, to feed animals, or for human consumption. She says she works from home, where she roasts the sunflower seeds and packs them for sale. She works Monday through Sunday and distributes her schedule according to her availability.

She buys whatever merchandise and supplies she needs to sell her sunflower seeds from distributors, and at the supermarket she buys low-cost bags to pack the seeds, which are the most affordable.

She will use the loan only to purchase sunflower seeds.

One of Mónica's goals is to purchase some items, such as ice cream, to sell in addition to the sunflower seeds and generate more income so that she may access a better quality of life.

Mónica lives with her husband and their two children, who are sixteen and nine and are in school. On a business level, her dreams are to expand her business and grow as a microentrepreneur by adding more and more products to sell so that she can offer her family good stability in life.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her, because it has allowed her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable around the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group, because they share different activities and interests, and that provides some leisure. As far as the trainings offered at the meetings, they have helped her manage her business better.

Talca belongs to the Maule region, located in the central area of the country. It constitutes the administrative, financial, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city of Chile's central valley. In Chile, there is a curious saying about Talca: "Talca, París y Londres" (Talca, Paris, and London). Among the myths explaining this, some say it is derived from something originally said by an Englishman: "Talca parece Londres" (Talca looks like London) on account of the fog that frequently covers the city during the winter season, as it does in the capital of the United Kingdom. (Both phrases sound virtually the same in Spanish).

loans.use: to purchase sunflower seeds.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Desde hace 30 años Antonio se ha dedicado a producir café junto con su familia, primero al lado de su padre y sus hermanos y después al lado de su esposa Enedina, con quien está casado desde hace 25 años y con quien tiene tres hijas, una de las cuales ya está casada. El se encarga personalmente de realizar todos los trabajos en su finca y su esposa e hijas lo ayudan. Durante la temporada de cosecha contrata a una o dos personas para que lo ayuden pues es cuando hay más trabajo por realizar. Antonio está por recibir en estos días la certificación de café orgánico ya que anteriormente su producción era de café convencional pero ha ido realizando desde hace algunos años las tareas necesarias para que esto sea posible. Durante la última cosecha Antonio tuvo una producción de ocho toneladas y para la dentro de dos años planea llegar a un total de doce toneladas. Para lograr su meta es necesario que compre fertilizante orgánico para sus plantas y por eso el solicita un crédito. Antonio nos platico que en las temporadas en que no hay mucho trabajo que hacer en las fincas se dedica a manejar un taxi para así obtener ingresos extra para su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio and his family have worked growing coffee for 30 years first alongside his father and brothers and then alongside his wife, Enedina, who he’s been married to for 25 years and with whom he has three daughters one of which is already married.

He does all the work in the plantation himself and his wife and daughters help him.  During harvest season he hires one or two people to help him because that’s when there is the most work to do.  

Antonio is about to get his organic coffee certification in a few days because he used to grow conventional coffee but for the last few years has been doing the necessary tasks to change over.  Antonio’s last crop yield was 8 tons and he hopes in two more years that it will go up to 12 tons.  

To reach his goals he must buy organic fertilizer for his plants and this is why he’s requested the loan.  Antonio related that during the time when there’s not much to do on the farm he works driving a taxi in order to earn extra family income.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Otgontsend

texts.en:
Mr. Otgontsend is 57 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the uptown ger (traditional Mongolian tent home) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife's name is Enkhtaivan, and she helps with his coal trade business. His three children all attend school and the oldest one lives separately. 

He has been running the family coal and firewood trade business for more than ten years. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. His town residents appreciate him as a cheerful and friendly person. 

He is requesting a 6,500,000 MNT loan to install a heating system for his house. The ger district is not connected with the public heating system in Ulaanbaatar City, where the peak cold weather reaches minus 40 degrees.

loans.use: to install a heating system for his house.

loans.name: Latifeh

texts.en:
Latifeh is a 56-year-old conservative married woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the photo.

Latifeh wishes for her son to complete his studies and get his BA degree. Now that he is majoring in economics, she wants to support him and pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Wangui

texts.en:
Wangui is 34 years old and married to Maso. They are blessed with two children, ages 17 and two years old. She has been in business for one year and earns KES5,500. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more animals for fattening and to sell later at a profit. The anticipated profit she gets will be used to expand her business.

Her dream is to educate her children and to better her family life.

loans.use: To purchase animals for fattening and to sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon, 42 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai. His oldest child is a secondary school student and his youngest son goes to kindergarten. Over the last ten years he has been operating a plastic, can, and glass scrap business out of his garage. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. This business is a green business, and his monthly profit is around 500,000-1,000,000MNT. 

He wants to buy more products, which he will then sell to increase his business income as well as profit. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more product for his recycled materials trading business. He is a hardworking, creative, and aggressive man.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his recycled materials trading business

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en: Qasem is a 20-year-old single guy living with his family of ten members. He is attending the university to get his BA degree in Psychology. Qasem wants to start depending on himself to decrease the financial pressure on his family. For that reason, he has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his registration and semester fees

loans.name: Purew

texts.en: Mr. Purew is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. In 2003, Mr. Purew started his local and urban passenger transit service by minibus. He upgraded his vehicle to an autobus in 2010 and has already gained recognition from his clients and customers. Since 2010, his wife has planted organic vegetables in their back yard and then sells them in the local market. Now his wife is planning to sell the organic vegetables in the Ulaanbaatar market, where the prices are higher. They bought a new jeep with their business profit in 2012. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to harvest his wife's organic vegetables and transport them to the Ulaanbaatar market. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: To harvest his wife's organic vegetables and transport them to the Ulaanbaatar market

loans.name: Flores De Bergel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE BERGEL” iniciará el primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Senia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa interior, salón de peinados, venta de puertas, costura de chamarras, venta de verduras, venta de pasacalles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Senia es una integrante, ella indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus amigas quienes son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, mismo que aprendió de un negocio anterior al que apoyaba, emprendiendo posteriormente su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en la en su espacio de comercialización todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Bergel" communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of its Senkata regional office. This group is composed of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Senia is the president. The businesses that the communal bank's members run are varied, but among them are a neighborhood store, underwear sales, a hair salon, door sales, jacket-making, vegetable sales, and banner sales.

The loan that they will receive will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, like Senia. Senia indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of her friends, who are members of the institution. Currently, she has a neighborhood shop. She learned how to run a neighborhood shop from a previous business that she helped out with, launching her own business subsequently.

The loan that she is now requesting is to increase her capital to buy rice, sugar, and oil. She will buy them from wholesalers and later offer them for sale in her sales location every day. This line of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Senia responds that she likes saving money.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Los Alamos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ALAMOS” iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladys es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos de belleza, venta de edredones, tienda de barrio, fabricación de estantes, transportista, costura de deportivos, elaboración de pan, ropa para niños, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladys es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella cuenta que hace varios años ella era la consumidora de estos productos y posteriormente ella decide emprender esta actividad por recomendación de su hermana y su tía. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de productos de belleza) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el incentivo y el ánimo que dan.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Juana ya que se fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The community bank “Los Alamos” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the organization's regional office in Villa Exaltación.  The group is comprised of eleven members and is overseen by a board of directors, of which Gladys is the president.  The community bank members are involved in a variety of businesses, including the sale of beauty products, sports clothes, children's clothing, quilts, and furniture.  Other businesses include shelf-building, taxi services, bread-making and a neighborhood shop.

This loan will benefit the small microbusinesses of these entrepreneurs, including that of Gladys.  She reports that this is the group's first time working with Pro Mujer.  She was invited by her sister-in-law, who is a member of Pro Mujer.  Currently she has a business selling beauty products.  She says that for several years she was a consumer of these products, and eventually she decided to learn the business upon the recommendation of her sister and her aunt.

She is seeking this loan in order to increase her working capital and purchase beauty products. She will buy these items from distributors and then sell them door-to-door.  This will enable her to generate income to support her family in the best way possible, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the motivation and positive atmosphere that the group provides.

Note: Juana, another member, was unable to be present due to a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es una joven de 21 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee lugares muy bellos los cuales son muy visitados por mucho turistas en todo el año como las Islas ballestas, el candelabro de paracas; asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, pallares, entre otros. Soledad aprendió a trabajar desde muy pequeña, por ello y debido a los pocos recursos económicos ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Día a día Soledad trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es amable con los clientes y también porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Soledad está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores para colocar sus productos y exhibirlos de mejor manera, así ella podrá ofrecer mejor sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Soledad, 21, is a young woman living in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its very hot, welcoming climate.  It also has beautiful places that are visited year-round by tourists like the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum.  Agriculture is common here too, especially growing cotton, corn and lima beans, among others.  

Soledad learned how to work when she was still little.  Because of that and because of her family’s limited economic resources she only studied up to 5th grade of secondary school but would have liked to have studied nursing.

Soledad works day to day in her small business selling beauty products.  She spends about 9 hours daily at work and can tend to up to 15 customers daily.  She believes she does well at work because she’s kind to customers and also because she has a strong drive to get ahead.

Soledad is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they are giving her she will be able to buy display cases to exhibit her wares in a better way.  In this way she will be able to better display her products and improve her income which will make it possible for her to continue working very hard to make her greatest dream a reality: to own a house and to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 36 years old and is married to Kijoolu. They are blessed with one child who is two years. He has been buying and selling animals for one year, with an income of KES5,500 monthly. 

This is his  first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase more animals for fattening and then selling at a profit. The profit he makes he will use to educate his children. His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more animals for fattening

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina lives in Armavir town with her 15-year-old son, Lyova. She runs a salon, where she trades in perfumes and provides cosmetology services. Marina started this business ten years ago. 

Marina would like to improve conditions in her salon, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the help of this loan she will purchase special chairs for makeup services. In addition, she plans to purchase perfumes for the salon. 

Marina dreams of founding a big hairdressing salon with a large variety of services. This loan will help her to develop the business and gather additional income, which she plans to invest in further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to pay for perfumes and chairs for her salon.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 30 years old and single. He lives with a family of nine members, four of whom are employed. 

Bahaa owns a pastry shop. He specializes in Arabic sweets. He established his business in 2007 and now he has one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,700 Youth Loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg, 50, works as a watchman in the common apartment.  Her husband, Galbadrakh, is a taxi driver and he makes crafts and sells them to the customers in the bazaar for extra earnings. 

Narantsetseg lives with her family in an old house which was built many years ago. The house has a heat loss and emission through its walls and some other parts. In winter they feel very cold and use the coal-fired stove to stay warm at home. 

Before this winter, she wants to repair her house and make wall insulation to it. As she told us, “It will be very beneficial to reduce my cost of coal purchasing. Yet, it will be healthful to the environment (if) I could reduce the coal usage in winter.”

The loan she is taking will be used to buy the insulation materials such as the foam, cement, etc. to make the wall insulation to her old house before the winter.

loans.use: to make wall insulation to her old house before the winter.

loans.name: Miraly

texts.ru: Мирали 49 лет. Он женат. Его жену зовут Латофат. Мирали на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 года назад он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей женской и детской одежды. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У него тонкий вкус и он умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все его достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет его быть внимательным и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Он должен купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки товара для нового сезона. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en: Miraly is 49 years old, married.  His wife's name is Latofat.  Miraly is raising three children.  In order to provide his family with all of the necessities, he started his own business of buying and selling women's and children's clothing four years ago.  His efficiency helps him to be successful in the business.  He sells his merchandise at a local market and has a large circle of customers.  He has intricate taste and can choose merchandise, which will be in high demand.  Despite all of his strengths, a powerful competition of the business world forces him to be attentive and renew his merchandise every season.  Miraly must purchase merchandise for the new season, but does not have enough means to do so.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase merchandise for the new season.  He awaits your kindness.  Let's help him uphold his motivation among businessmen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for the new season

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридуну 19 лет. Он очень талантливый и успешный студент. Фаридун учится на 2 курсе Медицинского Колледжа фармацевтического отдела. Он очень упорно учится и хочет стать хорошим фармацевтом и служить своему народу. Он живет с родителями. Зарплата его родителей не хватает, чтобы оплатить за учебу в колледже. Фаридун запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы. Будущий фармацевт ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Faridun is 19 years old.  He is a very talented and successful student.  Faridun is a second-year student at the pharmaceutical department of the Medical College.  He studies very diligently and wants to become a good pharmacist and serve his people.  He lives with his parents.  The parents' salary is not enough to pay for his college education.  Faridun is requesting a loan to pay for his education.  The future pharmacist awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his college education

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy furniture for her sales location.

loans.name: Soninbayar

texts.en:
Soninbayar, who is 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife's name is Byambasuren, and she is 40 years old. His two youngest children are school students and his oldest son is a college student. 

Soninbayar has conducted a taxi and public transportation business since 2003 and is recognized in the local market for his work in this business. In 2011, he built a house with his business profit. Now, Soninbayar is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a furnace and insulation for his house. He is an honest, hardworking, and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase a furnace and insulation for his house.

loans.name: Musulmonkul

texts.ru: Мусулмонкул всегда старается выполнить свои задачи во время и поэтому он является одним из успешных работников. Ему 46 лет, он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его дети Олим, Субхия, Шукрона очень умные и послушные, им 16, 13 и 3 года. Его жена Рухшона является домохозяйкой. Мунсулмонкул работает бухгалтером в организации и получает маленькую зарплату. Его зарплата не хватает для ремонта дома. Мусулмонкул планирует заменить окна, двери, сделать фасадную штукатурку и устройство пола и потолка. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 1800 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Musulmonkul always tries to complete his tasks on-time, and this is why he is one of the successful workers.  He is 46 years old, married and raising three children.  His children, Olim, Subhiya and Shukrona, are very smart and well-behaved.  They are 16, 13 and 3 years old.  His wife, Ruhshona, is a homemaker.  Musulmonkul works as an accountant at an organization and earns a small salary.  His salary is not enough to repair his house.  Musulmonkul plans to replace the windows, doors, apply plaster to the facade and repair floors and ceilings.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1800 to purchase construction materials.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and repair his house

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. Сын Ойгул находится за рубежом. Сама она занимается животноводством. Вот уже десять лет как Ойгул занимается купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Она просит кредит для закупа крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить поголовья и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Oygul lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 49 years old, married.  Her son is abroad.  Oygul is involved in animal husbandry.  She has been involved in buying and selling cattle for ten years.  Oygul is requesting this loan to buy cattle and small livestock in order to increase livestock headcount and make a larger profit.

loans.use: to buy cattle and small livestock in order to increase livestock headcount and make a larger profit

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg is 44 and lives with her family in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For the past 11 years, she has been working nonstop as a cook. Since 2008, Uranchimeg has been building a new family house in her plot of land but has not been able to complete it due to the shortage of money.

Uranchimeg is requesting a loan to pay for and install a water-heated furnace in her new house. She says it will be very important to cut her usage of harmful coal for heating.

loans.use: to pay for a water-heated furnace for her home

loans.name: Bat-Amgalan

texts.en:
Bat-Amgalan is 33 and an economist. He graduated university in 2000 and recently became employed. Bat-Amgalan lives with his family in a common apartment with two rooms in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In winter his apartment becomes cold and hard to heat due to heat escaping through his out-dated windows. His children always get sick due to their cold home. His family has not repaired or renovated their apartment since they moved in many years ago. 

Bat-Amgalan is requesting a loan to replace his old windows with double-glazed ones. He said that “it will be very useful and healthy to his family members." Bat-Amgalan's loan will be used to cover the cost of the new double glazed windows to improve his family house.

loans.use: to replace his old windows with double-glazed ones and renovate his family home

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розие 46 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 24 лет она работает медсестрой. Розия очень любит и гордится своей профессией. Ее дочь Азима окончила среднюю школу и хочет поступить в Медицинский Колледж. Азима хочет стать успешной медсестрой и продолжать работу матери. Зарплата Розии не хватает для оплаты учебы дочери в колледже. Розия запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы дочери. Розия и Азима ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Roziya is 46 years old.  She is married and raising four children.  She has been working as a nurse for over 24 years.  Roziya loves her profession very much and is proud of it.  Her daughter, Azima, finished a secondary school and wants to go to the Medical College.  Azima wants to become a successful nurse and continue her mother's work.  Roziya's salary is not enough to pay for her daughter's college education.  Roziya is requesting this loan to pay for her daughter's education.  Roziya and Azima await your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education at the medical college

loans.name: Edwin Jesus

texts.es:
Franco es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, algodón, paprika, entre otros, posee atractivos turísticos muy visitados como la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy amables. Franco es un joven que aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente desde pequeño, ya que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos.

Día a día franco trabaja como chofer de taxi, con lo cual apoya con los gastos de su hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy cuidadoso al conducir.

Franco está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, asimismo para realizar una bajada de motor para poder raparlo ya que ha tenido continuas averías; con esta mejora el podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y con más seguridad y podrá seguir trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar un nuevo carro y tener un gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Franco is a young 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica. Ica is known for its warm climate as well as for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of asparagus, cotton, and paprika, among others. Ica has popular tourist attractions like the Huacachina Lagoon, and its inhabitants are very nice people. 

Franco is a young man who learned to earn his living by the sweat of his brow from the time he was little, because his parents didn't have much in the way of economic resources and he needed to help out.

Day after day, Franco works as a taxi driver and helps out with the household expenses. He works around ten hours per day and he can serve up to twenty customers a day. He believes that he is doing well in his work because he is very pleasant with his customers and above all because he is a very careful driver.

Franco is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to carry out general maintenance on his vehicle, as well as to take out the engine to repair it since he has been having continual breakdowns. With this improvement, he will be able to have a vehicle that is in good condition, with greater security. He will be abe to keep working very hard to make his greatest dream into a reality: "to buy a new car and have a big business."

loans.use: to perform general maintenance on his vehicle, and to repair the engine.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a 23-year-old man. He is married and a father to one daughter.

Montaser is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies but needs a loan to pay the university fees, so he is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for him and improve his family's living conditions. 

Montaser is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Basem owns a car repairing shop. He specializes in repairing car bodies. He established his business in 2005. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Basem is requesting a loan of $3000 to buy a machine specialized for his work and install rolling shutters and an external ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his work and install rolling shutters and an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Ibrodan Group

texts.fr: Groupe de solidarité composé d’hommes et de femmes, l’Association IBRODAN est située dans la région centrale du Togo et a pour président Atchou. Père de famille de six enfants dont cinq scolarisés, Atchou est mariée à une ménagère et est âgé de 48 ans. Son premier fils est âgé de 14 ans et le dernier de 03 ans. Son activité se porte principalement sur la culture du maïs et du haricot et ceci depuis les années 1980 dans la région centrale. Il est aussi épaulé par cinq employés et trois membres de sa famille dans l’exercice de ses fonctions. Atchou est à son premier cycle de crédit auprès de WAGES. Ce crédit lui servira à l’achat des outils de travail plus performant et à l’amélioration de la qualité de son travail. Il souhaite ainsi constituer assez d’épargne et augmenter sa superficie cultivable, aussi son rêve est de construire une maison en dur pour sa famille. Les autres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs et du haricot.
texts.en:
The "Association IBRODAN" is a solidarity group made up of men and women.  It is located in the central region of Togo and its president is Atchou.

Atchou is the father of six children, five of whom attend school.  He is 48 years old and married to a homemaker.  His first-born son is 14 years old and the youngest is 3.

Atchou essentially grows maize and beans.  He has been involved in this activity since the 1980s, in the central region.  Five employees and three members of his family help him to carry out his duties.

This is his first loan cycle with WAGES.  He will use his loan to buy better tools and to improve his work conditions.

While Atchou hopes to save enough money to increase the surface area of his arable land, his dream is to build a house with concrete walls, for his family.  The other members of the group also grow maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy working tools.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar, 44, runs a grocery store in her backyard. She lives with her husband and 3 children in a traditional nomadic yurt in Darkhan, ger district, Mongolia. Her husband Batsukh works as a watchman in the primary school and his salary is quite low. 

For 8 years, she has been operating her store and her daily earnings are approximately $10-13. Her business already has some regular customers and she has gained a lot of experience. 

This time Otgonbayar is requesting a loan to increase the stock in her store for a larger sales volume. It is important to increase her business to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her store for a larger sales volume.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is applying for his second loan with KADET, LTD. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Stanley will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his farming business. His hopes and dreams are to expand the farming business and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Groupement Rjr

texts.fr: Cultivateur de profession, Eyabane est le Président de l’Association RJR composé uniquement du genre masculin. Âgé de 41 ans, Eyabane est marié à une ménagère et est père de famille de trois enfants dont deux sont encore sur les bancs de l’école. L’ainé est âgé de 14 ans et le plus jeune a 03 ans. L’activité de Eyabane se porte principalement sur la culture du maïs, du sorgho et du haricot et ceci depuis vingt deux  ans. Il est aidé dans l’exerce de ses fonctions par deux membres de sa famille et  six employés. Pour augmenter sa production, il sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des outils plus performant nécessaire à son activité. Ainsi ces revenus supplémentaires lui serviront à assez d’épargne pour son avenir. Aussi, il compte pour l’avenir augmenter ses superficies cultivables et construire une maison pour ses enfants. La culture du maïs  constitue l’activité des autres membres du groupement.
texts.en:
Eyabane is a professional farmer and the president of the "Association RJR", which only comprises male members.  He is 41 years old, married to a homemaker, and the father of three children.  Two of his children are still in school.  Eyabane's oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is 3.

Eyabane essentially grows maize, sorghum and beans, an activity he has been involved in for the past 22 years.  Two members of his family and six employees help him to carry out his duties.

In order to boost his crop production, he is requesting a loan from WAGES.  He will use this loan to buy better tools, necessary for his business.

Eyabane will use his additional income to save some money for the future, as he is planning to increase the surface area of his arable land and to build a house for his children.

The other members of the group grow maize.

loans.use: to buy working tools.

loans.name: Tsegmed

texts.en:
Tsegmed, who is 44 years old, lives with his wife and son in a small house in the Uvurhangai district of Ulaanbaatar. 

Since 1998, Tsegmed has been operating a livestock and animal product business, so he is well-experienced in this sector. He has his own garage for raw materials and livestock. 

Tsegmed's wife was working in a local organization, but she quit her job and started her own retail clothes business in the central market of Uvurhangai province. Her monthly rent is 150,000 MNT. Tsegmed needs 2,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for his wife's new business. He is a hard working and honest man who wants to make a better life for his wife and family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his wife's new business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam who appears in the picture, is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to three sons and one daughter. She works with the rest of her family in agriculture, which has been a profitable project, but the family's income isn't enough to cover their needs and pay the education costs for her children.

Mariam's daughter is studying at the university, specializing in Civil Engineering. Mariam wants to help her daughter to complete her studies by paying the university fees, so she is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD from FATEN. This will ensure a better future for her daughter and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Maria Saturdina

texts.es:
La señora Maria  de 53 años de edad, es soltera se dedica desde hace 11 años a vender ropa nueva, vive en casa de un familiar con sus dos nietos  en una comunidad de agua fría al sur de Honduras, en su negocio ella vende ropa para hombre, mujeres y  niños.
Doña María el préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar ropa para niños, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas y blusas. Ya que se acerca la época del día del niño y tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes es por tal razón que solicita   a prisma este crédito de 13,000.00 en refinanciamiento. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende salir adelante y suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio, ya que ella es una mujer sola que no tiene apoyo de nadie y quiere salir adelante con el apoyo de estos préstamo que Prisma le otorga.
Doña María sus metas es hacer crecer su  negocio y vender cada día más para mejorar su calidad de vida y hacer su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto 2012
texts.en:
Maria, 53 years old and single, has been dedicated for 11 years now to selling new clothes. She lives in the home of a family member with her 2 grandchildren, in the community of Agua Fria in southern Honduras. In her business she sells clothing for men, women and children.

Maria needs the requested loan to buy children's clothing, underwear, pants, shirts, and blouses. Now that Children's Day is approaching, she has various orders from her customers and that is why she is approaching Prisma for a loan of 13,000 [Lempiras] in refinancing. With the help of the loan, Maria intends to forge ahead, investing in her business, since she is a single woman who receives no help from anyone. She hopes to get ahead with the help of the loans Prisma offers.

Maria's goal is to make her business grow and to sell more each day, in order to improve her quality of life and build her own house.

loans.use: buy children's clothes, underwear, pants, shirts, and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Gereltuya is 40 years old and a librarian in the university. She has been doing her job for 14 years nonstop, and she has served thousands of students in the past. She is a hardworking women. 

Currently her younger brother Bumtsend is unemployed, but he wants to support his family by earnings. So he decided to start a taxi business around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

His sister Gereltuya wants to help her brother to start it.   Now he needs to purchase a car.  He is choosing a car that runs on natural gas. The loan that Gereltuya is taking will be dedicated to paying for the car that uses natural gas.

loans.use: To pay for a car that uses natural gas.

loans.name: Essowassi Group

texts.fr: Composé du genre masculin, le groupe de solidarité ESSOWASSI a pour président Magniné. Âgé de 32 ans, Magniné est marié à une boulangère et est père de famille de quatre enfants. Deux de ses enfants sont actuellement scolarisés. Son ainé a 10 ans et son plus jeune enfant est âgé de 10 mois. Magniné est enseignant de profession mais pour complément ses revenus il exerce aussi le métier de cultivateur depuis les années 2005 et se fait aider dans l’exercice de ses fonctions par un membre de sa famille et quatre employés. Son activité localisée dans la région centrale consiste à la culture des céréales tels le maïs et le haricot. Pour renforcer son activité par l’achat des outils nécessaires à son activité, Magniné sollicite pour la première fois le soutien financier de WAGES  en qui il fait confiance. Il souhaite constituer assez d’épargne et dans les jours à venir augmenter sa superficie cultivable, construire de nouveaux bâtiments et assurer une bonne scolarité à ses enfants. Les autres membres du groupe exercent la même activité que leur président.
texts.en:
The ESSOWASSI solidarity group is made up of male members.  The group's president, Magniné, is 32 years old, married to a baker, and the father of four children.  Two of his children currently attend school.  His oldest child is 10 years old, and the youngest is 10 months.

Magniné is a teacher by training, but he has also been working as a farmer since 2005, in order to supplement his income.  One member of this family and four employees help him to carry out his duties.  He works in the central region and grows grains such as maize and beans.

In order to strengthen his activity and purchase the tools necessary for his business, he is requesting financial support from WAGES for the first time, because he feels that he can trust this institution.

His goal is to save enough money and, one day, increase the surface area of his arable land, build new buildings and ensure a good education to his children.

The other members of the group are involved in the same activity as their president.

loans.use: to buy working tools.

loans.name: Chavelas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHEVELAS” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rose Mary es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesano en yeso, venta de fresco, tejido de mantas y venta de jugos, venta de ropa usada, venta de comida y café, librería y pastelería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rose Mary es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción de artesanías en yeso, ella cuenta que hace varios años emprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia y con ayuda de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de estuco) que comprará de los camiones distribuidores por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ciudades de Cochabamba, La Paz y Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “CHEVELAS” communal bank started its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Collpani Center. It is made up of eight members and it is led by a board of directors whose president is Rose Mary. The members' businesses in the communal bank are varied. Among them are: plaster artisanal crafts, selling drinks, weaving blankets and selling juice, selling used clothes, selling food and coffee, a bookstore and a pastry shop.

the loan they will take out will benefit the micro businesswomen. including Rose Mary. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer, a year ago at the invitation of a counselor from the institution who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a business making plaster artisanal crafts. She says that she started this business on her own initiative and with her mother's help.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying celing tiles. She will buy them from distribution trucks wholesale and later, after finishing them she will sell them i nthe cities of Cochabamba, La Paz and Oruro. This work allows her to generate income to support herself financially.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health aspect and the loans.

loans.use: to buy ceiling tiles

loans.name: Perenlei

texts.en:
Perenlei, 26 years old, is a taxi driver, and he has been operating his business the past four years. He lives with his family in the ger district, an area of Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts and houses, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since last year, he has been building a small house for his family. The work is 80% to 85% done, and he wants to buy some insulation materials for the walls. In winter, most Mongolian households use the coal stoves to stay warm at home.  Using wood or other chemical fuels is unacceptable in Mongolia because of the harmful pollutants. 

Insulating the walls is a good way to reduce the usage of coal fuel in Mongolia.   So Perenlei decided to buy some building materials, such as the foam and cement, to make the walls insulated in his family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as foam and cement, to insulate the walls of his house.

loans.name: Chulumani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHULUMANI” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana Marcela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cañería, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, venta de libros, venta de busos, venta de comida, tejido de gorros para bebe, venta de leche y queso, venta de zapatos, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana Marcela es una integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía (tejido de chompas), mismo que aprendió de su madre y que en la actualidad lo sigue para la generación de recursos económicos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tienen cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The. “CHULUMANI”  communal bank will start its thirty first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a prt of the Los Andes Center. It is made up of eleven members and is led by a board of directors whose president is Ana Marcela. The members' businesses in the communal bank are varied. Among them are: selling pipes, a neighborhood store, knitting sweaters, selling books, selling sweatshirts, selling food, selling baby hats, selling milk and cheese, selling shoes and selling skirts.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen including Ana Marcela. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of a friend who is member of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling artisanal crafts (knitted sweaters). She learned it from her mother and does it to generate income.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying wool that she will buy from the wholesale merchants and after kitting she sells her sweaters at her sales stall every day. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and the trainings.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is 41 years old and a conservative married woman, so she asked her son Thaer to take her place in the photo.

Asmahan has two sons and one daughter.  She started a fruits and vegetables sales business to help support her children and herself. 

Now she is working on expanding the business by bringing in more kinds of fruits and vegetable from the market and farms.  That is why she has applied for this loan. 

In the future, she wants to open another branch in a different area and let her son work in it.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman runs a little factory where he makes doors and windows. He has been running this business for 11 years. Arman always makes high quality products, which is why he always gets large numbers of orders. This requires more materials to make the doors and windows. Arman has applied for this loan in order to purchase plastic and wooden frames for doors and windows. It is important for Arman to complete the orders and keep his business running.  

Arman lives with his wife, parents, sister and 3-year-old son. Business income is vital for Arman to sustain his family and create better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for frames for doors and windows for his factory.

loans.name: Doumyana

texts.en:
Doumyana is a 21-year-old single woman.  She has owned a clothes selling shop since 2006. 

Her shop includes many different products to sell to increase her income. In addition to clothes, Doumyana sells accessories, perfumes, and linens. 

She is a hard worker who knows how to fulfill her customers needs. She insists on providing a wide variety of all the items to keep her customers satisfied.

Doumyana applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for a requested clothes order and to increase her linen capital with new items.

She is working hard to expand her business and to improve her store as much as she can.   Her prices are affordable and competitive. She encourages her customers to buy more than their requested needs.

loans.use: To pay for a requested clothes order and to increase her linen capital with new items.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is involved in agriculture. He raises cows, hens, and pigs. He also grows apricot trees and keeps a grape orchard. Gevorg would like to increase the number of livestick in his farm, so he needs sufficient funds. With the requested amount, Gevorg plans to purchase four calves. This will allow Gevorg to gather more milk and sell more agricultural products. 

Gevorg lives with his wife, Lilya, and son, Hakob. Although Gevorg works at the local village-hall, the main source of income for the family is agriculture. The development of the latter will help Gevorg to get more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay for four calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand by purchasing more scrap materials in bulk.

loans.name: Bakht

texts.en:
Bakht is a 55-year-old married woman. She lives in a big family with her nine children.  Due to the large number of family members living together, her husband has trouble managing all the expenditures of the family alone. 

Some years ago when her children were young, she started the business of selling milk to increase her family's income.  Afterwards, she started a general store at her home, to increase her family income.  She has run this business successfully from a year ago. She is getting a healthy profit from this business and is happy to fulfill the financial needs of her family.  

She is in a second loan cycle with Kashf foundation. Now she needs Rs.30,000 to purchase general grocery items such as sugar, oil packs, etc. 

She wants to give a better future to her children and also wants to upgrade the condition of her house. She is very near to fulfilling her dream because of her hard work and courage.

loans.use: To purchase general items of groceries, such as sugar, oil packs, etc.

loans.name: Mungunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Mungunchimeg, 26, is a receptionist in a private company. She lives with her husband and daughter in a house in the ger district, which is comprised of traditional Mongolian nomadic yurts and a few houses within the boundary of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Her family recently purchased a house which was built many years ago. Since she bought her house, there have not been any repairs or renovations. Her house loses heat through its thin walls and windows. In winter her daughter usually gets sick due to the chill at home. She uses the coal fired furnace to heat her home inside and it creates too much smoke both inside and outside. Therefore she is keen to make repairs and insulate the walls with bricks and other building materials. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy building materials and cover the cost of workers hired to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and pay for workers to repair her house.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Alaa owns a car-repair shop. He specializes in repairing car bodies. He established his business in 1998, and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3,000 as a loan to buy a machine specialized for his work and install rolling shutters and an external ceiling for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a machine specialized for his work and install rolling shutters and an external ceiling for his shop

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and married, with two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Haidar owns a small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2007 and now he has one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a generator and a refrigerator. He also wants to get signage for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a refrigerator and signage for his shop.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala lives in the Lukashin village in the Armavir region with her husband and son. Together with her family, Lala is involed in agriculture. They raise cows and pigs. They cultivate barley, cabbage, apricots, peaches, plums, apples, and keep a grape orchard. Lala would like to add more livestock to her farm, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. With the help of this loan, Lala plans to purchase a cow and 4 calves. This will allow Lala to make and sell more agricultural products and get additional income from the sales.

loans.use: To pay for a cow and 4 calves

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en: Hedaya is a 37-year-old married woman. Her husband works two jobs to be able to support his family of seven members. Seeing what her husband does has led Hedaya to start her cosmetics products sales at home. Now she wants to expand her business by having more variety in what she sells. This is why Hedaya has applied for this loan so she can start selling accessories besides cosmetics products.

loans.use: to start selling accessories

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman runs a little farm where he grows fruits and vegetables. Arman would like to improve the greenhouses on his farm, but he needs a sufficient amount of money. With the help of this loan, he will purchase polyethylene covers for his greenhouses, which will allow him to create a warm temperature during the winter. In addition, Arman will purchase cucumber and greens seeds for cultivation. Arman also plans to purchase 19 bags of fertilizer, which is necessary to prevent diseases, which have become common recently.
 
Arman lives with his wife, Meri. Arman dreams of creating prosperous living conditions for his family. The development of his agricultural business will allow him to make his dream come true.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, cucumber and greens seeds, and polyethylene covers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Ms Fazeelat is 42 years old and a mother of five children.  She is illiterate, so she wants to see her children as well-educated. Her husband is a laborer, and his monthly income is very low to provide for his family alone.   

She has been in the business of cloth sewing for the last four years. When she started this business, her income was very low, but with the passage of time her business income has increased by her hard work and her passion for giving a better future to her kids. 

At present, she has one sewing machine.  Now she has requested a loan of Rs.20,000 to purchase another sewing machine for her daughter to use and increase their capacity. 

She is hopeful that her family income will increase, and they will be able to better manage their everyday expenditures. Her loan has been approved by the Kashf Foundation. 

Her husband is much satisfied to see the increasing growth of her business. She desires to use part of the profits on her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase one more sewing machine for her daughter to use.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Amanecer” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran: modistas, podólogos, venta de productos de belleza, electricistas, venta de helados, venta de cebollas, garzones, venta de comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Elizabeth integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un poleron de color negro, pantalones de color gris y su cabello es de color castaño oscuro lo usa suelto y largo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de modista, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que realizó un curso, lo que le permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio, sacando el titulo de Confección y Vestuario, trabaja de lunes a sábados y dependiendo de la demanda de trabajo también hasta el domingo, realiza arreglos en general y confección de buzos, cortinas y manteles. Ubica un pequeño taller en su casa y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando para la confección y arreglos de su rubro los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en diferentes distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra telas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará telas, manteles y cortinas para decoración.
Una de las metas de Elizabeth son ser microempresaria y  tener un taller mas grandes con gente que trabaje junto a ella y producir mucho mas, además quiere instalar sus maquinas overlock y multipunto para trabajar más cómodamente.
Elizabeth vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle un buen pasar a sus hijos y que sean grandes profesionales el dia de mañana.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
