This communal bank is called “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) and is made up of twenty entrepreneurs who make a living in different areas, among them are dressmakers, podiatrists, a seller of beauty products, electricians, an ice cream seller, an onion seller, waiters, a fast food seller and service providers, among others, all of them belonging to the city of Chillán.

Elizabeth is a member of the group of the communal bank, who in the photo is seated in the front row, occupying the second place from left to right, dressed in a black hoodie, gray pants and her hair is dark chestnut brown that she wears loose and long.

She has made a living in the field of tailoring for four years.  She comments that she took a course which enabled her to improve and start her business, taking the name “Confección y Vestuario” (Tailoring and Clothing).  She works from Monday to Saturday and depending on the work demand she also even works Sunday, doing mending in general and sewing sweatshirts, curtains and tablecloths.  Her small workshop is located in her house and her schedule is spread out according to her availability.

The merchandise that she needs for the tailoring and mending in her line of work she buys in the city of Santiago, in different wholesalers and places where she finds low-cost fabrics, therefore economically suitable.  With this loan she will buy fabric, tablecloths and curtains for decoration.

One of Elizabeth’s goals is to be a small businesswoman and have a larger workshop with people that work with her and produce a lot more.  In addition, she wants to set up her overlock and multi-stitch sewing machines in order to work more comfortably.

Elizabeth lives with her two children, ages 12 and 9, who are in school.  Her dreams at the family level are to give a good life to her children and that they be the great professionals of tomorrow.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund), since it will permit her to invest in her business.  She says that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development, since she has learned to organize and distribute her income in a better way.  With regard to the group of the communal bank that she is a part of, she comments that in this group there exists very good communication.

Chillán is a town in the south-central area of Chile.  Its name means “silla del sol” (Chair of the Sun) in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (Cradle of the Homeland) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of Artists), due to the fact that in the city distinguished persons from the history of Chile have been born, like, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, tablecloths and curtains for decoration.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo de 43 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador; gracias al empeño que día a día logra, llego a comprar su casa, en la que ahora habita con su esposa Victoria y sus 05 estimados hijos. Hugo es un albañil que siempre esta trabajando desde muy temprano, ya que es muy solicitado por las buenas obras que hace; en sus tiempos libres se dirige a su parcela para ver la producción de sus cultivos. Gracias a los diversos trabajos que ejerce logró abrir un negocio para su esposa Victoria, quien esta a cargo de su tienda de comestibles (arroz, azúcar, conservas, verduras, bebidas, golosinas, especias, etc.). su tienda lo abrió hace 10 años, comenta que empezó poco a poco y ahora es una tienda muy concurrida por los pobladores de su localidad. En este negocio le genera buenos ingresos, ya que siempre esta vendiendo sus productos; sin embargo a veces le hace falta incrementar más víveres, ya que de eso depende el ingreso a diario; por ello cuenta con el crédito obtenido, de manera que así suministre su negocio. Este es su crédito número 01; agradece por esta confianza y apoyo de los financieros; se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas de pago, para que en otra oportunidad acceda a otro crédito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Hugo is 43 years old and is a hard working man. Thanks to the effort he puts in everyday, he has achieved the accomplishment of buying his own home, in which he lives with his wife and his 5 cherished children. Hugo is a contractor, and is always working, starting very early in the morning, because he comes highly recommended for the good work that he does. In his free time he tends to his plot of land, to see how his crops are doing. 

Thanks to the diverse jobs he has completed, he was able to open a business for his wife, Victoria, who runs a small grocery store. (Selling rice, sugar, canned food, vegetables, drinks, snacks, spices, etc.). They opened the store ten years ago, and commented that they started out little by little and now it has become frequently visited by the people that live in the area. This business generates good profits, because they are constantly selling their products. However, sometimes they lack the funds needed to increase their supplies, since this is dependent on daily income. This is why he has requested a loan, to be able to restock the store. This is his first loan. He is thankful for the trust and support being given by the lenders. He promises to be punctual with his repayments, so that in the future he will be able to take out another loan. With the 3,000 nuevos soles, he will restock the merchandise in the store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock his store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de sacar adelante a su familia; José ha trabajado desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, por tal motivo lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudios primarios, ni cursar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Agrónoma que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por el campo y en algunas ocasiones su esposa lo engríe cocinándole su comida favorita, como es el riquísimo Seco de Res. 
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, José se dedica a la agricultura, él cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde siembra camu camu, la cual una fruta típica de su ciudad, adicionalmente también tiene pequeñas siembras de sandia, yucas y maíz, todas los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento, abono y riego de sus cultivos; de esta manera José podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle satisfactoriamente y este en optimas condiciones para su cosecha y venta, así él espera poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 57-year-old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their 4 children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to help his family get ahead. José has worked since he was very young, helping his parents. For this reason he unfortunately was not able to finish primary school, and he was not able to pursue a professional degree in Agricultural Engineering as he wanted to, although he really would have liked to do so. In his free time, he likes to spend time in the countryside, and sometimes his wife spoils him by cooking him his favorite food, such as the delicious Seco de Res [stewed beef].
 
With great dedication and enthusiasm, and thanks to what he learned from his parents, José works in agriculture. He has a small plot of land where he plants camu camu, which is a typical fruit of his city. In addition, he also has small plantings of watermelon, yuca and corn. Every day he starts his work at an early hour. He can work approximately 12 hours a day, and he believes that it is going well for him because of his dedication and the friendly treatment he provides to his customers. 

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to him he will be able to maintain, fertilize and irrigate his crops. In this way, José will be able to ensure that his crops develop in a satisfactory way and that they are in optimal condition for harvest and sale. Thus he hopes to obtain a higher income, which will help him very much so that in the near future, he will be able to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain, fertilize and irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: O. Bolormaa, 42 sells casual clothes in the market. She started her business 8 years ago and has been operating her business successfully nonstop ever since. She lives with her family in her parent-in-laws` house. Recently her family purchased an old house in the ger district, which is comprised of traditional Mongolian nomadic yurts and houses in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since then, she has not made any repairs or renovations to it. In winter it becomes too cold to live due to the heat loss through the door and window of the living room. Her daughters always get sick due to the cold at home. So she decided to repair her house, and the first thing she will do is insulate the wall.  She hopes it will reduce the emission through the window of the living room and her need to use the toxic coal fuel. She needs about 5.000.000 MNT to fulfill her plan.

loans.use: To repair her house so it will be warmer.

loans.name: Drane

texts.en:
Drane is 44-years old and married. She has five children ranging in age from 23 to 13-years old and all of them attend school. She has been the sole financial support for the family for the past five years. It hasn’t been easy at all for Drane, yet, the profits she has made somehow makes up for all her struggles, she claims. Through it, she has been able to feed her family.

Drane has been in the livestock business for the past five years and is now planning to buy more cows to increase the milk production. This is the reason  she is requesting a Kiva loan in the hopes that she will get financial help from lenders. For this, she thanks them all in advance.

loans.use: To buy one more cow.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en: Mebakari is taking out another loan to invest in her cashew nut-selling business. She says that it has been a profitable business. Mebakari has shown a great interest in moving forward through her businesses. The previous loan enabled her to increase the merchandise in her clothes-selling business, which she still operates. Mebakari plans to use this loan to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She hopes to repay her loan on time so that she can ask for more loans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 39 year old married man. He has five children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be a visionary man.

He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. His primary customers are motorcycle and bicycle owners.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be disturbance by local authorities.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts.  His business goal is to be the best motorcycle provider of transportation in his home area.   He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en:
Hajran is 38 years old and the mother of four children. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. 

For 20 years, Hajran has run a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 53 year old married woman; her husband is a farmer. 

She has a small home business selling bed covers and home products.  Now she has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of her products.  She hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers and home products to sell.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is a nurse in a medical center in Kherlen, an eastern city in Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse for 31 years nonstop. She lives with her family in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Her house is kind of small and suffers heat loss in the winter through its walls and door. Therefore she has decided to make an extension to her house with bricks and cement. It will reduce the heat loss, making her house warmer after the repair. She thinks that it will also help to cut her coal usage in the future. The loan she is asking for will be used to cover the cost of building materials to make an extension or provide insulation for her small house.

loans.use: To cover the cost of building materials for an extension or insulation for her small house.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en: Majeda is 45-year-old married woman. Her husband works in the Ministry of Education to be able to support their family of 11 members. Having a big family has put more pressure on her husband financially so Majeda decided to help her husband and start a small retail business selling different types of goods such as clothes, bed covers and food products. Now she has applied for this loan to increase her quantity of goods to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of goods

loans.name: Ovsanna

texts.en:
Ovsanna lives in Armavir town with her husband, son, and daughter. 

Ovsanna runs a booth at one of city markets, where she trades in men's and women's clothing.  Ovsanna would like to refresh the clothing variety in her booth for the autumn-winter season. Unfortunately, her current income does not allow her to implement this goal. 

With the loan's help, Ovsanna wants to purchase suits, shirts, trousers, and sport clothes, as well as kids' clothing for her booth. This will significantly increase the sales, which will allow Ovsanna to gather more income and invest in the business next year.

loans.use: to pay for fresh varieties of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra, is a 50 year old conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the photo. 

Yusra has a small retail business selling baby Pampers and toilet paper.  She buys those goods in large quantites and sells them again in smaller quantities to friends and neighbors. 

Now she has applied for this loan to add more variety to the products she sells.  Later she wants to start distributing to near-by shops.

loans.use: to add more variety to the products she sells.

loans.name: Rositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora es la Ines es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de verduras, construcción, venta de disfraces, producción de papa, venta de papa, carnicería de llamas, venta y producción de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, artesanía.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ines es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene negocios de tienda de barrio que emprendió por iniciativa propia hace dos años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliación de negocio (compra de sardinas, azúcar, etc.) mismo que comprará de las ferias la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta, todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “ROSITAS” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional center. The group is made up of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors, with the borrower Ines serving as Treasurer. The businesses operated by the members of this communal bank are varied, including buying and selling vegetables; construction; selling party costumes; potato production and sales; llama butcher shop; vegetable production and sales; neighborhood store; and handicrafts. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises in this group where Ines is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined on the invitation of a promoter of the institution who came to her house to invite her. Currently, she operates a neighborhood store, which she started on her own initiative two years ago. 

The loan that she will now take out is to expand her business (buying sardines, sugar, etc.). She will buy these goods in the markets of the city of La Paz and later she will sell them in her sales space, which is open every day. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.   

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training on the topics of health and credit.

loans.use: to buy sardines, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 47-year-old married man and a father of six children. He has been working in furniture painting for 12 years.
Yasser has a good reputation and his good work attracts new customers.
Because of the hard financial situation he is facing to fulfill his family's needs, Yasser is working on starting an additional business to cover almost all of his family's expenses, which is why he applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua.
Through this loan, Yasser will open a convenience store in his village. This new business will surely improve his family's living, and will reduce the pressure on him. 
He hopes to expand his store to a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has two children who are attending primary school. Thanks to her job, she is able to educate her children and purchase all the family's household necessities. She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments. 

Halima started her own charcoal selling business two years ago with her parents’ help. She also sells coconuts from her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase four sacks of charcoal and 200 coconuts. Halima aims to own her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of charcoal and 200 coconuts to sell

loans.name: Damian

texts.es: El Sr. Damián  tiene 59 años, es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 12, 7 y 5 años, el Sr. Damián se dedica al servicio de construcción, el trabaja en las distintas construcciones de la localidad de Joronchito este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Damián  va a usar este préstamo para  la mejora de vivienda, comprando material de construcción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere mejorar los cuartos de su casa, el Sr. Damián enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la dependencia de cada trabajo ya que tiene que cumplir con el contrato por cada casa a la que va  a trabajar en la construcción  y va seguir utilizando los beneficios en mejorar su vivienda, comprando losa alivianada y carpeta de hormigón, su deseo con el tiempo es ver terminada su casita.
texts.en: Damián is 59 years old. He is married with three children who are 12, 7 and 5 years old. Damián makes a living working in construction. He works on various construction jobs in the city of Joronchito. This loan is the first he has taken out through the communal bank. He will use the loan to make home improvements, for which he needs to buy construction materials. The reason he has requested a loan is because he wants to improve the rooms in his house. Damián faces challenges in his business, mainly the dependence he has on each construction job as he has to complete the contracts he has for each house he has been hired for. He will continue using the profits from his business to improve his home, to buy supplies to make a concrete foundation. His goal is to be able to see the construction of his home finished.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine lives in Getashen village in the Armavir region of Armenia with her husband and two sons. Because the level of unemployment is high in the region, Kristine's two sons have to leave to go abroad for work. Meanwhile, Kristine and her husband run a farm, where they raise cows and pigs along with cultivating tomatoes and watermelon. 

Kristine does not have enough land to cultivate forage for the livestock, so she has to purchase forage, for which she needs sufficient funds. Kristine has applied for this loan to purchase grass and barley for the livestock. She also plans to buy a cow, which allows her to gather more milk.
 
Kristine dreams of developing her farm so that her sons will be able to get involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain their families in the future. This loan is important for her to develop the farm and reach this goal.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, grass and barley.

loans.name: Magda Lizzeth

texts.es: Magda, de 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, vive con ellos y su esposo en el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Magda tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería como ser: ropa nueva y usada, ganchos y colas para cabello, cortinas de baño, sabanas, carteras y otra achinería. Este negocio lo estableció hace 7 años y las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargo.  Ella ha solicitado ya varios prestamos para invertirlos en el negocio, el que solicita actualmente es el octavo préstamo y es por 23,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar mas mercadería para la venta, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es tener un negocio fuerte que le genere ingresos para cubrir gastos de educación de sus hijos y llegar a tener un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Magda is 41 years old and has four children. She and her husband live with them in the town of Tela, Atlántida. Magda has her own business of selling merchandise such as new and used clothing, hairpins and ponytail holders, shower curtains, bed sheets, purses, and other low-cost goods. She has requested several loans that were invested in her business.

The loan she is requesting now is her eighth one and is in the amount of 23,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy more merchandise to sell so that she can increase her earnings. Magda’s dream is to have a strong business that will generate income so that she can cover her children’s education and acquire a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, purses, curtains, and various low-cost goods to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer and married with three children. 

He specializes in buying and selling tomatoes which he does in rural Lyantonde. His main customers are the neighbouring community. David is mainly challenged by poor roads which get slippery during the rainy season, and price fluctuations. The heavy rains may lead to the fall of bananas, which are his other source of income. With the income from the sales, David is able to meet the needs of his family and also pay school fees for his children.
David is very hard working and hopes to expand his still small business to a large scale so that he will be able to do the planting himself if he gets enough capital.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik is 46 years old and has a partner with whom he has 3 children. Currently Rafik lives in Agsu with his family where he is developing his economic endeavors. He makes a living in animal husbandry. Rafik has been raising cattle for over 10 years at his home. His sons are involved in the business as well. Given this opportunity they need this loan to buy livestock, for example, dairy cows. Rafik is a hard worker and responsible which is why he requested a loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. This is his first loan in amount of 1500 AZN.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Estrella De Cristo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE CRISTO” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de comida, venta de ropa, tejido a macramé, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es una integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitar su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de tienda de barrio, da a conocer que hace ocho años atrás trabajaba en una tienda de venta de estuco, sin embargo no tenía muchos réditos; sin embargo observó que en su zona le faltaba una tienda por eso emprendió este nuevo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de compra de sardinas, azúcar, etc.) que comprará de las tiendas por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los beneficios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Estrellas de Cristo (Stars of Christ) will start in Pro Mujer’s first cycle as a part of the Regional Office of Alto Lima. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Antonia is the president. The businesses that the group members carry out are varied; among them are selling electronics, food, and clothing, making macramé textiles, and running a neighborhood store.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesswomen, one of whom is Antonia. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, joining at the invitation of a promoter from the organization who visited her home. Currently, she has a neighborhood store. She says that eight years ago, she worked in a store that sold plaster; however, it didn’t have a lot of revenue. She observed that her region lacked a store, and because of this she opened a new business. 

The loan that she will take out now is for an increase in capital to purchase sardines, sugar, etc., that she will buy wholesale from the stores and later sell in her permanent location. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has four  children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she enjoys the benefits.

loans.use: to purchase sardines, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur lives in Vedi town, Ararat region, with his wife, parents, son and daughter. Artur is involved in agriculture. He breeds lambs, cultivates beans and grows fruit trees. Artur gets a significant part of his income from the sale of lamb meat in local markets. Artur would like to increase the number of lambs, for which he needs sufficient capital. In addition, he would like to buy grass to feed the lambs. This is important for Artur to keep gathering stable income from lamb breeding and invest in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for lambs and grass

loans.name: Ninela

texts.en:
Ninela is from Senaki district, West Georgia. She is 65 years old and lives with her husband Shukri. Shukri works as a teacher and gets a monthly salary. Both Ninela and Shukri are provided with a retirement pension. Ninela is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, she owns a plot of land, where nuts are grown. In addition, Ninela runs a small dairy farm and has a milk cow. She milks the cow twice a day and produces cheese. She sells her agricultural products at the local open market. Ninela is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.
 
She requested a loan to put roofing on the house and repair her bathroom. The existing roof is damaged and drops water and the bathroom is uncomfortable. With this loan, she will purchase building materials. Ninela will improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to put roofing on the house and repair her bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a tile floor in her house.

loans.name: Ben Lom Group

texts.en:
Meemy, the lady with the raised hand, is 31 years old and a member of BEN Lom. Meemy's parents passed away, leaving her the responsibility of taking care of a younger brother. Being an orphan at an early age with a brother to look after, Meemy shouldered lot of responsibility in managing the household burden and her brother’s future. Her profession is stitching clothes, school uniforms and different designs requested by customers from time to time.

Meemy wants the KIVA loan to purchase another sewing machine and set up a Tailoring House of her own. The tailoring house will enable her to generate more income, employ others and stock more rolls of cloth to sew.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and stock more cloth to sew

loans.name: Halimeh

texts.en: Halimeh is a conservative woman who asked her son to appear in the photo instead. Her son Ayman, who was enrolled in the university to study Law, faced some financial problems lately, so his mother has decided to support him and pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ms Ayesha is a 44-year-old active woman and a mother of four children. Along with one of her sons she manages a small general store, and also has been selling vegetables for many years. Her eldest son assists her in running these business activities. He buys stocks of goods and vegetables from the market at lower rates. Ms Ayesha stays at the store and deals with customers. They serve well in her community and count a good client list. 
She lives in a large conventional family with her husband, children and other relatives. She requires more earnings to cover the everyday expenditures of her family. To help her continue operations of her business, Ayesha is requesting a loan of Rs. 30000/- to buy groceries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This enables her to cater to large number of customers time after time. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit runs a little grocery store. She started this business about 2 years ago. Margarit would like to add more varieties of goods in her shop in order to be competitive in the market. With the help of this loan she will purchase food, fruit and vegetables. Margarit hopes to increase her sales and gather more business income. 
Margarit lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren. Business income is vital for her to sustain the family and create more prosperous living conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for fruits, vegetables and food

loans.name: Vardush

texts.en: Vardush lives in Aratashen village with her husband and 2 school-age sons. Vardush is a baker in a local bakery. Besides this, she helps her husband, Garnik, to run the farm, where they cultivate peppers and tomatoes. Because of the weather conditions, the covers over the green houses get corrupted, so Vardush has to renew the polyethylene covers. Vardush also needs to repair the electricity to heat the green houses during winter. This is important for Vardush to gather a good harvest during the year and cover her family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene covers for the green house, and electricity to heat them during winter.

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Mirian tiene 52 años de edad, soltera, vive con el hijo mayor en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella tiene 12 años de haber establecido su propia fuente de ingresos. Doña Mirian elabora y vende desayunos, almuerzos, cenas, refrescos y jugos naturales en una caseta pegado a su casa. Anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo de arroz, pero miro que el negocio de comida era bueno y decidió establecerlo. la señora es muy emprendedora ha trabajado con varios prestamos, este actual que solicita es el decimo préstamo y es por 25,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar una refrigeradora nueva para el negocio y comprara insumos como carnes, arroz, vegetales, harina, aceite etc. para elaborar comida. Con esta inversión va brindar un mejor servicio al cliente. De las ganancias piensa construir el local de material de concreto, siempre ir mejorando su negocio y también mejorar su vivienda la que construyo con ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirian is 52 years old, single, and lives with her grown son in the town of Tela, Atlántida. Twelve years ago, she established her own business as a source of income. Doña Mirian prepares and sells breakfast, lunch, dinner, soft drinks, and natural juices from a kiosk that is attached to her house. She previously worked as a rice farmer, but thought that a food business would be good idea, so she decided to pursue establishing one.

Sra. Mirian is very enterprising and has worked with several loans. The loan she is currently requesting is in the amount of 25,000 HNL and will be used to buy a new refrigerator for her business and supplies such as meat, rice, vegetables, flour, oil, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. This investment will enable her to provide better service to her customers. With her profits, Mirian plans to build a concrete structure so that she can always improve her business. She also wants to make improvements to the home that she built using the earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and a new refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora es la María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de queso, venta de carne de llama, venta de papas, venta de verduras, producción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene negocios de comerciante de ganado vacuno que emprendió con a sugerencia de su esposo cuando decidieron casarse.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliación de negocio (compra de vacas y llamas) mismo que comprará de las ferias las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente lo pondrá a crianza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.

En la fotografia se encuentran el hijo de la señora Eusebia que esta vestido con chompa ploma, el esposo de la señora alejandrina que se encuentra vestido con chiompa azul y la hermana de la señora Eliana que esta vestida con una manta cafe
texts.en:
The communal bank Hormiguitas (Hardworking Women) will start in Pro Mujer’s first loan cycle as a part of the Regional Office of Achacachi. It is composed of ten members and is led by a board of directors, where María is the president. The businesses carried out by the communal bank’s members are varied; among them are selling cheese, llama meat, potatoes, vegetables, and production. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesswomen, one of whom is María. She says that this is their first time with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a promoter from the organization who visited her home. Currently, she has a business selling cattle, which she began at the suggestion of her husband when they decided to get married. 

The loan that she will take out now is for the expansion of her business - to purchase cows and llamas, that she will buy at the markets, the surrounding communities, and later raise. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has five children. 

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loan and the savings. 

In the picture, there is Eusebia’s son, who is wearing a gray sweatshirt; Alejandrina’s husband, wearing a blue sweatshirt, and Eliana’s sister, wearing a brown poncho.

loans.use: to purchase cows and llamas.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: La Sra.  Ana se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive localidad Torno,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como arroz y fideo y también en la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ana  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Ana  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana sells food from a stall located in the same area where she lives in the town of Torno. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender.

Sra. Ana will use this loan to buy supplies, such as rice and noodles. She will also buy tables and chairs for her business so that her customers will be more comfortable. The reason why she is requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business. Sra. Ana will utilize these benefits so that she can continue buying supplies and improving her earnings. Her wish for her business is to convert it into a restaurant where she can provide better service to her customers.

Sra. Ana is a hardworking individual who is pleased to have the opportunity to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, she was able to  buy more merchandise for her business. She was able to start a food stall selling a variety of dishes using her profits. 

Fatuma is taking out a new loan in order invest in her new business, and with this she will have a larger variety of foods to offer her clients. Because of this she can increase her income and keep fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: "To open a cafe." 

She intends to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, rice, maize flour, beans, etc.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, rice, maize flour, beans, etc.

loans.name: Cross Road Group

texts.en:
Cross Road is a group of 2 people, and they have been together as a group for 2 years. Francisca is 57 years old and a single mother with 1 child. The child is 20 years old and currently attends school. He also helps the mother to sell after school. 

Francisca is representing the Cross Road group. She sells second-hand clothing, which is displayed in the photograph. This is a business she has been operating for more than 10 years. She has gained valuable experience and many loyal customers over the years. 

She will use this loan to buy more clothing to stock her second-hand clothing shop. Her business strategy is to hold regular sales to attract customers to her store. Her store is situated in the southern part of Teshie.

Francisca has received 2 previous loans from Kiva’s partner, ID-Ghana. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to own a large boutique in Ghana one day.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives with her husband, who is a farmer. She has 4 dependents. She lives in Asebu, which is near Cape Coast. Mary produces fanti kenkey to sell, and she also sells gari. Fanti kenkey is a locally made food made out of maize. She has been in this business for 20 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their bills.  Mary will use her loan to purchase bags of gari to sell and bags of maize to produce her kenkey to sell. With her profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of gari to sell and bags of maize to produce her kenkey to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina has been operating a grocery store for five years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  She is married to a farmer and has six dependants. Ernestina uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Ernestina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha is a single parent who lives together with her two children at Asebu near Cape Coast.  Agartha sells African print cloth, scarves, towels, sponges, etc. She has been in this business for six years.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees.   Agartha will use her loan to purchase more African print cloth, towels and sponges to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more African print cloth, towels and sponges to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort lives with her husband who is a mechanic and her five children at Asebu near Caper Coast. Comfort sells beans and gari, which she has done for some years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Comfort will use her loan to purchase bags of gari and beans to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari and beans to sell

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine lives in Kapan town with her son and daughter. Lusine runs a little shop where she trades in flowers, souvenirs and aquariums with fish. In order to enlarge the variety of goods in her shop, Lusine has applied for this loan to purchase more artificial and natural flowers, as well as aquariums and fishes. This will significantly increase Lusines's business turnover, which is important for her to ensure a sustainable future for her children.

loans.use: buy flowers, aquariums and fishes to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte  sells charcoal at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 2 years now. Charlotte is married and her husband is a small trader.  She uses her income  to support her husband to pay their accommodation bills.  Charlotte will use her loan to buy charcoal to resell.  Charlotte will use the new profit from her expanded business to produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a woman who very much wants to get ahead and has many business ideas she wants to implement. She is a single mother and lives with her six children who she wants to provide with a better quality of life.

Her activity is the sale of local brews made from coconut. She has a refrigerator where she stores her beverages at low temperature, which is how her customers like them in the typical hot weather in her zone. She started out over fifteen years ago buying small amounts with her own capital. She’s always worked alone and noting the good welcome she got decided to continue.

Halima plans to increase her stock in order to increase profits and start a wholesale shop of coconuts in the future.

loans.use: buy coconuts to make drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the lady pounding fufu.  She operate a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold).  This she has done for 4 years now.   The food she serves are fufu, banku and rice balls   

Mary is married to a driver and has 5 children.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase  foodstuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Mary plans to acquire a place to enable her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in charge of a hair salon.  She has a child and lives with her husband who is a taxi driver. She set up the business with the intention of providing for her family and also to support her husband. So far she has seen good results.

Mary is requesting a loan in order to stock her salon with hair products such as hair oil, pomade, wigs, shampoo, etc. This will provide her salon with a wider variety of products and help her to give good service to customers.

Mary's goal is to make all necessary improvements to her business so that it becomes more profitable and provides her family with a larger profit margin.  This is her 3rd loan with ID-Ghana and she needs 650 Ghana cedis to buy items for the salon in order to meet the demands of her customers better.

loans.use: buy hair salon products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria  sells popcorn and plastic bowls at Asebu near Cape Coast.  She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their  accommodation bills. 

Victoria will use her loan to purchase maize to prepare her popcorn for sale.  With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy popcorn

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en: Fusena sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macaroni, and a meat and fish stew. Fusena has been selling waakye for 10 years now. She is married. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband to pay her utility bills.  Fusena needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye to sell. With her profit, Fusena will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a seamstress. She sews dresses to sell. She is married to a driver and has two children.  Gloria has been sawing for eight years now. She uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. Gloria makes dress to sell so she needs the loan to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop has been engaged in animal breeding and gardening in Aknaghbyur village in theTavush region for several years. He grows figs, persimmons and various vegetables for sale. Also Mesrop breeds 3 calves, 5 pigs and 10 piglets on his farm. During the New Year’s holidays Mesrop is able to sell beef and pork to butcher shops. Thanks to his occupations Mesrop supports his big family, which consists of his wife, his two small sons and his parents. 

Mesrop is 32 years old. He graduated from Yerevan State University, economics department.  Simultaneously with his farming, Mesrop works as an economist in one of Ijevan’s organizations. 

This is Mesrop’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and he has never been delayed in his repayments. Now he is seeking for $3000 loan to buy 2 or 3 more calves, to stock a large lot of fodder for his farm animals and to partly repair a cattle shed.

loans.use: buy calves and fodder and repair his cattle shed

loans.name: Al-Thoria Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Thoria and consists of six women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Amirh is the group leader for this loan.  Amirh is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. 

Amirh is 26 years old, married and has five children. She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy a cupboard for her house.  She hopes to buy house furniture to make her house more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: buy a cupboard for her house

loans.name: Ghalia's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Brkah and it consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Ghalia is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. She works hard to support the family money-wise. She decided to start working as a hairdresser, receiving customers at her place. She’s a brave woman who is running a business while at the same time, raising her children and taking care of her house. 

With her requested loan from AMB, she will purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies to better serve her clients. She hopes her business will grow and she will earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is single and lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His business is well organized. He starts at 7 am and works until 8 pm every day. He has one year of experience.

Jimmy has requested a loan from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance in order to buy more clothes for resale. With the profit from this loan, Jimmy will expand his business to a large stall in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina sells frozen beef, chicken and fish at Asebu near Takoradi. She has done this for 10 years now. She is married with three children. Her husband is a mechanic. Faustina uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Faustina will use her loan to purchase frozen beef, chicken and fish to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase frozen beef, chicken and fish to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 as he anticipates an increase in demand for food in the market. With this loan, he wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. He dreams of expanding to a restaurant business and becoming a leader in the market. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving him an opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: buy flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a petty trader; she sells footwear and clothes, which she has done for three years. She lives in Asebu near Takoridi. Efua is married and has two children. She uses her income  to  support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase footwear and clothes to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to enable her to sell the footwear and clothes.

loans.use: to purchase footwear and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has three children who attend primary school. Thanks to the job she is doing, she is able to educate her children and purchase all the household necessities. She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments. 

Amina has her own buffet meal business that she was able to purchase by working hard. She started the business with her savings from another business. She is requesting the loan to purchase sauce, pasta, meat and other ingredients to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase sauce, pasta, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 28-year-old man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is married and has one child.  Ammar is able to meet his family's needs and offer them a decent way of living. 

Ammar owns a small grocery store where he sells a variety of dairy and daily-use products in addition to soft drinks and many other items. He started his business with small amount that was provided to him from his deceased father. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from AMB to purchase food provisions for his business. This loan will enable him to diversify his stock, thereby increasing his revenues and thus his income. He looks forward to expanding his grocery store. In the future, he hopes to open many grocery stores around his area.

loans.use: restock his grocery store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort lives together with her husband and 5 children in Asebu near Cape Coast.  Her husband is a mason.  Comfort sells charcoal, which she has done for 3 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay for their food and to clothe their children.  Comfort will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Comfort will produce the charcoal she sells herself .

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates a grocery store.  This she has done for 8 years now.   The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees and  powdered milk.  Grace is married and has 4 children.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell.  With the new profit, Grace  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  produces charcoal for sale at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 3 years now. Ekua is a single parent and has 8 dependents  She uses her income to feed and pay her children’s school fees.  Ekua will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua will produce the charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: buy firewood to make charcoal

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa  cooks banku to sell at Asebu near Cape Coast. She serves her banku with fried fish and vegetables sauce. Adwowa is a single parent with 5 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe and to pay her children's school fees. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase maize for her banku, fish, and vegetables for her sauce.  With the new profit, Adwowa wish to build a stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi has always been noted for being very hardworking.  This has allowed her and her family to carry on despite the great difficulties that have presented themselves in her life. Chizi is married and has five children, to whom she has always wanted to offer access to a high-quality education. That's why she has worked hard to seek better economic conditions for her household.

Previously, Chizi worked as an employee, and for a while she also worked for a relative. There, she learned the business of selling groceries and everyday household goods. Since she got her own store a few years ago, the quality of life in her household has improved considerably. Despite the fact that she doesn't have a great deal of capital and she still lacks many products that she could offer her customers, her hard work has kept her business open and growing.

Since she doesn't have much capital but wants to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, Chizi is seeking a loan to buy more inventory and be able to offer her customers more variety. Her dream is to carry on with her business and be able to offer her five children a better quality of life and better opportunities to progress economically.

loans.use: buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives together with her husband and 7 dependents in Asebu near Cape Coast.  Ekua  produce charcoal for sale, which she has done for 8 years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school free.  Ekua will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua will produce the charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: buy firewood to make charcoal

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 33-year-old person living with his wife in Ibb, Yemen.  He has been operating a grocery store for two years.  He was a worker in another grocery store until he collected enough money in order to open his own grocery store. To grow his business he needs some financial support. 

Ahmed has applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to add grocery items to his shop. He wants to purchase pickles, rice, lentils, cooking oil, canned food, softdrinks, etc. to add to his inventory. He hopes to have a supermarket.

loans.use: buy grocery items for his business

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa produces palm-kernel oil for sale in Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 15 years. Adwowa is married and has three children.  

Adwowa uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and kernels to produce her palm-kernel oil for sale. With the new profit, Adwowa will buy a machine for the production of her palm-kernel oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and kernels to produce palm-kernel oil for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and five children at Asebu near Caper Coast. Efua sells kenkey (fermented maize) and maize, which she has done for some years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell and to produce her kenkey to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell and to produce kenkey (fermented maize) to sell.

loans.name: Juntos Crecemos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Juntos Crecemos” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran;  feriantes, venta de comida rápida, venta de completos, venta de sopaipillas, venta de articulos de aseo, venta de ropa, venta de ensaladas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Julia integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color negro que sobresalen los cierres de color gris, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de  ferias libres donde ofrece ropa, articulos de aseo, ropa interior, desde hace 7 años. Comenta que trabaja los martes, jueves, viernes y sábados y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ponchos, chupallas, pañuelos, todo tipo de accesorio para las Fiestas Patrias.
Una de las metas de Julia son seguir con el negocio, poder ampliarse aun mas para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Julia vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 14 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es estar siempre vigente en las ventas, ya que con este trabajo de esfuerzo le ha podido pagar a su hijo los estudios, y guardar para el dia de mañana para que tenga estudios universitarios.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte se siente cómoda ya que existe respeto y confianza.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Juntos Crecemos.” It is made up of 17 members who work in different sectors, including sale of fast food, hot dogs, sopaipillas (Chilean fried pastry), personal hygiene items, clothing, salads, services and other activities. All of them are from the San Bernardo commune, located in the city of Santiago. 

Julia is a member of the communal bank. She is in the photo, standing in the first row, occupying the second place from left to right, wearing a black jacket with grey-colored zippers that stand out. She has light brown hair and wears it plulled back. 

She has been selling at street markets for seven years, offering clothing and hygiene items. She says that she works Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays, and that she arranges her hours of work according to her availability. 

She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in the city of Santiago, at distributors that are low-cost, and therefore advantageous financially. 

With the loan, she will buy ponchos, straw hats, handkerchiefs, and all kinds of accessories for the national holiday. 

One of Julia's goals is to contrinue with her business, and to be able to expand even more, in order to generate greater income, and this way aim for a better quality of life. 

Julia lives with her husband and 14-year-old son who is in school. Her dream at the family level is to always keep her sales business going; as this hard work has enabled her to pay for her son's schooling and save for tomorrow, so that he can attend university. 

She is very pleased and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the training has been key for her business and also for her personal development, as she has learned to better organize and allocate her revenues and expenditures. With respect to the group she belongs to, she feels at ease, as there is trust and respect. 

San Bernardo is a city located 18 km south in a straight line from the central square of Santiago (Chile's capital). It is known as the "Capital of Folklore," due to the fact that each year, in January, the International Folklore Festival takes place. This is an event in which the country's roots come together and musical groups from all over South America gather. 

The Traditional Crafts Fair is also held, in which both Chilean craftspeople and those of other nearby countries participate. Then in April, the April of a Thousand Cuecas is held, which involves having the entire commune dance the cueca (a traditional Chilean dance).

loans.use: To buy ponchos, straw hats, handkerchiefs, and all kinds of accessories for the national holiday.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She says thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Agnas

texts.en: Agnes is a producer palm kernel oil for sale at  Asebu near CapeCoast.  This she has done for some years now.  Agnes is married and has 1 child.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their child.  Agnes will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and kernel to produce her palm kernel oil for sale.  With the new profit, Agnes will a buy machine for the production of her palm kernel oil.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 45 years old, married and a father of eight children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a bookshop and call center for eight years. He became in need of funds to purchase more goods for the shop to meet the demands of his clients.  

Ahmed took a loan of 100,000 YR from Alamal Bank, which he will use to purchase additional products like books, pens, etc. to sell.  In the future, he hopes to be a high merchant in order to buy a stationery store and to earn an increased income from his business.

loans.use: buy books pens, etc. to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is in charge of a hair salon.  She is not married and has no child.  She set up the business with the intention of improving her standard of living, and also to support her mother and siblings.  Her business is doing well.  

Beatrice is requesting a loan in order to buy hair products such as hair oil, pomade, wigs and shampoo, which she will use to beautify customer hair. 

Beatrice is 25 years old and she has been operating her business for 5 years.  Her goal is to be self-sustainable before she get married.  This is her 5th loan with ID-Ghana and she needs 1000 Ghana cedis to buy items for the salon in order to meet the demands of the customers better. She has been taken loan from ID-Ghana since 2010. 

After senior high school, Beatrice decided to learn hair dressing, which is the source of her money now.  She took 750 Ghana cedis as a 4th loan and completed that repayment on 15/08/2012. She needs Kiva help to able to continuously move toward reaching her goal.

loans.use: buy hair products for her salon

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy runs a plastic products store in the city of Accra. She started this business because she saw there was no other such business in her area of residence. She manages the business herself every day from very early in the morning.  She sells plastic chairs, plastic bowls, plastic tables and plastic utensils. 

Dorothy is a 48-year-old single woman with a 12-year-old daughter.  With this loan, she will buy the above listed items as well as expand her business by selling fish. This is Dorothy's 2nd loan cycle with ID-Ghana.   In her 1st loan, she was loaned 300 Ghana cedis and completed repayment on 24/07/2012.   She needs an amount of 400 Ghana cedis to be able to buy more goods for her business.

loans.use: buy plastic products to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold).  She has done this for 20 years now.   The food she serves are banku, fufu, rice balls with fish, and meat soup.  She is a single parent and has 4 children.   Theresa uses her income to support her children and pay their school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase foodstuff and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Theresa plans to acquire a better place to enable her to serve her customers.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba cooks banku to sell at Kufur near Elmina. She serves her banku with okra soup and vegetables sauce.  Araba  is marrried and has 2 children.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Araba will use her loan to purchase maize for her banku, fish, and vegetables for her sauce. With the new profit, Araba wish to build a stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: buy in gredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary operates a grocery shop at Kufur near Elmina. She has done this for some  years now.   The items in her grocery shop are eggs, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, canned fish and tomatoes.    Mary is married and has 4 children.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Mary  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a drinks bar at Kufur near Elmina.  She sells different kinds of soft drinks, which she has done for 16 years now.  Efua is married and has 5 children.  She uses her income to support her partner to pay their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to satisfy her customers. She plans to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: buy softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells African printed cloth in Edukrom near Cape Coast. She is married and has two children; her husband is an electrician. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Mary will use her loan to purchase different kinds of African printed cloth to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of African printed cloth to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa produces charcoal for sale at Abura near Cape Coast.  She has done this for 2 years now.  Adwowa  is a married and has 7 dependents.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and pay their children’s school fees.  Adwowa will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwowa will produce the charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: buy firewood to make charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.  Catherine has a store that sells RTW's or ready-to-wear clothes like pants, T-shirts, blouses and skirts. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more RTW's to resell.

Catherine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beauty products for his salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Leonida  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Leonida  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.  Maria Liza  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Maria Liza  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.  Emma  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emma  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: 18 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el ciclo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jeanet es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de frutas, venta de cerveza, tejido de chompas, venta de calzados, tienda de barrio, comerciante de artículos varios, venta de salchipapa, venta de cosméticos, compra y venta de cocinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jeaneth es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, ella cuenta que este negocio lo inicio por el incentivo de sus padres desde hace varios años 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de las comerciantes que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “18 de Octubre" communal bank will begin its fifth loan cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Villa Exaltación regional office. It is made up of eight members, and led by a board of directors, of which Jeaneth is the Secretary. 

The businesses carried on by the members of the communal bank are varied, and include sale of fruit, sale of beer, weaving sweaters, sale of footwear, neighborhood store, general retail, sale of salchipapas (fast food dish made of hot dogs and potatoes), sale of cosmetics, and buying and selling stoves.

The loan they will take out will benefit people with small businesses, including Jeaneth. She says this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her friend, who is a member of the institution. 

Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She says that she started this business several years ago, through the encouragement of her parents.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital by purchasing clothing, which she will buy from wholesalers and later sell at her stand.  This form of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family as best she can, as she is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training in health and credit.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Neziel

texts.en:
Neziel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.   

Neziel provides motorela or motorcycle services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to pay for maintenance of her vehicle.

Neziel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Jonaflor

texts.en:
Jonaflor is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children and has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has been running this business for six years. 

Jonaflor has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 52-year-old married mother of four children, who lives in the Philippines. For the past eight years, she has been running a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages.  

Aida has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business so that she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Fany Gisela

texts.es: Fany tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su conyugue y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Hace dos años que Fany se dedica a  vender mercadería de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Vende ropa nueva y usada, adicional vende cremas, perfumes, desodorantes de productos de catalogo de AVON y VOGUE. Ella lleva cinco ciclos de préstamos con ODEF para mantener activo su negocio. El préstamo actual es por 6,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de un fardo de ropa usada para mantener siempre inventario y poder abrir un nuevo mercado. Sus planes  son  incrementar las ventas, llegar a tener una tienda de ropa y terminar su carrera universitaria para  poderle dar a su familia una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Fany is 30 years old, and lives with her partner and three minor children in the town of Tela, Atlántida. 

For two years, Fany has been selling merchandise door-to-door, and by orders. She sells new and used clothing, as well as creams, perfumes and deodorants from the Avon and Vogue product catalogs. 

This is her fifth loan with ODEF, needed to keep her business brisk. The present loan is for 6,000 lempiras, and she will spend it on the purchase of a bundle of used clothing, in order to always maintain an inventory and be able to open a new market.
