Her plans are to increase her sales, eventually have a clothing store, and finish her university degree, so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of used clothing.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Молодой и весьма приятный молодой человек, которого зовут  Алишер, более 5 лет занимается услугами такси. Ему 27 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его жена занимается купле продажей одеждой. Алишер должен развивать свой бизнес и преувеличивать доход. Для этого он должен отремонтировать машину для привлечения клиентов. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму  5000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Alisher is a nice young man who has worked in the taxi business for more than five years. He is 27 years old and married with one child. His wife works in clothing retail. 

Alisher needs to develop his business and increase his income. In order to do this, he needs to refurbish his car to attract more clients. Hence, he is requesting this 5000 sumoni loan. He is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To refurbish his car

loans.name: Gulya

texts.ru:
Гуле 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Гуля работает преподавателем в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  10 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Гули в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гуля обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку крупного рогатого скота для откорма и доходов от продажи молочной продукции.  Доходы от кредита Гуля планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки земельного участка.
texts.en:
Gulya is a 47-year-old married woman with two children. She works as a teacher at a local school, but for extra income, she has also worked in crop farming and animal husbandry for more than ten years. She started her business with 10,000 som, and thanks to persistent hard work she now owns 15 sheep. Her farming provides her with a monthly income of about 5,000 som. 

With the long-term development of her business in mind, Gulya turned to the company Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som. She wants to use this loan to purchase cattle. She want to fatten them and sell their dairy products. Gulya plans to invest the extra income back into her business by purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru: Ширин работает на фабрике  ткачихой, ее считают ценным сотрудником в предприятие. Она любящая мать 2 детей. Начала сотрудничество  с нашей организацией  в этом году, она планирует сделать ремонт дома. Муж Ширин тоже работает на государственной организации .Зарплата невысокая и не хватает накопить на крупные расходы и поэтому они решили получить кредит на ремонт своей квартиры, которая нуждается в срочном ремонте. Она хочет купить строительные материалы и начать ремонт.Шерин надеется не нарушая политику кредитования, погасить этот кредит и ещё сотрудничать с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
Shirin works as a factory weaver, and she is considered a valuable part of the enterprise where she works. She is also the loving mother of two children. 

Shirin began working with our organization this year. She is planning to renovate her home. Her husband also works for a government organization, but his salary is low and not enough to save for big expenses. Hence, they decided to take a loan to renovate their apartment, which urgently needs this renovation. Shirin wants to purchase construction materials and begin the renovation. She hopes to repay her loan without breaking any loan policies and to continue working with our organization.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир женат. У него с супругой есть взрослый сын Степан. 

Владимир имеет две машины: легковую и грузовую. Он предоставляет услуги таксиста и перевозчика овощей и фруктов. Этот бизнес приносит ему достаточную прибыль. Владимир обеспечивает свою семью. Он выносливый и сильный духом.

Владимир просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 24000 гривен на покупку новых скатов для легковой машины и для микроавтобуса.
texts.en:
Vladimir is married. He and his wife have a grown-up son, Stepan. Vladimir has two vehicles: One car and one truck. He provides taxi service and transportation of vegetables and fruit. This business brings him sufficient income. Vladimir provides for his family. He is tough and strong-willed. 

Vladimir asks for a loan in the amount of 24,000 hryvnia for the purchase of new ramps for the car and the truck.

loans.use: to purchase new ramps for his car and his truck

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван женат. У него двое детей. Иван работает маляром на швейной фабрике больше 11 лет. Он трудолюбивый, настойчивый и ответственный. Иван имеет постоянный заработок.

Иван просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 8000 гривен на покупку мебели для кухни и газовой плиты. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия его семьи.
texts.en:
Ivan is married. He has two children. Ivan has worked as a painter at a garment factory for more than 11 years. He is hard working, persistent and responsible. Ivan has a steady income. 

Ivan requests a loan in the amount of 8,000 hryvnia for the purchase of furniture for the kitchen and of a gas stove. The loan helps improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove and furniture for the kitchen

loans.name: Lyuba

texts.ru:
Люба занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке родного города и имеет большой опыт в этом деле.

Люба уже брала ранее кредиты в КИВА. Последний кредит помог ей купить комплекты женской одежды и увеличить доход  на 1000 гривен. Это улучшило благосостояние ее семьи. 

Любовь просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку одежды к началу учебного года. Она хотела бы закупить кофты, джинсы и юбки.
texts.en:
Lyuba is engaged in selling women's clothing at the market of her hometown, and has wide experience in this business. Lyuba has also previously taken a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped her purchase sets of women's clothing and improved the income with 1,000 hryvnia. This improved the welfare of her family. 

Lyuba requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia for the purchase of clothing for the beginning of the school year. She would like to purchase sweaters, jeans and skirts.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, jeans and skirts for the fall season

loans.name: Ya Nere Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est  responsable du groupe YA NERE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Mme se porte bien. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 10mois. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes, des prêts à porter et des chaussures  depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché du secteur 10. Elle a bien exécuté son prêt passé  et est très contente. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 05 pièces de pagnes, ½ douzaine de chaussures et ½ douzaine de prêts à porter.

Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité et s’acheter une moto. Elle souhaite cette voici agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et pouvoir épargner. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Haoua is the Ya Nere group leader. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 12 years and 10 months. Two children are going to school and Haoua is responsible for 3 people. She is doing well. 

Haoua has been selling pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric), ready-to-wear clothes, and shoes for 10 years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are both women and men. 

She managed her previous loan well and is very happy. [For this loan] Haoua would like to buy 5 lengths of pagnes, 1/2 dozen pairs of shoes, and a 1/2 dozen pieces of clothing. 

She will use her profits to improve her business and to buy herself a motorbike. She would like to expand her business to better serve her customers and to be able to save up money. She hopes one day to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy 5 lengths of pagnes, 1/2 dozen pairs of shoes, and 1/2 dozen pieces of clothing

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Groupe 1

texts.fr: APEC AL OUMA GROUPE 1  est un sous groupe de 10 femmes  qui habitent  le meme village dans une des localités sénégalaises et adhèrent aussi dans la meme association (APEC AL OUMA). Elles exercent des activités séparées et diversifiées de commerce. Elles ont déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elles sont représentées par madame Ndiapaly(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo).  Elle s’active depuis 20 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de poissons et d’autres produits alimentaires divers dans la localité ou elle habite. Son activité lui génère des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Elle commence chaque jour ses activités  a 6 heures du matin pour rentrer chez elle a 17 heures dans l’après midi. Elle sollicite un crédit destiné a augmenter son fond de roulement afin de se procurer du poisson et des produits alimentaires pour les besoins  de son commerce. Elle ambitionne d’être une grande commerçante importatrice de produits qu’elle commercialise.
texts.en:
Apec Al Ouma Groupe 1, a subgroup of the association Apec Al Ouma, is comprised of 10 women who live in the same Senegalese village community. They are involved in a variety of different businesses. They have already repaid a previous loan. 

They are represented by Ndiapaly (whose hand is raised in the photo). She has been in business for 20 years selling fish and other food products in the area where she lives. 

Her business brings in profits that allow her to take care of her family's living expenses. She starts work each day at 6 am and returns home at 5 pm. 

She is requesting this loan in order to increase her working capital so she can procure fish and other food products that she needs for her business. She hopes to become a major importer of the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food products for resale

loans.name: Maira Arely

texts.es:
Maira tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene 3 años de administrar su propio cafetín, aprendió el negocio con su familia. Los productos los compra en una ciudad y otros se los llegan a dejar a su negocio los proveedores. 

Maira  solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más productos de primera necesidad y para ampliar las instalaciones del cafetín. Con la inversión, tendrá más espacio para atender a sus clientes, y ofrecerles más productos satisfaciendo sus necesidades, lo que le permitirá obtener ingresos que le sirvan para brindarle educación, salud y vestuario a su familia.
texts.en:
Maira is 27 years old. She is married and she has two children. She has run her own snack stand for three years. She learned the business from her family. She buys products in the city and other products arrive at the business from suppliers. 
Maira is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to purchase more staple products and to expand the snack stand’s facilities. With the investment, she will have more space to cater to her customers and offer them more products to satisfy their needs. This will allow her to earn profits that will give education, health and clothing to her family.

loans.use: purchase more staple products and to expand the snack stand’s facilities

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Djibril ; c’est un commerçant qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 6 ans maintenant. Activité de quoi  il vit et fait vivre sa famille. Djibril habite dans un petit village ou on a récemment installé un guichet IMCEC car le besoin se faisait sentir pour ses habitants qui sont la plupart du temps très actifs. Djibril a l’habitude d’acheter du fumier en quantité pour le revendre. Il est à son 1èr crédit et sollicite 50000F CFA pour pouvoir acheter 30 sacs. Comme on voit sur la photo ; il stocke une grande quantité.
Comme projet futur : il voudrait avec le soutien des préteurs ; ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits agricoles.
texts.en:
Our lender is named Djibril; he is a merchant who has run his business for over six years now. He makes a living from and supports his family through his business. Djibril lives in a small time where a new IMCEC branch has recently opened, thanks to the need of the inhabitants who are very active most of the time. Djibril buys manure in bulk for resale. He is on his first loan and is seeking 50,000 FCFA to be able to buy 30 bags. As is visible in the photo, he stocks large quantities. 
As a future project, he would like to open a large store selling agricultural products, with the support of lenders.

loans.use: To buy manure for resale in town.

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Ngor Groupe 2

texts.fr: APEC AL OUMA NGOR GROUPE 2  est un sous groupe de 10 femmes  qui habitent  le meme village dans une des localités sénégalaises et adhèrent aussi dans la meme association (APEC AL OUMA). Elles exercent des activités séparées et diversifiées de commerce. Elles ont déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elles sont représentées par madame FATOU (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo).  Elle s’active depuis plus de 30 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente d’huile de palme, d’habits et de petit déjeuner. Son activité lui génère des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Elle commence chaque jour ses activités  a 7 heures du matin pour rentrer chez elle a 00 heures  dans la nuit. Elle sollicite un crédit destiné a augmenter son fond de roulement afin de se procurer des habits a revendre pour mieux développer son activité de commerce. Son ambition est de voyager au Lieu SAINT pour y exercer une activité de commerce plus intéressante.
texts.en: The "Apec Al Ouma Ngor Groupe 2" is a subgroup of 10 women who live in the same town in an area in Senegal and belong to the same association (Apec Al Ouma). They run their own separate and diverse businesses and have already repaid one previous loan. They are represented by Ms. Fatou (whose hand is raised in the photo). She has been active in the commercial sector for more than 30 years and sells palm oil, clothing, and breakfast meals. Her business provides her with an income that allows her to take care of her family's daily expenses. She begins her work at 7 in the morning every day and returns home at midnight. She is seeking a loan destined to increase her working capital in order to procure clothing for resale and better develop her business. Her ambition is to travel to Lieu Saint to run a more interesting business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Teresita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jane Rosaly

texts.en:
Jane Rosaly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shells crafts business in the Philippines.

Jane Rosaly has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shells crafts business.

Jane Rosaly has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Jane Rosaly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shells crafts business.

loans.name: Salvi

texts.en:
Salvi works hard to support her family. Salvi is married and has a dry-goods business in the Philippines.

Salvi has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell.

Salvi has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Salvi would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a general store business in the Philippines. Letecia has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

Letecia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as cheese, flour, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Miguelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.  Miguelita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy meat, dressed chicken, hot dogs, and other ingredients for her food business.

Miguelita has sustained her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of buildimg and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, hotdogs, and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and married, with five children.  With four children still in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Marites has been in this business for three years, and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Macel

texts.en:
Macel works hard to support her family. Macel is single, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Macel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

Macel has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Macel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con él. Es albañil de profesión, construye casas y hace mejoras de viviendas junto con su hijos, ya que ellos aprendieron bien el oficio de albañilería y hacen contratos por obra. También se dedica a  agricultura específicamente a la siembra de maíz. En esta oportunidad quiere sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Esta actividad, la realiza desde hace más de 35 años. Cuenta que su familia se dedicaba ha esta actividad productiva, es patrimonio familiar.

Los fertilizantes, abono, semilla, formula los compra en ferreterías de la zona, que se encuentran a una distancia de su casa de habitación de dos kilómetros.

Este es el segundo financiamiento KIVA que solicita don Juan y es para comprar: ocho sacos de fertilizantes, cincuenta libras de semilla, dos litros de herbicidas y pago de mano de obra.

La necesidad primordial y mas importante que sera satisfecha con la inversión, es la siembra de maíz para el consumo de él y de su familia. Ya que la tierra la preparo con anticipación y le urge sembrar la milpa de postrera. Ademas, podrá obtener la semilla del maíz,  debido a que en temporadas se pone muy cara y él no tiene suficiente dinero para comprarla de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida, por que no se preocupara por este producto ya que lo almacenara.  

Don Juan, Tiene planes a futuro de seguir con el mejoramiento de la vivienda ya que le faltan varios de talles para terminarla. Estos planes los tiene para final de año que en El Salvador se encuentra en estación lluviosa.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old, is married and he has five children, only one of whom lives with him. He is a mason by profession, he builds houses and improves homes together with his children, now that they have learned the profession of masonry and they complete work contracts. He also works as a farmer, specifically by planting corn. This time around he wants to sow 14,000 square meters of corn. He has been doing this activity for more than 35 years. He told us that his family worked on this productive activity, that it is part of his family heritage.

He buys the fertilizers, manure, seeds, formulates in the markets in the region that he visits at a distance of two kilometers from his house. 

This is the second Kiva loan that Juan seeks and it is to purchase: eight sacks of fertilizers, 50 pounds of seeds, two litres of herbicides and payment for manual labor.

The most basic and most important necessity that would be met by the investment is the planting of corn for him and his family's consumption. Now that the earth is prepared in anticipation, he feels an urge to plant the corn in rows. Moreover, he will obtain the corn seeds now, because later in the season it is very expensive and he does not have sufficient money to buy it. This way he can improve his quality of life. It doesn't worry him because this product can be stored. 

Juan has plans for the future to continue improving his home because it lacks several details in order to be finished. He has made these plans for the end of the year, when El Salvador is in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of fertilizers, 50 pounds of seeds, two litres of herbicides and payment for manual labor.

loans.name: Cachi Lipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CACHI LIPE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora es la Catalina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de comida, venta de queso, chofer, venta de ganado, venta de ovejas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Catalina es una integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene negocios de venta de queso que emprendió con a sugerencia de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliación de negocio (compra de vacas) mismo que comprará de las ferias las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The Cachi Lipe Community Bank will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Achacachi group. Cachi Lipe has eight members and has a board of directors headed by President Sra. Catalina. 

The members have a variety of businesses including food selling, cheese selling, driver, cattle selling, and sheep selling. Catalina is one of the small business people who will benefit from the loan. She has been working with Pro Mujer for three years after joining at the invitation of an advisor who came to her house. Currently Catalina has a business selling cheese, which she began at the suggestion of her mother.

The loan she is seeking will be used to grow her business. She plans to buy some cows in the nearby community markets and then after making the cheese she will sell it in her local market. This will enable her to generate an income to help her family as much as possible. She is married and has five children.

Catalina most enjoys the health training sessions provided by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: buy some cows

loans.name: Laura Victoria Fernanda

texts.es:
Laura es una joven de 20 años de edad con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque quiere que sus padres se sientan muy orgullosos de ella, Su vivienda se ubica en la calurosa ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika, entre otros, posee lugares turísticos muy visitados entre los cuales tenemos a la “Laguna de Huacachina”. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer obras literarias pero también le agrada compartir con su familia uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Día a día Laura trabaja como mesera en una cafetería de su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo puedo solventar los gastos de sus estudios superiores, ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de economía, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias ya que por las noches va a clase; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable.

Laura está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora, ya que actualmente ella acude a cabinas de internet para poder realizar sus trabajos, de esta manera ella podrá tener una herramienta muy necesaria para sus estudios ya no tendrá que gastar mucho dinero en alquilar una cabina, así ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Laura is a young women who is 20 years old with a lot of desire to get ahead, above all because she wants her parents to feel very proud of her. Her home is located in the hot city of Ica, which is characterized by its hot and friendly climate. In Ica they produce agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus and paprika, among others. It has tourist attractions that are frequently visited, among which is the "Huacachina lagoon". When she has free time she likes to read literary works but also she likes to share with her family one of her favorite dishes which is the very rich "rice with chicken."

Each day Laura works as a waitress in a restaurant in her city. With the fruit of this labor she can pay for the expenses of higher education. She is currently studying the major of economics. She works 8 hours per day and goes to classes at night. She thinks that her work is successful because she is very friendly with the clients and above all she is responsible. 

Laura is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help that they have provided she will be able to buy a computer. Right now she goes to internet kiosks to do her school work. This way, she will be able to have a tool that is very necessary to her studies and she won't have to spend a lot of money to rent a kiosk. By this means she will be able to continue fighting to be able to accomplish her greatest dream "to finish her major and to be a renown professional."

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pareja y su pequeña hija, a pesar de ser tan joven él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja tienen mucho deseos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Miguel no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y con el apoyo de su pareja, Miguel puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras, él cuenta con un pequeño espacio en el mercado central de su distrito donde realiza sus ventas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos para elaborar especerías tales como: mostaza, diversos ajís molidos, culantro molido, pimienta, entre otros; de esta manera Miguel tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio, con ello él espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzando para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante y superarse.
texts.en:
Miguel is 20 years old and lives in the city of Ina, in the district of Parcona with his partner and young daughter. Despite being so young, he is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who along with his partner, have great desire to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, because of the need to work to cover their expenses, Miguel wasn't able to pursue a professional career, though he would have greatly liked to do so. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and on some occasions he cooks a delicious beef stew to share with his family. 

With much effort, enthusiasm and the support of his partner, Miguel launched his small business of selling vegetables. He has a small space in a central market in his district where he makes his sales. Everyday, from the early hours of the morning, he starts his work and works approximately 12 hours daily. He thinks it is going well because of his dedication and for the kind treatment he provides his customers. Miguel is very grateful for the loans from Kiva. Thanks to the assistance provided he will be able to purchase ingredients to prepare spices like: mustard, various ground aji, ground coriander, and pepper among others. This way Miguel's business will be better stocked and he hopes to increase his sales and income, which will allow him to expand his business little by little so he can continue working and striving, along with his family, to get ahead in life.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to prepare spices.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and married, with fve children.

Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries, etc., in her general store.

Carmelita has borrowed -- and repaid -- 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for 20 years, and she also earns an income from fish vending.

Carmelita aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшану 18 лет. Он молодой, энергичный и приятный молодой человек. Равшан с отличными оценками окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Худжанский Государственный Университет факультет Иностранных языков. Среди однокурсников Равшан уже имеет хороший статус и уважение. Он очень любит читать зарубежную литературу на английском языке. В свободное время он занимается спортом. Особенно он играет футбол. Равшан еще не женился и живет с родителями. Зарплата его родителей не хватает оплатить за учебу в университете и поэтому он запрашивает кредит на сумму 525 долларов США. Он надеется на вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем стать переводчиком и таким образом осуществить его заветную мечту!
texts.en: Ravshan is 18 years old and he is a young, energetic and pleasant young man.  He finished high school with outstanding marks and has earned a space in the Foreign Languages department of Khujand State University.  Ravshan already enjoys good status and respect among his classmates and he loves to read foreign literature in English.  In his free time, he enjoys playing sports, especially football.  Ravshan is not yet married and he lives with his parents.  His parents' income is not enough to pay for his university studies, which is why is asking for a loan of 525 US dollars.  He looks forward to your kindness.  Let's help him become a translator, which would make his cherished dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for university study

loans.name: José Moises

texts.es:
José tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo. Se siente muy feliz con su familia y de trabajar con la Fundación Campo, su familia esta muy unida; actualmente esta en casa de su mamá, pero en un futuro necesita construir su propia casa. Él toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo, como agricultor  de hortalizas y jornalero. 

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para recolectar la cosecha de maíz, pago de mano de obra. Él manifiesta que ha tenido una buena producción y muchas ganancias. Al recolectar la cosecha la almacenara para tener seguro el alimento para su familia. Sus objetivos son el construir su casa de bahareque y adobe, instalar una granja de cerdos más grande, continuar trabajando con la Institución y ahorrar.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old and lives with his life partner and his son.  He feels very happy with his family and his work with Fundación Campo.  His family is very close.  He currently lives in his mother’s house but in the future he needs to build his own house.  All of his life he has made a living working in the field as a farmer of vegetables and as a day laborer. 

He is applying for a loan from Fundación Campo to collect the corn harvest and to pay for labor.  He states that he has had a good production and a lot of gains.  Upon collecting the harvest he will store it in order to have food security for his family.  His objectives are to build his house of waddle and daub (a structure made from either bamboo or sugar cane stalks woven together and filled in with straw and mud) and adobe, set up a larger pig farm, continue working with the institution and save money.

loans.use: to collect the corn harvest and pay for labor.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old and married, with four children.

Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Remedios has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Remedios aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Rayma

texts.en:
Rayma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rope-making business.

Rayma has been in this business for 10 years. Rayma earns additional income from clothing sales.

Rayma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tacianita

texts.en:
Tacianita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Tacianita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Felicidad is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

She has a business selling pigs and had this business for more than seven years. She earns PHP 18,000 a month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs for her business.

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her piggery and have a meat shop on her own.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her business.

loans.name: Edito

texts.en:
Edito is 46 years old, married to Rebecca and has eight children. Edito has a farming business which he has operated for more than 10 years now. He is very happy to have an income derived from the business as it serves for the family's sustenance and especially for school fees. He was not able to send all his children to college because he doesn't have the financial means to sustain them all. Some of his children already got married and live separately from him. He still manages the farming business.  

He has insufficient funds and would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay labor fees and purchase rice seeds to grow. Someday, he hopes to harvest a productive crop and get more income so he can save for the family.

loans.use: to pay labor fees and buy rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Sheily

texts.es:
Sheily, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Está casada con German quien es docente y  padre de su hija Josie de 17 años de edad. Habita su casa propia en compañía de su hermana y suegra. La actividad que realiza Sheily es la venta de bebidas gaseosas para eso cuenta con una congeladora grande que compró con el apoyo del padre de su esposo, y en donde guardan y sus bebidas bien heladas al gusto de sus clientes. También vende golosinas de diversas presentaciones y marcas.
 Tiene más de 4 años dedicándose a éste negocio, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes ganándose la preferencia de ellos, de esa manera recomienden con otras personas, para luego convertirse en nuevos clientes. 
Tenía apuros económicos para pagar los gastos de su hogar por eso le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y le permite sentirse ocupada contando con un oficio. 
Considera a su negocio rentable por la demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y hacerlo crecer y en un futuro abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes. Este es el préstamo número 9 con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta  de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas de diversa marcas y sabores, así como golosinas, ambos en mayor volumen para tener un stock surtido y disponible para la venta buscando precios más bajos por el volumen de sus compras.
texts.en:
44-year old Sheily is a hardworking, diligent woman as well as being friendly and likable. She is married to German, a teacher and father to their daughter 17-year old Josie. She lives in her own house along with her sister and mother-in-law. Sheila earns her living selling soft drinks so she has a big refrigerator which she bought with help from her father and husband. The drinks are kept there so they are cold, just the way her customers like them. She also sells candy of different types and brands.
Sheily has had her business for more than four years, serving her customers in a friendly manner so they choose to buy from her. Their recommendations have also brought her new customers.

She has had difficulties paying for household expenses so she likes her business as it generates an income and allows her to feel usefully occupied. Sheily says the business is profitable as there is a demand for what she sells. Her plans for the future include continuing with the business and growing it. She would also like to open a grocery store.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she wishes to continue working with the institution so she can complete her objectives. She also enjoys working with her community bank and helping other people improve their businesses. 

With the 2,500 soles loan she is seeking, Sheily will buy soft drinks of different brands and flavours as well as candy in large amounts so that her store is well-stocked. She will be able to buy at lower prices because of the volume of purchases.

loans.use: buy different brands and flavours of soft drinks and candy

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying & selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buying & selling of vegetables business.

Amalia has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from fish vending and farming vegetables.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur whose business is buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 11 years. Gemma earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and farming rice.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Mercy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a 37-year-old married man and a father of two young children ages six and a month old baby. He is a fisherman. His wife works as a healthcare staff in the community clinic. Raul has been in the fishing business for five years. This is his way of living. Raul plans to expand his business but lacks the financial means to do it. With that, he joined CEVI to gain access to financial services offered by the organization. He is requesting for a loan worth 8,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets. With this, Raul will be able to improve his daily catch. 

In the future, Raul dreams of making his business a success. Moreover, he plans to explore new possible ventures to enhance his daily earnings. He also wants to save for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany is 41 years old and is living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has three children, two daughters and one son. One is still in school and the others work as paid workers in the local area. To support her family, Dany has been farming rice for twenty years while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver to supplement their income. The main challenge for their business, beside lack of water for the rice crops, is the fact that her husband's motorbike is broken.

This is the first microloan for Dany with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan of US$500 to buy a decent motorbike to support her husband’s business. Dany hopes the new motorbike will work well, unlike the old one which is very often broken and costs lots of money to fix, and that as a result, she will be able to save some money for other future needs.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: LA SRA JUANITA TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA CON EL SR. JUAN. ELLOS VIVEN SOLOS EN SU CASA YA QUE SUS HIJOS YA SON GRANDES Y ESTAN CASADOS. SU ESPOSO RECIBE UNA PENSION CADA MES CON LA CUAL SUPLE LOS GASTOS EN SU CASA. ELLA SE DEDICA AL HOGAR Y PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO VENDE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA POR CATALAGO. DE ESTAR MANERA JUNTOS CUBREN SU NECESIDADES. ACTUALMENTE HAN ESTADO TRABAJANDO EN SU CASA REALIZANDO ARREGLOS PARA MEJORAR SU HOGAR. POR ESTE MOTIVO JUANITA HA SOLICITADO UN CREDITO CON EL CUAL LLEVARAN ACABO LA REALIZACION DEL CUARTO DE COCINA CON EL CUAL BUSCAN PODER AMPLIAR MAS EL ESPACIO DE SU CASA Y LES BRINDE UNA MAYOR COMIDAD EN SU HOGAR.
texts.en:
Sra. Juanita is 50 years old and married to Sr. Juan. They live alone in their house since their children are all grown up and married. Her husband receives a pension every month that covers household expenses. Juanita is a housewife and also sells beauty products from catalogs in order to help her husband. In this way the two are able to support themselves. 

They have currently been working on their house and making repairs to improve it. That is the reason Juanita has requested a loan in order to finish construction on the kitchen, so they can expand the space and make their home more comfortable.

loans.use: to finish constructing a new kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 61 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, a driver, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Amelia oversees the operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, from which she receives a boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Amelia dreams to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

- Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two children aged 12 and ten. She is a merchant and sells different kinds of products to the people in the locality. She sells ready to-wear-garments such as shirts and pants as well as household and kitchen materials.

Teodula has been engaged in this business for more than ten years now. This is where she gets her daily income which helps to meet some of the needs of the family especially the schooling of her two children.

In the future, Teodula dreams of making her business a successful one. Moreover, she wants to send her children to school continuously so that they can learn better and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as ready-to-wear garments and household materials.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is patiently selling fruit to people in the public market. He is married to Gina, a mother, who helps him to manages their business. Together, they are raising their children. The couple wants to provide a good education for their children, so they have been running this business for almost six years now and earn about PHP 4,000 monthly. 

This time, Albert is borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy citrus fruits and mangoes to sell. Albert would like to increase his sales. The couple is working toward the diversification of their business and with the aim of keeping on providing better service to their customers.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 57, Chheang is a rural villager in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married with seven children, one of whom is still dependent on her and helps the family’s business. She is a housewife who takes care of her child while her husband owns a small construction business in the village. The business earns him about 26,000 KHR per day. Lacking working capital to support the construction business is the main challenge for her husband’s business.

Chheang has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other member in her group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans have helped her family to have sufficient food to eat. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan from VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR, respectively. With her portion, she is going to buy construction materials for her husband’s business. She hopes to have sufficient materials for his construction works so that the workers can perform the work faster and more money will be generated, and as a result her family can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is single and lives with his parents in Imishli. He has a small grocery store which is located near his home. His family has been running the grocery store for 10 years and earns an income from this business. This is the only source of income for the family. They have a lot of customers. 

Murad is 25 years old, and a young man who has a very good reputation in his community. His neighbors and his friends have a very good opinion of him. Murad requested the loan of an amount of 1,500 AZN from Kiva partner AqroInvest CU. He will use his loan to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or convenience store business for several years now. She also sells cooked snack foods to the people in the community. This is the source of her daily income.

Reina plans to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, shampoo and detergents, and ingredients for cooking. With this, Reina dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, shampoo and detergents, and ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Nahouri Group

texts.fr:
Mme WOUWOLO est  responsable du groupe NAHOURI. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Elle se porte bien.Mme a pu acheter ses objets comme prévu.Le plus âgé a 37ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Mme  vend des objets plastiques depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  au marché de Gounghin. Gràce à son crédit, elle a pu augmenter la quantité de ses marchandises. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes( amis et voisins).

Elle veut s’acheter ½ douzaine de seaux, 02 douzaines de plats, etc.

Avec ses économies, elle veut épargner et prendre soin de sa famille. Mme ambitionne aider son enfant dans ses études (scolarité).
texts.en:
Wouwolo is the leader of the NAHOURI group. She is married and mother of six children. She is doing well. Wouwolo was able to buy her items as planned. Her eldest child is 37 years old, and her youngest child is 17 years old. One of her children goes to school, and she has three other children living in her care.

Wouwolo has been selling plastic items for five years now. She stocks up at the large market and at the market in Gounghin. Thanks to her loan, she was able to increase the quantity of her goods. Her customer base consists of both men and women (friends and neighbors).

She would like to buy half a dozen buckets, two dozen dishes, etc.

She wants to save the extra money that she earns and take care of her family. She plans to help her son in his studies (schooling).

loans.use: to buy half a dozen buckets, two dozen dishes, etc.

loans.name: Sreypin

texts.en:
Sreypin lives in Thmor Koul district located in Battamabng province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and has two dependent sons, both of whom help the family’s business. Sreypin is a cloth-seller and her husband is a barber in the local area to help the family generate their income. They have been in these business for almost ten years. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for Sreypin's business. 

Sreypin is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy a motorbike for her family to travel to work. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a proper motorbike for commuting which in return will save them some time when travelling to work and back home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work and back home.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun, 53, lives with his wife in a rural area of Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has six children, two of whom are dependent on the family and still in school. For four years, he has made a living through selling homemade Soya milk and coffee in the local area, while his wife supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. The current business earns him about 12,000 KHR per day and allows him to save about 8,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. However, lack of working capital is still the main challenge for his business. 

Sarun’s group consists of two males and this is the seventh loan for his group with VisionFund. The past loans have helped him to have sufficient food and support his children’s education. He and his group member are applying for a loan of 1,100,000KHR each. As the leader, Sarun will use his share to buy more grocery items for his wife to sell such as eggs, salt, sugar and so on. He hopes to increase his income further through selling these grocery products so as to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 53-year-old married man from Imishli. He is living with his wife and two sons. He has owned a small grocery store for 15 years, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Elman requested to borrow 1,000 AZN from Kiva's partner, AqroInvest CU, to increase his shop’s inventory. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 20 years old, married, and the father of one daughter. Samir has been a wheat farmer for the last 2 years, and he also raises livestock. Samir's wife supports him in farming. This is his first loan, which he spent on preparing land for planting wheat and the remaining amount on buying some livestock. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting wheat and to buy some livestock

loans.name: Aliaga

texts.en: Aliaga, a 59-year-old man who lives in Imishli with his wife and their four children, has owned a grocery store for almost 10 years. He decided to start this business because he wanted to work independently. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, eggs, bread, etc.. Aliaga is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients who are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan, his first, from AqroInvest in order to purchase merchandise for his store. When Aliaga first started his business, he successfully confronted both financial issues and competition. In the future, he plans to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Marlene works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marlene is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. Riza is single and has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Riza requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shell craft business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 65 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable, es separada del padre de sus 2 hijas: Mia Cecilia de 24 y Auda de 22 años de edad y su nieto. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Antonia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, para lo cual cuenta con una refrigeradora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor, quienes compran para llevar a tomar en otros lugares,  y no toman en la casa de Antonia.
Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 3 años,  y contando con la ayuda de su hija en la venta del producto a los clientes. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades. 
Por otro lado, comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo, en toda actividad social ya que siempre tiene demanda. Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería, ósea las bebidas gasificadas en variados sabores y marcas, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras, de esa manera espera aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia is 65 years old. She is a hardworking and dynamic woman, in addition to being cheerful and sociable. She is separated from the father of her two daughters: Mia Cecilia, 24 and Auda, 22. She also has a grandson. They live together in their own home. Antonia's activity is selling soft drinks, for which she has a refirgerator in her house. She keeps her products there at the temperature the consumers like. The customers buy the drinks to drink somewhere else; they don't drink them in Antonia's house.

She has done this activity for more than 3 years. She has the help of her daughter for selling the product to her customers. She considers her business to be profitable because of the earnings it brings in. She is able to pay some of her family's expenses. She also likes the free time that she has that she uses doing other activities.
 
She also says that she has no losses because it is a very popular product used in every social gathering and for which there is always a demand. This is loan number 6 for the MFP institution and she is committed  to making her payments on time. She is also happy with her communal bank, because she considers the members to be committed and supportive people. 

With the amount she has asked for, 2500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying merchandise, that is, different flavors and brands of soft drinks, seeking low prices by buying in bulk. This way, she hopes she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy various flavors and brands of soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Albertina, ahora tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se dedica a la   Ganadería, principalmente a la producción y venta  de leche. Albertina necesita producir más leche para cubrir con su demanda, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Albertina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Albertina quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
This member's name is Albertina. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in the Tambo Real district in the province of Anta. She works raising cattle, mainly producing and selling milk. Albertina needs to produce more milk to cover the demand. That is why she will invest the loan in buying a dairy cow.

She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop this activity. She is committed to making her payments on time. Albertina belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” communal bank in the district of Tambo Real in the province of  Anta in Cuzco – Peru.

Albertina wants to giver her children a better life and education. She sacrifices for them and hopes to work a lot and save to invest their education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Nora has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Nora is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business. Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Haidee has been in this business for one year. Haidee earns additional income from a general store.

Haidee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en: Abdurahim is married and has five children. Abdurahim is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. He began his own business dealing in animal husbandry when his children were little. He requested a loan for the amount of 3,000 USD to buy feed for cows. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy feed for cows.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year. Alice requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

In the future, Alice would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Margarita is borrowing 3,500 PHP through NWTF to buy a SOLAR. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Margarita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy carismática. Está casada con  Marden quien es obrero, llevan viviendo muchos años juntos, fruto de esa unión tienen 4 hijos: los 3 mayores de ellos ya son independientes. Juntos viven en compañía de su última hija Janise de 21 años de edad en su propia casa.
La  actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de helados de una marca reconocida y bebidas gasificadas de diversos sabores y marcas, contando con un refrigerador instalado  en su propia casa que logró comprar con sus propios ingresos, comenta que en temporada de verano tiene bastante demanda, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes. Empezó éste negocio con su esposo hace más de 4 años con un préstamo de MFP, con el que pagaban parte de sus gastos, y hasta en momento le sigue apoyando en sus ratos libres.
Le gusta su actividad por el ingreso económico con el cual logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ahora que tiene a su última hija en su casa, le brinda  educación, como hizo con sus  hijos mayores.
Así como también sigue en el negocio por la necesidad de contar un ingreso económico  y sentirse una persona productiva, comenta que realizando ésta actividad siempre lo tiene  presente, y desea continuar, buscando hacerlo crecer y tener mayores ganancias. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, por eso se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el plago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su grupo de su banco comunal, considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en más productos para su negocio como los helados de marca y bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas,  para tener un stock disponible para la venta, así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 52, is a hardworking, happy and charismatic woman. She is married to Marden, who is a laborer, and they have been together for many years. They have four children as the fruit of their union; the oldest three are already self-supporting. The couple lives with their youngest daughter, Janise, 21, in their own home.

Isabel has a business selling a well known brand-name ice cream and different flavors and brands of soft drinks. She has a refrigerator installed in her house that she was able to  purchase with her own earnings. She notes that there is a great demand for her products during the summer months, when she is busy waiting on her customers. 

She started this business with her husband more than four years ago with a loan from MFP and it has helped pay for part of their expenses. Her husband still helps her in his spare time. She likes her business because of the income, which pays for household expenses. Now that she has her last daughter at home, she is also able to provide her with an education as she did for her older children.

She also continues running her business not only due to the need to have an income but also in order to feel that she is a productive person. She notes that running this business always keeps her active and she wants to continue looking for ways to make it grow and earn higher profits. 

This is her 13th loan from MFP and she is pleased with the financial support that she has been receiving. Consequently she is committed to continuing to make her payments on time as she has done with previous loans. She is also pleased with her communal bank and considers its members to be responsible and supportive people. She will use all of the money she has requested, S/. 3,000, to buy more products for her business, such as brand-name ice cream and various flavors and brands of soft drinks. Thus she will the stock available to sell and be able to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase various flavors of soft drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Doña Elsa tiene 57 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.  Hace un año que doña Elsa ha puesto su propio negocio de venta de mercadería, vende ropa, zapatos, sandalias, carteras, artículos plásticos, etc. este negocio lo tiene en su casa y ya tiene sus clientes fijos. Con el préstamo que solicita por 12,000 lempiras va comprar mercadería nueva para surtir el negocio, ya que teniendo su inventario con variedad de productos va incrementar las ventas. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y se mantenga activo porque es una fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 57, is married and has two children.  She lives in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.

A year ago Elsa established her own business of selling merchandise.  She sells clothes, shoes, sandals, wallets, and plastic items, etc.  This business is in her house, and she now has fixed customers.

With the 12,000 lempira loan she is requesting she will buy new merchandise to stock the business.  Having an inventory of a variety of products will increase her sales.  Her plan is for her business to grow and stay active because it is a source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, sandals, plastic items, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Rosa, ahora tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia continua dedicándose  a la   Ganadería, principalmente a la producción y venta  de leche y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Rosa necesita producir más leche para cubrir con su demanda, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Rosa, who is now 57 years old. She is married and has six children. She lives in the district of Tambo Real, in Anta province. She still works with livestock, mainly producing and selling milk and also raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. Rosa needs to produce more milk to meet demand, which is why she will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a milk cow.

Member Rosa is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business and she is committed to paying her installments on time. She belongs to the communal bank San Bartolo de Tambo Real in the district of Tambo Real, within Anta province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Jimmy Abraham

texts.es: Jimmy estudia la carera de derecho, paga sus estudios por medio de la ayuda que le brinda sus padres, le interesa su profesión por lo que piensa trabajar en ella superarse, ayudar con los gastos básicos de la familia y deudas, dice que el programa de apoyo es muy excelente ya que ayuda a jóvenes de escasos recursos y la manera de optar al préstamo es bien fácil. Solicita el crédito para el pago del curso de titulación, último paso para culminar su carrera.
texts.en: Jimmy is studying law. He pays for his studies with the help his parents give him. He is interested in the profession because he is planning on getting ahead with it, helping with the family's basic expenses and debts. He says that the support program is excellent because it helps low income young people. In addition, it is easy to take out the loan. He is asking for the loan to pay for a graduation course, the last step to finishing his degree.

loans.use: to pay for a graduation course

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has six children. 

Alejandro provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 12 years. 

He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

Alejandro has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Alejandro hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like soft-drinks, biscuits and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Ma. Lydia

texts.en:
Ma. Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell-craft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shell-craft business.

NWTF is relisting Ma. Lydia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell-craft business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Glenda requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Glenda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
Jelma is 37 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Jelma is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a local eatery business in the Philippines. Jelma has been in this business for 2 years. Jelma requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

 In the future, Jelma would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene 47 años tiene un hija de la edad de 16 años, el tiene el oficio de artesano, el  realiza rompecabezas de venestas con motivos infantiles, los comercializa al por mayor, realiza sus entregas sobre todo en la feria de la tablada donde ya tiene clientes que le hacen su pedido cada semana, también en algunas ocasiones viaja a la ciudad de Oruro y Cochabamba le va muy bien con los viajes al interior de país,  el Sr.  Hugo vive solo, actualmente vive en anticrético, con su hermana y su sobrina, el utilizara el crédito para la compra de una material para la fabricación de rompecabezas y de esta manera optimizara su trabajo, ahora ya quiere fabricar en mayor cantidad por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene y también porque ya se acerca la época de fin de año y tiene mucha demanda de sus productos,  Su sueño más grande es darle lo mejor a su hija  ya que es por quien trabaja.
texts.en:
Hugo is 47 years old and has a daughter who is 16. He is an artisan who makes jigsaw puzzles with themes for very young children. Hugo sells them at wholesale, especially at La Tablada market where he has customers who order weekly. Also, on occasion, he travels to the cities of Oruro and Cochabamba. His trips to the interior do very well. Hugo lives alone, currently with a special rental contract [cash up front, refunded at the end], with his sister and niece.

Hugo will use the loan to buy material for making jigsaw puzzles and, in this manner, optimize his work. Now, Hugo wishes to make a larger quantity of puzzles, to fill his growing orders and, also, because the end of the year is approaching and there will be much demand for his products.

Hugo's major dream is to provide the best for his daughter, since it is for her benefit that he works.

loans.use: buy materials for making jigsaw puzzles.

loans.name: Fredy Nain

texts.es: Fredy, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara con su conyugue. Fredy trabajo varios años en una compañía privada y de sus ahorros estableció hace 6 meses su negocio de pulpería. Este negocio tiene buena ubicación y buena clientela, donde vende granos básicos, manteca, huevos, harina, azúcar, condimentos, leche, refrescos, productos de limpieza etc. el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en compra de productos para surtir la pulpería. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y en el futuro construir una casa
texts.en:
Fredy, age 31, lives with his wife in the San Marcos municipality of Santa Bárbara.

Fredy worked for several years for a private company.  He used his savings to establish a grocery store business six months ago.  This business is in a good location and has good clientele.  He sells basic grains, lard, eggs, flour, sugar, condiments, milk, soft drinks, and cleaning products, etc.

He will use the 10,000 lempira loan that he is requesting to buy products to stock his grocery store.  His plan is to make his business grow and to, in the future, build a house.

loans.use: to buy food products like basic grains, canned goods, soft drinks, and cleaning products to stock his business.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ernestina, ahora tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la  Ganadeía, en la producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt y los comercializa en los mercados y ferias de su provincia. Ernestina necesita más leche para elaborar sus productos, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar más leche.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ernestina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Ernestina quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
This member is Ernestina, who is now forty years old. She is married with two children. She lives in the district of Tambo Real in Anta province.
