She is still working as a dairy farmer, producing and selling dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt. She sells them in the different markets in her province. Ernestina needs more milk to make her products, which is why she will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of more milk.

Member Ernestina is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business and is committed to paying her installments on time. She belongs to the communal bank San Bartolo de Tambo Real in the district of Tambo Real, within Anta province in Cusco, Peru.

Ernestina wants to provide her children with a better life and an education. She makes sacrifices for them and wants to work hard and save money so that she can invest in their education.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make viand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. 

Adoracion is a responsible mother who is engaged in buying and selling vegetables in the market. She has been in her business for 20 years. She usually earns about PHP 1,500 a week. 

Adoracion wants to buy more vegetables to sell. In this regard, Adoracion is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of vegetables such as onion, garlic, tomatoes, string beans and squash to sell. With continuous patience and hard work, Adoracion's family will achieve a better way of life some day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables such as onion, garlic, tomatoes, string beans and squash to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish to resell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and blessed with three children. 

To provide sustenance for the family, she sells fruits and vegetables to people in the market. She had been doing it for over 20 years now. She is happy with the kind of business she has even though she generates only minimal income from it. She usually acquires about PHP 3,000 each month selling fruits and vegetables. 

She would like to increase her sales capacity to improve her income, but she has insufficient funds now. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy cabbages, bananas, tomatoes, squash, onions and garlic to sell. With continuous patience and hard work, Estrella's family will achieve a better way of life some day.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, bananas, tomatoes, squash, onions and garlic to sell.

loans.name: Thun's Group

texts.en:
Thun is 38 years old and has six children, five of whom are dependent on her.  Some are in school, some work for others for fees. Her family lives in a rural village of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. 

Thun has been involved in farming rice for 12 years, while her husband is a fishermen. A low crop yield is still the main challenge for her business. 

Thun is leading a loan group of three females, all of whom live in the same village. The first loan has helped Thun to better support her business. And now, Thun and her group members are applying for another loan with VisionFund. 

Thun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice with higher yield, so that she can sell the rice for higher income. Then all her children can remain in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is single and has a general store in the Philippines. She has had this business for five years and she works hard to support her family.

Emilie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Agustinus

texts.en:
Agustinus is a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He wants to work at a major port. His parents only work as farmers and their income is uncertain. While his parents' income is just enough to cover the day-to-day family needs, Agustinus has five brothers who still require school fees. 

Agustinus wants to help his parents for the betterment of the lives of his family and his five brothers and sisters. With the student loan program of Kiva, he wants to continue his studies. He is very grateful to all investors of Kiva, who will help him in his studies, although they do not know him personally.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Khusen

texts.ru:
Хусену 62 года. Он живет с женой, детьми (невестками) и внуками. У них очень большая и дружная семья. Хусен является отцом шестерых детей. Жена Хусена глава ассоциации женщин села Айвоч. 
Хусен имеет 8 лет рабочего стажа, он 8 лет проработал учителем в средней школе. Более шести лет Хусен совмещал преподавание и животноводство. Конечно, совмещать две профессии ему было нелегко, но на зарплату учителя он не мог прокормить свою семью. Хусен разводит телят и бычков у себя дома в дальнейшем для продажи. Он просит кредит для закупа несколько голов телят и двух голов бычков.
texts.en:
Khusen is 62 years old. He is a father of six and lives together with his wife, children, children-in-law, and grandchildren. Their family is large and peaceful. Khusen's wife is the head of the women's association of the Aivoch village. Khusen has been employed for the past 8 years as a high school teacher. For over six years, he has been also raising livestock. Naturally, working two jobs simultaneously has been difficult, but Khusen's teacher's salary alone is insufficient to provide for his family.

Khusen raises calves at home for subsequent sale. He is requesting this loan to purchase several male and female calves.

loans.use: to purchase several male and female calves

loans.name: Fitim

texts.en:
Fitim is a 30-year-old recently married male. He lives in a small village of Kosovo with his wife and his entire family. Fitim works as a security guard but earns a low salary. To cover the family expenses, he is also working with some family members in their agricultural business. 

Using a tractor, they cultivate and maintain the properties of others in order to generate income. Until now, the family had used one of the uncle’s tractors, which was considered common property, but as he has recently separated from them, Fitim has remained without the use of a tractor. Fitim is requesting a loan in order to purchase a tractor. With the help of this loan, he can expand the number and frequency of the work he completes; thereby, generating a larger income for his family. 

He appreciates all of Kiva's lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 69 years old and married. For the past 10 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling rice. Alicia has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans through NWTF to purchase stock to sell. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Alicia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 41-year-old married woman who has four family members. She is from Jubeiha, Amman, Jordan. 

Maram is requesting a 600 JOD loan to buy household products to resell to her friends and neighbors. In the future, she would like to expand her business project and open a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy household products to resell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 62 years old and married with eight children. For the past 10 years, she has run a general store. Delia also earns an income from raising pigs. She has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF and she works hard to provide for her family. 

Delia is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy rice grains, snack foods, and other grocery products to sell. She aspires to save enough to expand her business and do some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy rice, snack foods, and grocery products to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Miguela is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of spice to sell for her business.

Miguela has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Porm's Group

texts.en:
Porm is the 64-year-old father of five children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. 

The main source of his family’s income is rice farming, which they have done for forty years. Porm is also a village chief in a village in Sangke district, a district in Battambang province. This agribusiness earns him about KHR 36,000 per day and allows him to save about KHR 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for his rice business. 

Porm has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while his fellow female member is new to VisionFund. The past loans have helped to run his business well. 

Now he is leading a group of two to apply for a loan. Porm, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland. 

He expects that this loan will allow him to grow fruitful crops, so as to improve his family's standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 40 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming rice for three years, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bonevasius

texts.en:
The reason Bonevasius attends lectures at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara is that he would like to work in port administration in Indonesia. He comes from the village of Kapuas Hulu, in the upper Kapuas River, the largest river in Kalimantan Island, Indonesia. The local conditions and the situation of his origin motivate him to learn and aspire to be a professional employee in a harbor. 

However, Bonevasius faces difficulties in his studies because his two parents have died. During this time, he was funded by his siblings, but his siblings are now married and each has a child. The income of the siblings is not fixed because they are only laborers, and they also have to pay for their children who are still in school. Bonevasius hopes to get a loan from Kiva through the student loan program. He is very grateful to Kiva investors who are willing to help him to continue his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Olan

texts.en:
Olan is a 19-year-old student. He is living alone and away from his parents. Olan's parents live in a remote village in rural Sepauk, Sintang, Indonesia. His father works as a laborer only on a rubber plantation; his income is not fixed. The income of rubber labourers is inadequate because the price of rubber is very low at this time. His parents want their children to be in school for their future happiness. Thanks to his parents' encouragement, Olan is determined to study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, as Olan's ideal is to work at a port in Indonesia. 

Due to the economic conditions of his parents, who are not permanent workers, Olan volunteered to seek a student loan from Kiva in order to relieve the burden on his parents and continue his studies. Olan is very grateful to the lenders from around the world, who would help him in his studies, although he does not personally know them.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза родилась 1991 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она студентка 4-го курса Технологического Университета. Она учится на договорной основе по специальности Международный менеджмент. В этом году ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебу. Шахноза запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1991. She is single and lives with her parents. Shahnoza is a 4th-year student at the Technological University, where she studies International Management. Unfortunately, this year her parents are unable to pay for her education, and so Shahnoza is requesting a loan to cover her university tuition. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa además de ser amable y solidaria. Es conviviente con Aurelio quien es obrero de construcción civil, y fruto de esa unión tiene 03 hijos a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan cómodamente  su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Gladis es la confección y venta de ropas interiores de damas y caballeros, para lo cual cuenta con una maquina que compró con sus ahorros y aprendiendo por cuenta propia viendo a sus amistades y ayudándolas. También vende comidas tanto desayunos como almuerzos en el frontis de su casa.
Iniciándose hace más de 21 años en la costura, 3 años en la venta de comidas, confeccionando primero para sus familiares y vecinos, ahora ha logrado hacer crecer sus clientes gracias a sus buenos trabajos, contando con la ayuda de su hermana quien también está aprendiendo éste oficio de costura.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio ya que puede contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta el cansancio físico que le ocasiona estar en una misma postura, pero aun así desea continuar trabajando y ampliar su negocio confeccionando faldas y blusas para surtir su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por  otro lado comenta estar cómoda con el grupo de su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para costura como telas, blondas elásticas y otros, los cuales los traerá desde la capital buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Gladis, 52 years old, is a hardworking woman who is also caring and friendly. She lives with her partner, Aurelio, who is a civil construction worker and they have three children as the fruit of their union whom they love greatly. Together they live comfortably in their own home.

Gladis has a business making and selling underwear for ladies and gentlemen. She has a machine that she bought with her savings and learned to sew on her own by watching her friends and helping them. She also sells meals, breakfasts as well as lunches, in front of her house. She started sewing more than 21 years and selling food three years ago. She sewed first for her relatives and neighbors but has now succeeded in expanding her customer base thanks to her fine work. She relies on help from her sister, who is also learning the skills of a seamstress.

She feels her business is successful because of the good profit it generates. She likes her business because she can count on an income to help her husband with household expenses. On the other hand, she does not enjoy the physical fatigue she endures from maintaining the same posture, however she still wants to continue working and expanding her business by making skirts and blouses to stock her inventory.

This is her eleventh loan from MFP and she is counting on their collaboration in order to continue meeting her goals. She is also comfortable with her communal bank and considers its members to be responsible and supportive people. With the S/. 3,000 sum requested, she will purchase sewing supplies, such as fabric, elastic lace and other items, which she will bring from the capital, seeking the lowest prices by making high-volume purchases.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, elastic lace and other items.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez is 36 years old and married with two children. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a restaurant. Mercedez has borrowed and repaid three previous loans through NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Mercedez is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Reorita

texts.en:
Reorita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Reorita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Reorita would like to expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.ru:
Исомиддин уже несколько лет сотрудничает с нашей организацией. Он ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Исомиддин считает, что наши условия кредитования более приемлемы для него. Получив кредит он смог получить хорошую прибыль и улучшить свое финансовое положение, также он увеличил поголовья скота. Крупнорогатый скот, который у него имеется - это его богатство. 
Исомиддин на протяжении пяти лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном занимается купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. У него имеется дехканское хозяйство, где он посеял холопок. 
Исомиддин просит кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Isomiddin has been a client of MLO Humo & Partners for several years. He is a responsible and purposeful person. Isomiddin finds that MLO Humo's lending terms are quite acceptable. After receiving his previous loan, he was able to make higher profits and improve his financial situation, as well as increase the size of his herd. Isomiddin's cattle is his treasure.

Isomiddin has been raising livestock for the past five years, mainly buying and selling cattle. Additionally, he is engaged in agriculture on his farm where he has planted cotton. He is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Jenny Jannet

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 27 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo, con el cual tiene 2 niñas, de 6 años y la segunda de 6 meses, es una madre muy amorosa y sobre todo luchadora, ya que su primera niña nació que una discapacidad y debido a ello no pudo terminar de estudiar y se dedico de manera integra a su cuidado debido a su condición, por ello ella se esfuerza mucho junto a su esposo para poder darle a sus hijas una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura y también por su clima cálido y acogedor. 

Con mucho entusiasmo día a día Jenny atiende su pequeño negocio de venta d abarrotes, con el cual puede apoyar a su esposo con los gatos del hogar y los gastos de atención de su pequeña, diariamente puede llegar a atender hasta 20 clientes y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jenny está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, entre otros; así de esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y también mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” poder darle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijas y llegar a tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Jenny is 27 years old and lives with her husband. They have two daughters, one six years old and the other six months old. She is a loving mother who fights for her children. Her elder daughter was born with a disability, so she was unable to finish her studies and instead took care of her daughter. She and her husband work hard to give their daughters a good life that is full of love. Her house is in Ica, an agricultural city with a warm, pleasant climate.

Every day Jenny puts a lot of enthusiasm into her little grocery shop, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses and the cost of their daughter's health care. She gets up to 20 customers a day, and she thinks her business is going well because she's friendly with the customers and really wants to make it work.

Jenny is very grateful to Kiva's lenders, who have helped her buy merchandise for her business, including rice, sugar, pasta, jam, and other products that have allowed her to offer her customers a wider variety and to increase her earnings. That way, she can keep working every day to make her biggest dream—“to be able to give my daughters a better life and education and eventually open a minimarket”—come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, pasta, jam, etc.).

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia es la señora María Cleofe, ahora tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   ganadería, crianza de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes y ovejas, pero también se dedica a la agricultura, sembrado productos como papa, maíz y trigo según sea la estación. María Cleofe está solicitando el préstamo para comprar alimento como pastos, forraje, alfalfa etc. para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. María Cleofe pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
María Cleofe quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en: María Cleofe is now 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Tambo Real in the province of Anta. She raises smaller animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and sheep, and also grows crops such as potatoes, corn, and wheat, depending on the season. María Cleofe is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals, including grass, hay, alfalfa, and so on. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments on time. María Cleofe belongs to the San Bartolo de Tambo Real village bank in Tambo Real, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru.She wants to offer her children a better life and education. She makes sacrifices for them and hopes to work hard and save money to pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, including grass, hay, alfalfa, and so on.

loans.name: Yanet Azucena

texts.es:
Yanet es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente desde hace varios años Yanet se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la orilla de un río cercano a su hogar y  en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Yanet puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende frituras, tales como: hamburguesas, alitas broaster, salchipapas, pollo broaster, entre otras; todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Yanet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ella desea poder tarrajear, pintar y hacer pequeñas refacciones; de esta manera Yanet tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones, brindando mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio y lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en: Yanet is 36 years old. She lives in the city of Camaná with her three children, who are the most important thing in her life. Unfortunately, Yanet and her partner split up a few years ago. Since then, she's done everything she can to improve her family's situation. She is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic. In her free time, she likes to walk along the riverbank near her home and sometimes cooks a delicious lomo saltado (a Peruvian dish with steak and vegetables) for her family.With a lot of effort and her parents' help, Yanet has started a small business selling food. She sells fast foods such as hamburgers, chicken wings, hot dogs with potatoes, roasted chicken, and so on, starting very early every morning. She works about 12 hours a day and thinks her business is going well because of her hard work and friendly attitude with her customers.Yanet is very grateful for Kiva's lenders, who have helped her improve her home. She wants to plaster and paint her home and do some repairs so it will be in better shape and safer for her family. She will keep working and making an effort to gradually expand her business and achieve her greatest dream: seeing her children get good jobs and become upstanding men.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia Periférica de San Pedro Sula junto a sus 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad. Karla es muy trabajadora y en busca de obtener ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos decidió hace dos años vender mercadería como ropa interior, blusas, pantalones, bisuterías, monederos, y otros que le soliciten. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa por pedidos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar más mercadería que le han pedido sus clientes, así poder incrementar los ingresos. Su plan es continuar trabajando con ODEF y mantener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en: Karla is a 31 year-old single mother.  She lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula along with her 2 children aged 2 and 4.  Karla is a very hardworking person, and she is seeking a way to earn income to support her children.  Two years ago, she decided to sell merchandise such as underwear, blouses, pants, accessories, wallets and other items that her customers request.  She sells from place to place, and she also takes orders in her home.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Honduran lempiras so that she can buy more merchandise that her customers have asked for.  This way she will be able to increase her income.  She plans to continue working with OFEF and to maintain a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, pants, handbags, wallets, and accessories to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ana María, ahora tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt y los comercializa en los mercados y ferias de su provincia. Ana María necesita más leche para elaborar sus productos, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ana María pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Ana María quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en: Ana María is now 33 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Tambo Real, in the province of Anta, whre she produces and dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt and sells them in the markets and shops in the region. Ana María needs more milk to make her products, so she will use the requested loan to buy a milk cow. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments on time. Ana María belongs to the San Bartolo de Tambo Real village bank in Tambo Real, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru. Ana María wants to offer her children a better life and education. She makes sacrifices for them and hopes to work hard and save money to pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
This is Evelina, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, a taxi driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelina oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, her regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Evelina dreams to be successful in life and hopes to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their pedicab unit

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aleja, ahora tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se dedica a la   agricultura, principalmente a la producción y venta de papa, trigo habas y quinua, además de esto, ella también se dedica a la a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes.
Aleja invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar alimento como afrecho, forraje y chala para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Aleja pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Aleja is now 37 years old. She is the single mother of two children. She lives in Tambo Real in the province of Anta. She raises crops, mainly potatoes, wheat, beans, and quinoa. She also raises small farm animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. Aleja will use the requested loan to buy feed for her animals, including mash, corn husks, and fodder. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments in full. Aleja belongs to the San Bartolo de Tambo Real village bank in Tambo Real, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, including mash, corn husks, and fodder.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
This is Pilar, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bartolome, her business partner, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, Pilar manages her household while operating her food stall. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and prepared food costs less than raw food. Pilar's regular customers are neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP each day. 

Pilar is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  Pilar dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. Pilar faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.


Ingredients

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Walter, el ahora tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, Walter continua con su actividad económica principal que es la ganadería, pero también trabaja operando maquinaria pesada. Walter trabaja hace muchos años en esta actividad y es con esta que saca adelante a toda su familia.
Walter necesita mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, por ello invertirá su préstamo en la ampliación y mejoramiento de su fundo y su establo, para ello debe comprar materiales de construcción como madera y cemento, 
Walter está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a mantenerse y desarrollarse en sus actividades y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Walter pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Walter quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
Walter, 44, is married and has two children. He lives in the Tambo Real District, Anta Province. He is continuing with his main job, which is ranching, but he also works operating heavy machinery. He has done with work for several years and this is how he is moving his family forward. Walter needs to improve his barn infrastructure, so he will invest the loan in enlarging and improving his farm and his barn. For this he needs to buy construction materials like wood and cement.

Walter is very thankful to Kiva for helping him to stay engaged and growing in his work and he promises to make his payments on time. Walter belongs to the communal bank San Bartolo de Tambo Real, in the Tambo Real District, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru. He wants to provide a better life and education for his children, and he sacrifices for them. This is why he hopes to work a lot and save to invest in their education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and runs a general store in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past ten years and works hard to support her family. 

Salvacion is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as shampoo, sugar, soft-drinks, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, sugar, soft-drinks, and other items

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 29 years old married with five children, three of whom who are in school. For the past four years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie has borrowed three previous times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Margie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
Amia is a 55-year-old married woman with six children. For the past two years, she has been operating a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. Amia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

Amia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, bush knives, weed killer and spray, baby taros, a crow bar, and a chain saw. With her profits, she hopes to improve her business and help her family's living situation and provide for her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, seedlings, and tools

loans.name: Munhnasan

texts.en:
Munhnasan lives with her husband and two children in an old house, in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Bathuyag.  He has found a new job and now works for a mining industry company. 

Munhnasan started her own sewing service business in 2004, so she now has eight years' experience in sewing service. Her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. The local residents describe her as an honest woman. 

Last year she bought old house, and she would now like to repair her house and to install new heating. Therefore she needs a 500,000 MNT loan to buy  a heating system and other construction materials to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To purchase heating and other construction materials to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Abinery

texts.en:
Abinery is 32 years old.  He is married to Ruth, a business lady. Together they have two children.

He operates a motorcycle transport business, and he has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his second term loan in KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer.  He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

He will use the loan amount to purchase his motorcycle spare parts and also to service the motorcycle.  He hopes to purchase a chain of motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Olevia

texts.en:
Olevia  is 19 years old and married, with one child. 

She wants to start a small  baking business, making and selling donuts, German buns, and biscuits in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, yeast, baking pans, oil, baking powder, and a new cooking oven set. 

In the future, Olevia hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kid educations. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, yeast, baking soda, and a new cooking oven..
